text: I didnt get much of the vanilla notes. It does have the expected banana and clove taste however it was a tad bit too fruity for my liking. The style is pretty spot on though and its a good overall hefeweizen but its not the best hefeweizen I have had.
Bottle from Just Tappd. Cloudy yellow medium bodied with thick white head. Banana and yeast nose, with spicy clove and wheat taste.
Clear golden with white head. Wheat with a spicy belgian yeasty touch with some banana. Not really for me... Maybe need to try it again in the future.

Lekker fruitig wit bier, ongecompliceerde alleman vriend, voor witbier liefhebbers een aanrader.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mistig, bleek, goudgeel bier. Geen kraag. Bitter, licht zoet en licht zuur. Peper, citroen, honing. Redelijk co2. Fris.

500ml bottle from Pintas in Moscow. Pours bright, hazy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, yeast. Taste is similar, bit of vanilla too, slightly sour, slightly bitter. Very decent.
Una buona weisse colore perfetto e schiuma persistente. Al naso punta acidula, lievito e agrumi. Al palato dolce con punta fruttata.

50cl bootle at huize Kwast in Leeuwarden. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a big white head. Aroma of yeast, malt, citrus, cloves, slight vanilla, nutmeg. Taste is medium sweet, soft bitter with a soft dry finish. Notes of yeast, spices, malt. Texture is oily, light to medium bodied woth moderate carbonation

As the description states, this beer does have a long-lasting fluffy white head. I detect no vanilla or fruit in the aroma, instead spicy. Like most things, it tastes like it smells - spicy. However, as far as "spicy" goes, it doesnt overpower, and doesnt linger with aftertaste. And in fact, though I dont prefer spicy beers, this wasnt bad at all. If I had to choose a spicy beer to drink I would probably select this one.
Honiggelb mit feiner Schaumkrone. Vollmundig cremiger Antrunk. Zitrone und Banane schmeckbar!
Light gold and lemon-colored with a thick, meringue head. Ripe banana, cloves, and spicy nose. Lightly-carbonated, mild, and somewhat sticky with bittersweet lemon and pepper in the finish.

Hazed golden with a white head. Eatery clove banana and clove character. 

Notes: bottle at Lees tequila and beer experience
Amarillento turbio espuma blanca. Cereales trigo suave ligeros afrutados platano algo de cítrico al final. Cuerpo fino con algo de gas y espumoso. Buena refrescante.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy light yellow gold with many small bubbles cascading to a large pillowy white head. Fresh lemony wheat malt aroma. Sweet honeyish wheat malt flavor has notes of lemon, banana and hay. Complex and flavorful, with a sweet vanilla finish. Very good and really refreshing.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color with a white head. Aroma and taste of fruit, bananas, caramel and spices.
Botella @IXCata Ratebeer Asturias, 10/04/17. BBD:10/17. Color amarillo turbio, corona de espuma blanca, aromas a levadura notas a plátano, sabor levadura, toques especiados, banana cuerpo medio.

50cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma is wheat, banana, fruits, spices, bread.
Taste is banana, wheat, spices, citrus, peach.
Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Pale opaque honey. Tall white staying head. Spice, banana, phenols on nose. Similar taste. Light to medium body. Low bitterness. A noble beer. Still not among my favourites.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
On tap at Biercab. Hazy yellow colour with white head. Wheat and spices aroma. Sweet, wheat, citric, fruit, bubble gum taste. Medium body.
Perfect example of the style! Lemon and spice flavor comes from yeast...as it should be. Nicely cloudy per the style.

Tap at the Ayingers Speis and Trank, 27th March 17. Pours a hazy straw colour, great white head that stays with you. Aroma is lemon, yeast, banana, spice. Taste is banana, citrus, yeast, spice, smooth, refreshing and Interesting
Plátano, vainilla, toque fresco cítrico y balsámico. Ligera y elegante en boca con final seco.
Keg at the beerhall. Pours hazy yellow orange, nose is banana and cream, toffee, taste is sweet, banana milkshake, wheat, toffee.
Foamy golden pour out of bottle. Malty cereal notes of hay and grass and yeast. On the palate smooth and supple and well made. Nothing spectacular but this goes down like silk. Balance is impeccable.
Pours a pale cloudy yellow with a white lacing. Aroma is banana, some clove. Mildly sweet
UPDATED: MAR 8, 2017 on tap pours a hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is of spice with banana in the back. Taste follows the nose.

Bottle from SinH4. Many thanks!
Pours a nice, murky orange with a big white head. Aroma is dominated by a play between fruit (banana and orange) and perfume-y floral notes. Distinct wheat notes, a bit grainy, with vanilla and cloves. Taste is medium sweet, slightly tart, lightly bitter. Very refreshing. Creamy, medium body with lively but soft carbonation. 
A very refreshing Hefeweizen. Nice and clean, definitely high quality stuff. Not watery, with the distinct something in the play of aroma and taste. GREAT mouthfeel.

Its my five year anniversary for joining RateBeer, so I thought to celebrate this great feat by having a style I rarely rate. In five years, Ive come around to really appreciate all styles for what they are, rather than focus on my original love of IPAs and Stouts. Ive come a long way. 

Anyway. Aroma is clove, wheat, banana, fruity, slight hop, eh. Appearance is golden, hazy, white head. Taste is wheat, fruity, slight banana and clove, earthy hop, good. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, wheat and hop aftertaste. Overall, I was expecting this to be not great by the aroma, but the banana and clove are dialed back to let the wheat shine in this. Well done for a style I typically avoid.

on [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */; unripe banana accompanied by traces of nutmeg and cloves on a yoghurtlike undercurrent of refreshing almost-tartness; quite a dry finish; flawless and totally balanced.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2017 Pours a hazy yellow with a medium sized head. Aroma is of spice with banana in the back. Taste follows the nose. Overall this is a good beer I just wish the banana flavor came out a bit more.
Boca 0,5L- ravno iz obećane zemlje...odlično pivo, mala zamjerka ide mirisu ali zato je okusom odlično, nevjerovatno pitko, usklađeno, ima sve to jedan hefe-weizen mora imati...

How: Bottle.
Where: NK bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy yellow colour with a white head.
Aroma: Banana, wheat, fruit, bread.
Body: Medium body, high carbonation.
Flavour: Banana, wheat, bread.

Bottle in Seattle. Proper German bottle gifted by SinH4 when he came in to town this week. Thick foam pour, lovely, perfectly hazed lemon gold. Delicious, complex banana and fresh fruit, almost tropical, nose. Some baking dough as well, from nose straight through to sip. Pale banana flavors, but with a lovely spicy carbonation. Does give a champagne impression, with a rounder fresh fruit base. Adding the yeast swirl mellows the flavors some, with some increased depth as well. Full and balanced mouthfeel. Quintessential.

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours cloudy orange with a big, fluffy, white head and lacing. The aroma is banana, spice, and bread. The taste is banana, spice, bread, lemon, and orange peel. Its very smooth but also has nice carbonation. It tastes really fresh. This is a great beer and the best of the style Ive ever had.

Ar: Restrained lemon and floral aromas; lean banana on the background. Ap: Straw yellow with some golden highlights at the thickets point in the glass; big white head with great retention, leaving a solid, stiff cap of foam with chunks of lacing left on the side of the glass; cloudy. T: Moderate banana and fresh, doughy wheat malt; soft sweetness with touches of spicy, floral hops; a bit of banana and peach on the finish with a clean bitterness and lemony tartness. P: Medium, creamy body with high carbonation; finish is quite dry. O: Very nice German hefeweizen, one of the most refreshing of the great style examples, owing to the lemon notes and very pale, brisk malt profile.

Schaum: gut, beständig
FARBE: trübgelb ein bisschrn ins blässliche
Nase: hefe, ein bisschen richtung banane aber eigentlich eher wie saubere erde und weizen.
Geschmack: im Mund für ein Weizen eher leicht, eher Richtung Säure, im Abgang kommt dann die Hefe raus es wird runder, Geschmack geht richtung erde und Weizen. Wie in der Nase, ein hauch banane ist dabei. Im Nachgeschmack mild nach Weizen. Naja ein bisschen leicht und unauffällig um nicht zu sagen langweilig. Positiv könnte mans ausgewogen nennen.
Draft at Lizard! Hazy, straw like in color. Not very aromatic,. Taste wonderful with bananas. This does have carbonation like champagne. Smooth on the palate. Overall this is just a wonderful beer!
Flesje gedronken tijdens ijsfestijn. Goudgeel troebel bier met stevig schuim. Weinig aroma. Smaak is licht bitter en fruitig. Bittere nasmaak.

7. 12. 2016, Ljubljana. Bottled. Fine murky golden colour with punchy taste and little aftertaste. Bananas are present.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deffinetely notes of vanilla and Bannana a light golden color that looks beautiful when poured highly rated beer but thats where the magic stops. In reality the Bräuweisse does not live up to its presentation and aroma in taste it is rather bland and me being someone who loves a good Hefeweizen this beer did not hold its own. To be honest it leaves a rather disgusting aftertaste and I didnt even have a desire to finish it. To put it in perspective Sam Adams Hefeweizen tastes better than this beer.
Отлично& пиво, красивы& цвет, хороший аромат и вкус, приятно& послевк& Годен до 06.2017. (Bottle 0,5/ 5,1%)
Citromos WC-öblítő aroma, nagyon halovány színvilág (borsodi búzás), nem igazán tudnám megkülönböztetni egy lidl-ös vagy penny-s búzától. Talán azért mert nem is lehet.
500 ml bottle. Poured golden, cloudy, large lasting white head. Aroma of banana, clove, yeast and citrus. Taste was sweet, banana, creamy, spices.
A mne ne ponravilos. Metallicheski vkus. Vtoruju butylku, da zaberi takie dengi brat ne budu.
Bottle at fest, hazy light amber beer, white skiff of foam.aroma is malt, banana. Taste is banana, malt. Palate is average, as is carb.

Great scents of yeast, wheat and lemon. Pours cloudy gold with a thin white head with tiny bubbles. Great astringent crisp weiss tastes. Fizzy balanced carbonation and a clean mouthfeel. Very fresh and light. I like it very much.

Lemon and orange rind,banana and vanilla, musty wheat, and some clove in the aromas. Taste is lemon zest and orange peel, vanilla and wheat, then banana esters and cloves. A bubblegum after taste with a dry Champagne.

Beer on tap, served in Weizen. Pours hazy golden, slightly orange, with big white head. Both aroma and taste are banana, yeast and vanilla. Sounds simple, but its really delicious. Hoppy notes on the aftertaste (decent proportion for a Weissbier). Medium body, perfect carbonation. To summarize, this beer is so harmonic and incredibly easy to drink. The best Hefeweizen Ive ever had so far, I highly doubt I can find another one as good as this stuff.

Aroma: vanilla and cloves.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: zesty, cloves, vanilla, weak banana notes, quite dry.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Really nice weizen, drinkable and zesty.

At the nose, notes of Very mature banana, lime zest, crumbs. In mouth is light bodied, very drinkable. A enjoyable sweetness from malts, in the edges of the tongue hints of mandarin. The after taste is a long and a embracing sweetness. Very balanced and well made beer  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

0,5l bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with huge white head. Aroma is bread, banana and vanilla, some citrus and clove. Taste is similar, wheat, bananas, yeast, hints of clove and almond, some pepper, its slightly sour. Body is light with lively carbonation, low bitterness. Very nice hefe, balanced and very drinkable.

Tap at Ayinger Bräustüberl. Ah, another great Weizen from Bavaria. Has everything a beer of this style needs. Balance works, a bit on the sweet side for a Hefeweizen. Crisp. IYAM the Urweisse works a tad better, but this one is not bad either.
Poured from a bottle into a Weizen glass. Notes of lemon and banana in the aroma. Pale orange, almost yellow color with a big white head. Hazy. No lacing. Medium body, sweet, creamy.

Out of the bottle, poured a medium yellow, cloudy/unfiltered, with a pillowy white persistent head. Characteristic notes of clove and banana, along with tart lemon, vanilla bean, and sweet shredded wheat cereal. Refreshing with great carbonation. Good example of the style.

[backlog] 24-08-15 / bottle at home. Excellent Hefe. Fresh and crisp. Yeasty, some ditrus. Fruity spicyness. Some herbs. Nice complex. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 4/5
On tap at growler guys meridian. Pours out a hazy gold topped with a white head. Nose is banana spice clove citrus and a nice wheat. Taste is more of the nice banana bread spice and a great end.
#843Tap. Hazy light yellow body, high white head. Aroma of low intensity: wheat, touch of bananas. Taste is sour to dry. Wheat, spicy notes. Light body, medium carbonation. An average weizen.

500mL bottle. Pours a hazy, pale gold with a large foamy white head. Light aroma of banana, wheat, yeast, and clove. Taste is initially sweet, fruity, and spicy with a blend of banana, wheat, yeast, and a little vanilla. Finishes dry, with a light bitterness. Light body. Lively carbonation. Mouthfeel is crisp, but not outstanding.

Draught at Ayingers, Munich. Hazy, pale gold colored. AROMA- wheat, honey, touch of bananas. FLAVOR- neutral to slightly dry, lightly sour, a bit bitter, wheat, slight banana note. Medium bodied. Clean, but not so tasty weissbier.
Hazy yellow beer with nice white head. Sour sweet banana aroma. Taste is very refreshing, mild sweet banana, herbs. Nicely balanced and suprisingly good beer.

From a bottle. Cloudy yellow golden body with a very good off white head. 
Banana dominates both the aroma and the flavor but its also nicely bready.
Medium-light body with medium+ carbonation.
Sweet up front fading to lightly bitter by the aftertaste.

Bottled.

Aroma: banana, fruity, wheat
Appearance: Cloudy yellow with a white head
Taste: Very balanced, on the sweet side. Yeast.

Overall: One of the best German Hefeweizen one can drink.

Samea, vaaleankeltainen olut runsaalla valkoisella ja pitsiä jättävällä vaahdolla. Todella kaunis olut. Tuoksu banaaninen ja vehnäinen. Maku vehäisen banaaninen ja sitruksinen, raikkaan hiilihappoinen ja lopussa hieman mausteisuutta kielen päällä kutittelemassa. Oikein raikas kesäinen laatuvehnis.
Bottled. Old note. The aroma has light cloves, banana, some honey. Hazy, yellow coloured beer with a big foamy head. The taste is light bitter and sweet and has grain, banana, spice. Nice.

On-tap at Trattoria Calabrese, Garmisch. Cloudy orange golden with a huge white head. Aroma is nice, fruity esters, banana and clove. Sweet, fruity, yeasty, spicy, flavors of banana, bread, clove, citrus, light tart notes, finish is dry and clean. Light-medium bodied. Very good Weizen.
Very well brewed and robust hefeweizen with all classic flavors of banana and yeast in there accompanied by some vanilla and lemon flavors.

On tap. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma has the classic hefeweizen yeast esters, fresh and floral. Taste starts with sweet wheat malt and banana flavor. Finish is more balanced with some hop bitterness. Medium body with high effervescence. Overall this is a really well made, classic hefeweizen.
Fantastic. Every hefe should strive to be like this. The palate is refreshed while drinking this. Definitely a top 5 hefe

Bottle at home on a hot day. Perfectly chilled. Pours Cloudy Yellow with a White head. Lovely full flavour. Thick and wheaty. Typical Hefe character with Banana and clove. Lovely consistency. After havinf The Schneider Festweisse during the week and now this, Hefeweizens are firmly back at the forefront of my mind.

Lichtgeel bier met veel schuim. Smaak is licht friszuur met iets van citrus, helaas iets te zoet om een echte topper te zijn. Degelijke Weizen dat zeker !
Gedronken bij de Roovertsche Leij op het terras in de zon.

Pours hazy yellow with low thick long lasting head. Aroma is fruits, yeast, freshness, banana, light flour. Taste is flour, fruits, sweet berries, strawberry, banana, yeast, some sweet candies. Very good hefeweizen!
Tap. Pours hazy straw yellow. Aroma of clove, banana, lemon and herb. Herby flavour with some fruitiness and yeast. Nice.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color with thick white head. Aroma has banana, yeast, honing. Taste is malty with long aftertaste. Flavors of banana, honing, yeast. Well balanced and tasty.
Ottima birra. Aspetto e palato di alto livello. Forse un po leggero laroma di banana che dovrebbe avere ogni weiss, ma il corpo della birra è veramente pieno. Merita un assaggio.

500ml bottle. Poured a very fizzy large size head. Has a slightly hazy yellowish appearance. Has a yeasty aroma, fairly strong. Flavours are citrusy with hint of banana, and bready type taste. Very tangy I find for a wheat ale for mouthfeel. Somewhat bitter aftertaste, sort of sour/spicy. Carbonation is pretty active, some tingling on the palate. Still good, but not really for me.

Une superbe blanche à la robe or pâle, à la mousse présente, au nez puissant et complexe, et à la bouche qui allie ampleur, fruit, fraîcheur, fine bulle et finale acidulée. Tout ce que lon attend dune blanche. Un régal absolu.

bleek geel/gouden met prikkelende witte kraag. Aroma van citrus, tarwe, graan, gist,mout. Smaken zijn redelijk zoet, citrus, fris, limoen, mout, iets weeïg zoet, citrus, biscuitjes, lichte banaan, redelijke mondvullende co2, medium body, iets droog in de afdronk. niets over de top gewoon oerdegelijke/redelijke hefeweizen, verder ook niet exceptioneel goed.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2016 Gelbgold-trÃ¼b, Aroma nach Banane, Malz, leicht sÃ¼Ãlich, mittlerer KÃ¶rper, leicht Ã¶lig, perlende KohlensÃ¤ure, Geschmack nach Banane und exotischen FrÃ¼chten
Tap @ Jagersrust. Troebel goudgeel, mooie plakkraag. Ruikt gistig, banaan, kruidnagel. Smaakt idem, met een wijnbalsmaakje erbij. Vrij zurig en waterig ook. Niet echt mijn bierstijl.
Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a thin white head. Nice wheat aroma. Crisp taste with a hint of cloves. Typical classic style Hefeweizen. Very refreshing and enjyable.

Lemon, banana, looks like the color reflects the flavours.
The dryness, high carbonation and low ABV make it very refreshing and drinkable, but maybe the general taste its a bit too gentle for me.

Festői búzasör szalmasárga színben, mely teltséget sugároz, illatai pedig haraphatóvá teszik a levegőt, vaníliás, enyhén banános, kissé fanyar és citromos aromákat árasztanak. Maga a műfaj bár nem tartogat mérhetetlen izgalmakat, a jól sikerült alkotások mennyei mannaként szolgálhatnak a melegebb idő beköszöntével. S mivel ez esetben igencsak jól összerakott italról van szó, valóban remek élményt nyújtanak egyszerre frissítő és telt kortyai, melyek jólesően savanykásak, mélyek és gazdagok, krémes gabonaturmixot idézőek.

Flasche 0,5l: Goldgelb, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger stabiler feinporiger Schaum; frische, fruchtige Nase, leichte Süße, Malz, Getreide, kräftige Hefearomen, Banane, Brotteig; im Körper mild, leichte Süße, Getreide, kräftige Hefearomen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte Säure, grüne Bananen, trockener werdend; angenehmer eher trockener Nachgang

Bottle from BevMo! in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is vanilla, almonds, cloves, fruit, spiced breads, banana bread, some floral. Taste is creamy, one of the few vanilla / almondy beers that tastes balanced to me. Lots of different floral, spiced breads but smooths out in the finish. Maybe my favorite Hefeweizen thus far.
Yeaty aroma, spicy & cloves. Grainy sweetness in aroma, too. Straw/plae yellow and opaque. Big white head. Cloves dominate the flavor, with bready, grainy sweetness too.
330ml Flasche. Trüb und orangefarben mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Fruchtiges Aroma. Hefig.

0.33l bottle. Hazy yellow body, white head. Aroma of bread, banana, cloves and toffee. Taste of banana, bread, lemon zest, peach and some floral hops. Very nice weizen, but to be honest based on how highly its rated, I expected a bit more.

Bottle. Pale yellow color, hazy liquid, white head. Brutal carbonation. Aroma of yeast, some tones of roasted malt (even if not present), lemon acid sourness. Quite bitter for hefeweizen. Quite good, even thou this is not my favorite style.

The beer has a typical weizen bier apesrence. The color of the beer is a light yellow, wit an light almost greenish tiny. The beer has a massive cloudiness. Its definitely unfiltered. The beer pours a nice soft layer of white foam. The foam collapses slowly over time, to leave a nice drape of foam. The smell and flavor are typical weizener like. They are pretty much the same. There are lovely aromas of loris Der and lemon zest and other tropical citrus fruits. I can also clearly distinguish the alcohol, which gives a almondy touch to the beer. The balance is nice. Sweets, bitters and sours balance each other out quite nicely. Its a proper weizener, I like it. Its very easy to drink and really leaves you longing for another beer.

Flasche - trübgelbe Farbe, dicker, cremiger Schaum. Geruch sehr bananig, im Geschmack eher mineralisch-frisch. Gut ausbalanciert. Ein sehr gutes Hefeweizen ohne große Ausschläge in irgendeine geschmackliche Richtung. Im Abgang eher trocken. Kaum süßlich.

toast, bread, caramel, herbs, dough, banana, vanilla, clove, some gentle pepper. When it gets warmer however, sadly becomes a clove soup. 
pale, hazy, white foam, frothy.
light sweetness, lightly bitter, same taste notes as in aroma. 
light-medium body, slick feel, lively, long smooth slightly sweet finish.
 Overall a good wheat, nicely balanced untill it warms up a bit more.
Probably the best beer i tasted already, all the flavours from the start to the end pleassed me. Im not a fan of wheat beers and even tasted many, but this is fantastic
Hazy bright yellow with medium white head. Aroma is bubblegum, light fruit. Taste is mostly sour and and medium fresh. Not as smooth. But overall ok.

Maybe one of my first hefeweizens. Really good. Same maker makes the best dopplebock

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy straw-golden pour with white ring of foam. Aroma is banana and lemon. Flavor is delicious with banana, bread, bubblegum, and just a mild touch of sour lemon. Rather carbonated, so the mouthfeel isnt as smooth as it could be. Tasty example of this classic style though.
Bottle at Beer Ditch. Hazy golden, large white head. Banana, wheaty, some phenols, plenty of bananas. Medium body, medium to high carbonation. Semi dry low bitterness.

It pours a cloudy yellow color with a white head. There are aromas of banana, vanilla, wheat, and lemon. There are flavors of banana and lemon with plenty of wheat flavor. There is a sweet character to it which has hints of citrus flavors. It has a mostly light feel to it.

At Maakuns. Bottle shared. Hazy pale golden with foamy white head. Grainy, fruity, banana, lemon, chalk, light salt, minerals, sugar replacement. Under medium sweet, light bitter, 1 grain of salt and a drop of lemon juice. Under medium body, feels slick and minerallike as well. Mealy feel. Quite dry. Medium carbonation.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Cloudy straw with big white head that leaves a thin film. Quite fruity with peach and banana, dough, lemon, dry flour, miso. Light sweet and even lighter bitterness, quite light in the taste overall. Under medium bodied with slightly dry feel and quite some carbonation.
21-Apr-2016-0,5L Flasche. Hellgelb, naturtrüb, weisser stabiler Schaum. Aroma: Hefe, Getreide. Antrunk. Getreide, banane, ordentliche Rezens. Fein.

Originally rated on 8/31/08. Rather dark and cloudy for a hefe, brau- weisse none the less is a pretty decent beer. The head is small and disapates quickly. Aroma of banana but not overwhelming as described above. Mouthfeel is decent and it has a crisp finish, flavors of wheat and nicely balanced spices. Not my favorite hefe but pretty good and its worth a try.

Color giallo pallido, opalescente, con un cappello di schiuma bianca abbondante, molto fine e dalla lunga persistenza. Al naso tipici sentori di banana e di fieno, lievissimo metallico. Corpo leggero e carbonazione spinta ma che si spegne subito.Al palato note acidule fin da subito, lieve fruttato e finale leggermente erbaceo.

In bottiglia. Colore giallo pesca opalescente torbido. Schiuma fragile e frizzante, di rapida dissolvenza. Buon naso di lievito, banana, spezie e vaniglia. Carbonazione flat, piacevolmente solleticante. Aroma solido, ottimamente fruttato di banana, leggera albicocca, percezione di mela e di pera, spezie, note di vaniglia e biscotto. Efficace doppia maltatura di orzo e frumento. Gusto dolce maltato, sapido e succoso, poi appena increspato con morbidissima luppolatura, sufficientemente solida, nello stile. Corpo leggero, trama da succosa a oleosa, abbastanza spessa e concreta, piena senza vuoti acquosi. Una delle migliori e più ricche weizen bevute.

50cl bottle. Pale yellow pour, hazy, with a tall white head that gives way to a sticky lacing. Smells like bananas, white bread, yeast and honey. Sweet taste, with notes of bananas, oranges, yeast and honey.

Good looking hazy yellow/orange with creamy big head. Strong but soft carbonation. Aroma is citrus, yeast, bread, clove and a bit of banana. Fresh overall. Taste is moderatly sweet with notes of grains. Gets a bit dry like banana skin and mellow citrus juice. Overall refreshing and surprisingly not soapy. Me likey.

Haxy yellow colour. High head disappeared quickly. Aroma of yeast. Hints of banana and flowers. Yeasty beginning. Hints of banana. Sweet and banana-like finish. Banana also in the aftertaste. The sweetness of the beer is in balance. Rather light bodied, medium carbonated, classical weizen.

Hazy dull orange color with two finger white head. Smells of hay, coriander, wheat, juicy fruit, brown sugar, slight bit of perm. Taste is light delicate caramel malt sweetness with a touch grain and spiciness. Well carbonated, well balanced, refreshing. Slight tartness in the finish but barely there.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle at home on 22nd March 2016. Poured into a Hofbrau Haus Munchener Kindl weissebier glass. Looked the regular cloudy, grubby yellow with the typical huge white head that all good beers in this style tend to have. Yeast, Bananas and Vanilla Pods in the nose and taste: very pleasant in deed.

Bottle. Hazy yellow golden color with a lasting white head. Vanilla, banana, honey aroma. The flavor is nice too, quite well done. The champagne notes they mentioned are legit. Medium body, nice carbonation. Really great for the style.

Pours hazy lemon blonde with a very big white head. Nose is bread and a gentle touch of hops and citrus. Flavor has a little tartness and fruit on the front but quickly fades to wheat and pastry on the back. Finish is quick and drier than expected. Excellent example of the style.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours light golden and hazy in colour with a really thick off white head. Lots of smokey bacon on the nose with plenty of wheat too. Lovely creamy mouth feel with some sweetness, bacon and wheat. Nice but not sure about the sweetness.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a big white head that leaves a ring. Nose is yeast with faint citrus. body is full. Taste is wheat, yeast that develops in to a bitter aftertaste that has a hint of lemon. The yeast does not overpower as in other hefes. 1/2 liter bottle

beautiful tall creamy head, hazy golden, drying finish, five minutes after pour nose reminded me of modeling glue, a pleasant memory of sticking planes and cars together in the basement as a child; I was expecting to feel lively carbonation, but not disappointed by the softness here; creamy mouthfeel light bitterness; definitely the banana-clove thing happening here. Im going to share this beer with whoever asks me if I have any Blue Moon; Ill probably enjoy a few this summer.

50cl bottle from Drink shop, Tallinn. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Fresh, fruity and wheaty with bananas, yeast, hints of citrus and spices. Moderate sweet with nice acidity and medium flavour intensity. Nice and very refreshing.

Average frothy creamy white head. Fair lacing. Mostly diminishing. Dark yellow cloudy thick body. Aroma: heavy yeasty, banana. Initial flavor: moderate sweet. Final flavor: light sweet very light astringent; average duration. Palate: watery texture, lively carbonation, light body, metallic finish. 10s

Pours hazy vitrus with low minimal head
Aromas of citrus, bread, wheat, lemongrass, spices
Taste has citrusy fruits, hints of banana, spices, wheaty bread

Sehr leckeres Weißbier, getrunken vom Fass im Hotel Bauer in Feldkirchen. Gelb-oranger Körper mit angemessener Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Hefe, Banane, Brot. Voller Antrunk, fruchtig, bananig, Hefe. Kurzer Nachgang

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Very hazy yellow with big fluffy head. Aroma is pleasing and the expected characteristics are all there. Though citrus scent is pronounced theres no lemon flavor which I prefer. Tartness on the tongue, but otherwise a real silky malted brew and quite light. Sweet fresh candy banana. A great example of the style.

Classic Bavarian Hefeweizen with thick, frothy, very creamy, lacing, beaten egg-white head and cloudy ochre blonde robe with peachy hue; lively bubbles rise up through the haze. Aroma of dried banana, lemon peel, freshly baked bread, clear soapy wheat, chamomille, fainter hints of cloves, almond, vanilla, stewed pear and kiwi. Soft, fruity onset, restrainedly sweet balanced by a soft, refreshing sourishness with some vague citrus peel accent, estery hints of pineapple, banana, green plum and sweet red apple, the latter still being palpable in the finish; soft but effective carbo, gently tingling, very fluffy and supple body as expected from the style, with both the lightly soapy and lightly sourish wheatiness and a sweetish, very bready barleyness working well together; soft clove-like phenols show up retronasally as expected, while hops are only present indirectly, providing a very weak and very brief bitterish touch in the end. Malty and wheaty finish with still that soft, subtle yet refreshing sourishness, with even a very subtle lemony touch to it. Very typical example of the style, technically perfectly executed as expected from this brewery, quenching and pleasantly aromatic the way a good Hefeweizen has to be: I would recommend this to anyone who wants to introduce themselves to the style.

Una weiss discreta. Senza esagerazioni di esteri e aromi aggressivi.Nel bicchiere di presenta con la sua torbidità e il suo colore giallo canarino. Schiuma bianca, abbondante e persistente.Aromi di banana non esagerati, un pizzico di chiodo di garofano e crosta di pane.In bocca prima dolce e poi secca con la carbonatazione esuberante che lascia freschezza e pulizia.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Pours a beautiful hazy gold with a high, creamy, fine-grained, lacy, white head; thats just pretty, that is. Nose is Meyer lemon, roses, fresh bread, cardamom, apricot, and starfruit. On the tongue, its...hell, its perfect. Every hefeweizen out there wants to be this. Sweet up front, with notes of lemon and honey, moving into fresh bread and lightly roasted grain and nuts. The finish is long, elegant, and just slightly sweet. When American breweries want to make hefeweizens, they should take a long nap and then wake up and drink a bottle of this. Then they should ask themselves, "Can I make a beer three-quarters that good?" If they cant honestly say yes, they should move on to another style.

cloudy yellow, smooth white head.
slightly dusty aroma, wheat and banana, dough.
flavor is wheat, banana, faint yeasty notes, dough, very well rounded and velvety, clearly one of the best Hefeweizen i have tasted.
Smell of lemon, citrus, malt, color of pale yellow and thin white cloud, taste of brut, citrus, yeast, slightly sour and bitter. Good beer above average.

Bottle Germany. Pours a nice clear light golden hue with a thin foamy white head. Lovely clean and classic German hefe aroma of wheat, toast, a bit of clove, and more wheat. Delightful wheaty and bready flavor with some toast, clove, and a clean German yeasty tone on the palate. Nice banana tones come in once you pour the yeast in. Exemplary brew and a benchmark of the style.
500 ml bottle at GH. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma is yeasty, banana, candy, wheat. Taste is malty, banana, wheat faint cloves and grass.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2017

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, wheat, Weizen yeast, banana and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque yellow/golden beer with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, wheat, Weizen yeast and banana; ends slightly dry with citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Great Weizen with loads of banana and just a tat of dry citrus in the finish, making it really refreshing. Perfect appearance and a great palate as well, but the aroma could have been stronger.

Hazy yellow with large white head. Aroma is fruity, citric and yeasty. Tastes of banana, malts, yeasts and clove. Refreshing and smooth, one of the best Hefeweisen Ive tried.
Yellow cloudy color with nice foam head. Banana nose. Mild and sweet taste with some banana notes. Calm and mild finish.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

Bottle: Hazy straw-yellow body with a huge, chunky white head that leaves lots of fat, patchy lacing all over the glass. Bananarama aroma with tons of fruity esters right off the bat. Large hints of clove, mint, & bubblegum from the yeast, as well as a hint of straw, wheat, & grassiness hidden underneath. Flavor is also heavy with the mostly-sweet, yet mildly-spicy banana & clove hints, only theres a solid backing of freshly baked bread to hold it all up. Lighter hints of grass, bubblegum, & salt-water taffy with a clumpy finish thats reminiscent of banana bread. Mouth feel could be a tad thicker, but its still pretty chunky. A really nice German hefeweizen.

Ayinger Bräu-Weisse on vaaleaa suodattamatonta vehnäolutta ja väriltään vaalean kultaista ja sameaa. Hiivaisessa tuoksussa on hiivan lisäksi myös mietoa banaania ja aavistus vanijaista tuoksua. Suutuntumaltaan Bräu-Weisse on raikkaan hiilihappoinen, ja virkistävä hieman limonadimaisella tavalla. Maussa on hedelmäisyyttä, joka tuo ensimmäisenä mieleen sitruunan, sekä yleensä belgialaisille vehnäoluille tyypillistä mietoa mausteisuutta. Hedelmäinen jälkimaku on lyhyt ja miellyttävä. Bräu-Weisse on hiilihappoisena ja virkistävänä oluena mitä oivallisin patio-olut. Oman tyylinsä ehdotonta kärkeä.

bottle. Poured cloudy yellow with a big foamy white head. Banana clove aroma. Light body, average carbonation with a clean crisp finish. Light malt flavour, straw, mild citrus, yeasty with a peppery hint.
Bottle, 0.5 l. Hazy yellow colour with big white head. Average carbonated. Aroma of wheat, banana and yeast. Refreshing fruity taste with bitter/sour aftertaste. Overall delicious hefeweizen.,

Yellow hazy color with a nice white head. Full of bananas and fresh honey and citrus aromas. High carbonation. This is the way how a real german hefeweizen must taste. After heating you can smell out some gingerbread flavors combined with alcohol.
Bottle, 500 ml from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours cloudy light yellow, white head. Bananas and wheat in aroma. Yeasty banana flavor.

Poured from a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass on 09.26.14.

A: Lemon and wheat are strong. A tiny bit of banana and some sweet clove too.

A: 2 finger fluffy head. 1/2 finger remains throughout. Orange yeast cloud at the top with see through straw yellow at the bottom.

T: Lemon and wheat dominate. Banana and sweet clove are subtle.

P: Crisp, then smooth in the middle and back end.

O: Nothing is jarring. Everything is very well balanced. Its a favorite hef of mine.
500ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy bright yellow with a white head. Aroma of banana, cloves and yeast. Sweet finish. Smooth, no harshness. Nice.
Hefig, bananig, würzig. Typisches Hefeweizen, klassisch im geschmack und optimaler Durstlöscher.
Pours a hazy pale golden color, topped with a hefty white foamy head. Aroma of wheat, lots of fruits and some soury notes. Taste is sweet and wheaty, also a bit fruity. Not bad at all.
Pours a hazy yellow color with white head. Not bad, but not an outstanding hefe-weizen

Cloudy yellow color with big white head. Aroma of wheat , fruits an spices . Wheat , fruity taste. Just the perfect weizen, although taste and aroma have same notes with other weizens .Great balance make all difference.

500 ml bottle, poured into a tulip glass at approximately 45 degrees F.

A: Pours a beautifully cloudy deep straw gold, and forms a spectacularly frothy head of tight white bubbles. The head alone leaves lacing down the glass as it recedes, and so too the beer itself, in sheets of tightly-entwined froth that slowly split apart to slip down the sides of the glass in small patches. Columns of tiny bubbles can be seen erupting continuously from the bottom of the glass, only to vanish about half an inch into their ascent, obscured by the cloudiness.

S: A rich bouquet of wheat, fruit, and spice greets the nose from the glass. Banana, apple, pear, and honeydew melon skip along arm-in-arm, amidst softly, faintly bready wheat, while clove and coriander cavort alongside.

T: Bliss. So much fruitiness, packed into a single beer without overdoing the intensity or going over the top. No one flavor leaps out, but instead, all seem to hit and subtly dance and shift about in unison. All the fruits from the aroma are present, all rolling through the backdrop of silky wheat to precisely the same degree, with exactly the right amount of spice from the clove and coriander notes. A hint of a citrus tinge rounds out the flavor profile. Delightful.

M: Light, airy, and lively, this hefe sparkles across the palate and tongue, yet manages to avoid having the carbonation sharpness appear in the taste.

O: This is, to me, the perfect hefeweizen, and quite possibly the perfect beer - flavorful yet subtle, complex yet approachable, refreshing and intriguing, able to be drunk quickly or sipped and savored. I have no idea how Ayinger works this sorcery, but I am eminently pleased they do.
Bebi em Chicago e não muito gelada, apesar do tempo frio. Mas achei boa, entre as melhores que já tomei

33cl beer. Hazy pale yellow colour with a small white head. Banana, yeast, spices and bread in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is well balanced with some fruity notes coming out of the bitterness. Overall, a very good weisse.
bottle a light yellow colored beer with a white head aroma wheat banana yeast spicy and hops flavor wheat banana yeast spicy and a bitter hoppy finish for a hefeweizen

Reviewed from old notes. 500ml bottle. 5.1% alc./vol. Pours a pale gold colour with a small lasting white head. Aroma of wheat, bread, and yeast. Taste has banana, yeast. Crisp beginning leads to a smooth finish. Creamy body.

cloudy yellow-white with thin, coarse, and fast-fading white head. Aroma is a tart yeast, wheaty flavor, light spice, bit of cloves. I would have thought it was a great but subtle Belgian blonde aroma had I not known better. bit of semi-sweet apple cider. Body is a little oily-to-watery, with light, fat carbonation. little burn. Flavor is a bit tart and lemony grain, with hints of banana bread underneath. A very pleasant Weiss, not over carbonated (Hoegarden :( )nor overly banana (like some American attempts.) Yum!

Colour: straw gold with a rich white head.
Nose: citrus, orange, vanilla, wheat (bread). Tingling carbon sensation. Quite rich.
Flavours: Lemon, mandarin, banana. Rich, creamy and full of flavour.
Finish: long, fruity, mellow and thirst-quenching.
Verdict: amazing hefeweizen. One of the finest and most original today.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2015 On tap at Ayinger braustuberl, Aying. This weizen uses, as most of the bavarian breweries, the famous Weihenstephaner yeast. And it resembles my all-time favourite Weihenstephaner Weizen. Deep dark yellow to light orange color, hazed, big creamy white head looking like snowy mountains that doest fade quickly and remains til the end. Weizen perfume on the nose. Classic aroma, very malty with what, orange, banana, vanilla and yeast. Taste is well balanced. Body is medium, soft, smooth, texture tends to be creamy and partly dusty. Finish is dry, very clean. This come closer to the HB one, which i like a lot too, would need to be darker and add in a bit more hops to pair with the weihenstephaner but still a rock solid and extremely pleasurable top-notch weissbier.
Pale aroma, average appearence, good taste, nothing special overal, something to drink when there is not much choise
Drank from a pint glass poured from a twelve ounce bottle. Aroma of bread combined with sweet and slight spicey notes. A good solid hefeweizen. The taste of banannas is not overpowering in this brew.

By far my favorite hefeweizen, and the one I know of the highest quality. Murky amber, it offers a clean taste while having the requisite complexity of the yeast. If theres one hefe you have to have, for me, its this one.

* Old rating, 0,5l crown-top-bottle, 2006.  Leckeres, mild-weiches Bier. Hefige Banane, Nelken, nicht zu süß. Leckerer, intensiv hefiger mild-weicher Nachgeschmack. Tolle Hefe-note mit mild-weicher Banane bleibt lange auf der Zunge! Toll!

Pours a cloudy gold with a foamy white head and lacing. It has a nice aroma of biscuit, honey, and some spices and floral notes. The flavor is bread and homey up front with a slightly spicy backbone and semi dry finish over a smooth body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Very cloudy orange appearance with classic Weizen foam. Lots of yeasts, of course with the expected banana/cloves, citrus and vanilla. A bit of citrus freshness as well. Taste is very interesting, fruity, and with a floral/spicy kick in the finish. Smooth mouthfeel. Great stuff, and something different, its a bit tart as well.

Bottle. Typical hefeweizen pour. Golden, hazy with a big fluffy head. Aroma is spicy, clove, banana, lemon. The taste is wonderful. Clove, fruity but the kicker are the hints of floral that put it over the top. Another great beer from Ayinger.

A brilliant weizenbeer. Beautifully balanced beer. A bit more citrus fruitiness to it when you compare it to the Weihenstephaner who has more of a banana fruitiness. Looks like a weizen, pours like a weizen, smells like a weizen and taste like a great weizen. Really refrehing.
Opaque golden yellow with decent lasting lacing white foam head. Aroma is citrus with vanilla tones, nice spicy. Good soft toned citrus taste, again vanilla taste. A very good Weisse. (Velp 201411)

Bottle. Pours golden, cloudy, small head. Taste is very standard hefeweizen, similar to Maisel Weiss or Paulaner Hefeweizen - not that thats a bad thing! Strong citrus notes, slightly sweet, no bitterness.
Hazy yellow beer with a big white foam. Lots of citrus aromas with a hint of banana. Fresh carbonation. Good balance in flavors. Some sweetness and sour lemon. A really good weisse.
Another from the list of most ratings and available to me. Nice light fruit, lemon flavors and aromas. Hay flavors running throughout. Wheaty toasty grain. Banana little bit of spice.

Lemon is strong with this one. I mean, there is the typical banana / clove one would expect, but then it is different with some citrus. Here is what Superspak says " 500 ml bottle into weizen glass, no bottle dating. Pours super cloudy golden amber color with a nice 2-3 finger dense off white head with great retention that redueces to a thick cap that lingers. Some spotty lacing on the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up as expected. Aromas of huge banana, orange, pepper, clove, biscuit, grass, and herbal spiciness. Fanatastic and well balanced aromas, with good strength. Taste of lemon, banana, clove, pepper, orange, breadiness, wheat, grass, and herbal spiciness. Lingering notes of citrus, banana, clove, and spiciness on the finish for a bit. Great balance of flavors overall, with no cloying flavors as expected. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a nice creamy mouthfeel. Incredibly smooth and drinkable; this will be in my summer fridge. Overall this is a fantastic, well balanced, and super drinkable hefeweizen; with some pretty big flavor. I would get this again, it is priced well. " He gave it a 4.3.
"this ones definitely got the whole banana-clove thing going one. Refreshing and aromatic. You can taste the wheat. quite good for the style, but not "blow your socks off"."

Pours hazy golden with a nice head. Aroma is banana and clove. Flavor is perfect hefe, not too malty, nice bite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Esperava muito mais dessa cerveja. Pela fama que tem esperava algo mais saboroso. Boa aparência, mas sabor não me agradou muito

bottle. light yellow with a hazed body and a lasting white head. fruity banana nose. sweet fruit gives way to a light lingering pepper. just a bit of floral notes in there to keep it in check. banana bread and light apple notes with just a bit of candy in there.
the aroma of citrus and banana with shades of spices and yeast... the taste is malty and fruity with notes of dry wine, rather spicy... dry spicy aftertaste... very good hefeweizen...

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2014 Bottle from Liviko Alcostore in Tallinn harbour ( 2,19). Pours a hazy pale yellow with a big off-white top that drops slowly. Nose - nice wheat with vanilla-banana-lemon (biscuits). Taste equally nice, accompanied by the rather crisp carbonation. Somewhat sticky texture, dry finish. Body on the lighter side of medium. Pretty good. (But also boring and conventional.)

The body has an orange/yellow color with a cloudy haze and some visible carbonation. On top I got a thick and creamy off white head. It is long lasting and makes slick lace ring which slowly slide down the sides of the glass. The aroma has notes of sweet bubble gum and banana peel with just a light touch of wheat malt. The flavor is not as sweet as the aroma foreshadowed. Tangy wheat meets the tongue first with a light clove banana yeast notes following. A touch of citrus and spicy/leafy hops leads into the finish which is crisp and fairly dry. The firm medium body has plenty of active carbonation give it a lively snappy texture.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Taste banana, sweet, wheat, fruit. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light retention and no lacing. Smells of banana, spices and yeast. Tastes of yeasty malt, banana and creamy wheat. No aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a hazy golden color with a bit of head. Great wheat beer flavors. Mild and easy going.

Cloudy yellow color, medium sized white head which disappeared quickly. Huge banana aroma. Watery texture with some creamyness. Medium sweetness. Thin body, soft carbonation. Another great Hefe.
(Pivoljub 0,5l bottle)

Bottle. Hazy/cloudy yellow with white head. Aroma of sour malts,raw banana.
Taste of riped banana, malts,sweet and sour, some spicyness, yeasty. Medium body. Nice hefe/weisse.
Muito suave. Trigo torrado adequadamente sem exageros. Turva. Core Clara. Sabor muito bom.

Bottle. Cloudy pale yellow liquid. Medium body and carbonation. Strong banana aroma. Medium to heavy sweetness. Taste of grains and overripe bananas. Even I dont prefer sweet overripe bananas, I like that taste in this beer. A hint of vanilla. Very good one. Liked it very much.
Excellent classic weizen. Refreshing but tasty. Traditional weissbier taste with banana and bread flavours. Top 3 Ive had in classic weizen category so far!
Cloudy pale yellow color, average sized white head that quickly disappeared. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice banana aroma, wheat, yeast. Medium sweet taste. Very tasty and enjoyable.

.5L pours with a generous white head and dissipates slowly. Straw yellow. Aroma is banana and cloves. Palate is creamy smooth with no sticky sweetness and no metallic or overly dry finish. Flavor is custard, cloves, hint of banana, hay and sunshine! This is not too in-your-face and not to meek - dangerously drinkable and delicious.

Hazy yellow, big fluffy white head. Nose is banana, mild spicy notes. Flavor is vanilla, banana, wheat, mild citrus somewhere in the background. Dry mouthfeel. Refreshing and very clean. Maybe a bit too simple, but enjoyable nonetheless.
Green banana nose. Loads of cereal bread, fruity clean finish. Great smooth balance, outstanding hefeweizen!

Drunk from 50 cl bottle at the Paion del Cermis refuge in Folomites. Fantastic fruity tasting wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap in 17oz glass at 1st draft in Chicago. Hazy unfiltered gold with thick white head. Smells of citrus and maybe vanilla. Yeasty citrus, really nice body. Creamy and pleasant to drink. Great beer.

Bottle. Lemon coloured pour, just a touch of haziness. Tall fizzy white head that reduces to a thin white skin of foam on top. Lemony aroma, yeast as well. Taste is similar. Medium to light body with lively carbonation. Nice dry finish, almost sour.
Very nice Hefe with fruity smooth taste with no bitter hoppy taste and a lemon sparkling champagne feel in the mouth.
Notes from Family Hefe Tasting. Pours a clear golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is fruity and kinda blah. Taste follows. 12.6 Easily voted best bottlecap.
En bra balanserad weissbier. Skummar som den ska. Inte för söt. Ganska lite jästfällning, men bra ändå.

Bottle. Big fast head, no lace. Hazy honey yellow. Very crispy, citric palate. Fruity herbal aroma. Citric hoppy dry grainy taste. Very refreshing, one of the of the kind. Thank you, ancestors, for this culture.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours a deep golden crystal color. Head is white and starts off at 1.5 fingers then fades to a 1/4 film that stays. Aroma is a nice even citrus and clove with vanilla and banana hints. Some maltiness and dough linger on the scent as well. A nice tart citrus with balanced clove/banana on the front but nothing too intense (which is a good thing) and finishes with a nice lightly bitter but clove vanilla taste and leaves the mouth dry but not too dry. Wheat hints throughout with enough carbonation to make it fizzy but good. This is how a Weizen beer is supposed to be and Ayinger is a master of the craft. It can be during a hot day or a cold night and I could drink this forever.

Havent really had a lot of this kind of beer, but i really liked it. It has murky golden colour and average white head. Slight sour taste that is really pleasant, kind of hints on banana. Pleasant citrusy finish.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow body, medium head (no "Alps", more like a snowy flatland if you insist on using geographical terms). Aroma has bread, banana and yeast. Sweet yeasty taste with more banana. I really dont get "complex fruitiness of extra-dry champagne". A standard German Hefeweizen but nothing really screams "Top 4" in the style.
Pours golden with a lot of head, smell is yeasty and has a slightly sour note. Taste is excellent. A very good hefe!

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2014 500ml bottle for local bottle shop in Unterhaching.

Very nice weissbier. Pale in colour and full of flavour. Definitely one to try.

edit: hat this again, but this time on tap. Quite disappointing, really lacking in flavour and strength.
Draft. A fine of esters in the nose. Light orange with some vanilla and banana. Medium mouthfeel.

Bottle in a little bar in Bellano.
Very tastefull, well balanced and refreshing beer.
I was very thirsty, so...Ill have to drink it again to rate it better

In my opinion, both as a beer taster and casual drinker, for 30 odd years, THIS is what beer is supposed to be!
Sweet cereal, floral, grass, citrus, bubblegum, vanilla, creme soda...awesome

Now labelled as Bräuweisse since Ayingers rebrand, this pours a hazy yellow with a fine white head and aromas of spicy bread and banana, plus a hint of vanilla. On the palate is an interesting combination of banana bread and a light lemon and spice note.

500ml bottle. Cloudy light orange color. Medium size, thick creamy white head, stays. Looks nice. Banana, citrus, sweetish aroma. Sourish, wheat, grainy, touch of sugars in taste. Mellow taste. Soft carbonation.

Pours a clear blond, and I was expecting cloudy, with a finger of dense white head. Wheat malt, fruits, banana, nice yeasts smells. Wonderful taste wheat, banana, fruits, a little vanilla, yeast. Really good beer. Best enjoyed with your children sleeping over at grandmas house.
A little metallic. All the required flavors for an on model hefe. Quite good. Perhaps too simple.

Hazy yellow color, medium white head. Aroma of malt, lemon, wheat, vanilla, cloves, yeast. Taste has similar notes - dry sweet with light hoppy bitterness in finish. Thin to medium body and fizzy carbonation. Nice wheat beer, highly drinkable.

At the nose I get citrus and a hint of vanilla. It smells very vibrant and cheerful if that makes any sense. I think thats usually the aroma of cloves. Pours a very hazy gold with a long-lasting head and bubbles that seem to never stop streaming upward, a la champagne. Up front , the taste isnt too far from some form of pink bubble gum, but as it moves into palate that changes to banana, the main characteristic of this aftertaste. This is a top of its class hefeweizen without a doubt. It seems like all Ayinger products are at the top of their genre. One of the aspirations of my life is to drink at least one of these days every single day.
Tap pour. Light, cloudy yellow. Aroma is breakfast cereal, mild under arm, wet wool and German yeast. Taste is Asian pears, wheat, funky yeast, with a burnt finish. Chewy.
cloudy gold color; spicy peppery, clove aroma with hints of banana; lots of spice notes - clove and pepper, with mild banana notes; soft, light wheat malt base

Pours a hazy golden color with a delighfully light and fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, bread, banana, spice, vanilla, lemon, and a slight floral note. Taste is yeast, banana, vanilla, a slightly spicy floral, and lemon. Texture is pleasant, creamy and dry. Overall a fantastic beer, great at sunset in the summer.

0,5L bottle, BB 01.15. Pours hazy golden with white head. The head stays forever. Aroma is very fruity, banana, citrus, spices, and wheat. Taste is sweet and slight sour, wheat, fruits, spices, and yeast. Finish is spices and wheat. Overall: lovely weizen!

Very solid beer and a great example of its style. Nose has banana, a touch of spice and vanilla. The colour is cloudy gold with plenty of bubbles rising into the rocky foam cap. The flavour is banana popsicle, hints of vanilla, and lemon peel. Smooth and refreshing on a warm day. Prickly carbonation makes for a lively mouth feel and the fruitiness lingers on in the after taste.
50cl in bottiglia. Non so, questa famosa weisse tedesca non mi ha convinto particolarmente.

Une bière complètement trouble, aux accents couleur poire, avec une bonne couche de mousse blanche. Les arômes en nez sont classiques, avec les bananes, le clou de girofle et les autres fruits jaunes. La bouche est superbe, juste assez goûteuse et complexe pour séduire lamateur difficile, et à la fois désaltérante et accessible. Un exemple très "by the book" de ce style, mais équilibré à la perfection. On ny trouve aucun défaut majeur.
Opaque pale gold honey color, pouring with very tall head. Flowery scent typical for a weissbier, taste of bananas and subtle lemon and vanilla.

500ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.
Cloudy hazy pale straw golden colour with lots of dirt- like yeast sediments; One finger head with crumpety white foam which lasted for 2 minutes; Very good sticky lacing and notable carbonation; Very fragment aroma of wheat malt, with banana, vanilla, bubblegum, champagne bubbles, caramel, light pineapple, sugar, cloves, spices, light malt, strong yeast, lemon and very light grass; Tart and light sweet taste of light malt, with vanilla, light banana, light caramel, strong wheat, faint red fruits, light phenolic, strong cloves, spices, strong yeast, light lemon and very light grassy hops; Mid to light body. Crisp and smooth palate; Mouth feel is strong wheatyness but not very tart in a solid body. Very smooth to the tongue which brings out the vanilla and caramel. Banana ester is light with shades of red fruits. Light phenolic weith good cloves and spices. Quite yeasty with matching light malt. Solid!... Hoppiness is fragrant light lemon and loe grassy hops in nose and taste. Bitterness is typical weiss low-fi but notable in background for a mostly wheaty light tart finish; Quite dry after taste, very easy and smooth to mouth.

Comments: This ones main forte are its quite fragrant banana ester and lemony hops aroma, plus smoothness in palate. I also think this one is quite well-balanced, with aromatic hops and clove spicy elements being well expressed without amplifying its chemical aspects. Still, For richness and smoothness, this one cannot top the Neumarkter Lammsbräu Weisse. All in all, very solid and functional, a nice one if the price is right. (Lammsbräu and Paulaner are cheaper, BTW)

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2014 Pours a large soapy white head which leaves a final stable thin layer; colour is a hazy pale golden. Smells wheat, vanilla, fruits, yeast and flowers. Tastes wheats, banana and spices, with a citrus/lemony hint. Right amount of sweetness, with a nice fruitiness and tartness in the finish; overall an extremly low bitterness and very delicate aftertaste. Lively carbonation, light bodied; texture is a bit thin, I remembered this to be creamier. Balanced and very refined weissbier, in my opinion together with Schneider its the best German wheat beer producer

Pours a hazy lemon skin yellow with a snazzy champayne style white foam cap. This is a fantastic beer & best enjoyed holding your new born son while watching the German side win in the World Cup. Love the aroma, with its promise. Sipping on this is a treat: a complex swirl of spice, yeast, & subtle fruit notes. Its the balance that is so striking here. Highly recommended.
Pours piss-like with thick white head. Aroma of banana, yeast, and a bit of citrus. Taste is big on the yeasty bananas. Big time. Very refreshing.
(bottle) hazy opper yellow colour with a tall white head; aroma of bananas, spice; balanced, competent flavour

50 cl bottle into a weizen. Hazy straw color, medium head, little lacing. Mostly banana with some lemon on the nose. Tart wheat with sweet yeasty banana and a hint of lemon on the taste with a clean dry aftertaste. Medium body with good carbonation that lightens the feel, very smooth. Overall a really good hefeweizen, really drinkable and refreshing. Doesnt have a lot of complexity but has a lot of flavor. Will certainly have this one again.

Great heffeweisse. I love the style and this is a prime example. Refreshing with a suble taste. It starts fresh, even a bit tart, then goes to malt sweetness banana and yeast and finishes with a bready malt aftertaste.
Hazy deep yellow colour. Sweet fruity aromas. Fruity banana flavour. Easy drinking. Cool.
0,5l Flasche. Hellgelbes Weizen mit herrlicher Schaumkrone. Riecht leicht malzig. Geschmack nach Malz, Fruchtaroma nach Banane und dezent nach Citrusfrüchten. Sehr süffig und schmackhaft.

0,5l bottle. Unclear pale yellow, not the biggest head. Yeast, banana and cloves on the nose. Starts with wheat and yeast. Later more fruity, light herb, banana and chewing gum in the background. High carbonated. But still not more than an average bavarian Weißbier.
Pours a hazy yellow with a large head. Aroma is bread and fruit. Taste is a great mix of fruit and spice. Really great taste. Will have to get again.

Bottle sample at Beer and Beyond shop. Thanks troubles. Cloudy blond with a big, frothy white head. Smells of warm apricot and some clove, tastes sweetish and slightly tarty, rather light-bodied, sweetish finish and mild carbonation. Pleasing.

Draught at Ayingers Speis und Trank, Munich. Golden to orange, hazy body, with a medium, rocky, white head. Aroma of grains, banana, clove, citrus. Taste with the same aromas, really great balanced. Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a lively carbonation and it finishes grainy, fruity and spicy. Tasty! Especially the grain notes are really nice and the other, typical Hefeweizen notes are greatly balanced. Refreshing and smooth, great Hefeweizen!
Hazy straw yellow. Aroma is mainly coriander. Taste is sweet banana and a little pineapple. Enjoyable.

Murky straw-orange with a thin head and many tiny, energetic bubbles. Aroma is bananas and bread. Creamy mouthfeel with lively carbonation. Tastes crisp and refreshing with a little spice. Reminds me of the Weizenbock but not quite as sweet.

Bottle sample from old notes. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a large white head. The aroma and flavor have wheat malts, lemon citrus, light banana and spices, softer than many German Hefes. Light bitterness to the finish.
Draft at Buzzard Billy's. Pours cloudy light golden with huge white head. Nose is clove. Taste is banana, vanilla and clove. So refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 Appearance: This beer poured a nice cloudy, golden pale color. The initial head was very large, about three fingers worth and it slowly receded but didnt get any lower than a finger or half finger worth.

Aroma: Sweet almost citrusy, yeast like aroma that was powerful but not overwhelming at all. I could defiantly pick up on some malty aromas to it as well.

Taste: You can defiantly taste some malty flavors with this one. It also has a banana flavor to it. The flavor finishes off with a little clove and lemony taste.

Mouth feel: I would defiantly say this has a great mouth feel. Very smooth, not too much carbonation, light body overall but in no way is it watery.

I will defiantly be buying this more often.

On the bottle, Brau-Weisse claims to be a "fruity, spicy wheat ale." That accurately sums things up. On the nose, Ayingers Hefeweizen smells like lemon, cream, and cloves. Those elements are featured heavily in the taste but theres also some mild yeast, softer fruit flavors, and candy-like wheat malt. Do I even have to mention the appearance? Fine. Brau-Weisse is splendid to look at with its cloudy, layered body and pure white head. For people who love Hefeweizens with a soft yeast profile (and for people that love wheat ales in general) Ayingers ale covers all of the bases.

500 ml bottle from LCBO. Cloudly yellow with fluffy white head. Smell: ripe banana, bubblegum. Nice presence. Creamy mouthfeel. More banana and bubblegum on the taste and finish, a bit of lemon. Classic. Yummy.

500ml bottle. Pours a translucent yellow with a large, fluffy,, white head. Aroma has big notes of banana, clove, candy sugar, and a touch of farmhouse funk. Taste is balanced. Banana and citrus with a very slight spice and sugar on the finish. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Fairly clean in the mouth but very smooth with a nearly effervescent carbonation. Overall a tasty summer beer. Solid banana, citrus and spice flavours with a great mouth feel.

ドイツ白ビー  
 
とくに美味し&

Appearance- big big frothy ivory white head. Lasts and lasts. Not much lacing. Cloudy straw tinted yellow. 

Smell- banana!!! Sugary scented wheat and barley. Clove. I loved the smell of this. It reminded me of the smells associated when visiting a brewery. 

Taste- spicy, crisp, banana, slight citrus.

Mouthfeel- light, smooth, great balance.

Overall- a very good beer. I consider Schneider Weisse hefeweizen to be the gold standard. This doesnt measure up, in my opinion, but it is a very solid beer. Nobody does it better than the Germans. 

Cheers!

Bottle sample at Beer and Beyond shop. Thanks troubles. Pours pale yellow hazy with a nice head, aroma of banana, peach, pleasant and balanced, flavor of banana, peach, apricot, balanced, medium bodied, quaffable.

A pretty damned delicious White style beer, this cloudy wheat-yellow quaff. In the scent, wheat, lots of spices such as coriander, cloves, light ginger and black pepper pop out as well as caramel and banana. This all comes out in the taste which also has some grass, citrus and floral hop-work happening. A lively but soft texture make this a very enjoyable Weisse-slice.
Pale cloudy yellow color, with a big white persistent head. Malty aroma and high fermentation. Banana and clove flavor. Very sweet with a soft bitterness. Very refreshing.
Highly refreshing hefe with a potent mix of banana and coriander notes as well as citric, grassy notes. Impressive.
Aroma of wheat, yeast and especially banana. Flavour is yeasty and more banana. Definitely a fine Hefe.

Cloudy yellow with medium white head. Spiced nose with banana and hidden citrus fruits. Also wet dog. Fresh first citrusy taste. Then the spices and tropical fruits gradually appear. Quite thin bodied with prickly bubbles. Nice refreshing weizen. Gentle and thirst quenching!

On draught at stammtisch - pours cloudy golden with medium thick head. Nose of cloves, yeast, grass, vanilla, citrus. Taste is of cloves, banana, vanilla, and citrus. Very slid.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Holds its own w others solid banannas and Clive good and cloudy goes down smooth plenty of carbonation

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a large, long-lasting, white head. Aroma is lemon, banana, wheat, yeast and a hint of vanilla. Flavour is sweet wheat, banana, yeast and a little citrus. Medium body, lively carbonation and a sticky, oily texture. Very refreshing. One of the best hefs in the world.
Bottle 50 CL. Pours Hazy yellow with big creamy smooth lacing head. Notes of banana, fruits, wheat, creamy. Not that much of wheat taste in this why this is more drinkable. Easy to drink.
Pours cloudy light yellow with a thick and vibrant white head. Floral and banana aromas. Very smooth with a refreshing carbonation. Citrus background with with a slight sweet finish.
Hazy yellow/orange pour. Thin white head and lacing. Pleasant malt, malt, clove and banana aroma. Nice subtle flavour of banana and clove. Quite sweet with a zesty finish.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance had a hazy yellow colored looking body with a nice lumpy two and a half finger white foamy head that must last for at least a good three minutes before dieing and leaving some foamy clingy lacing in its wake.
The smell has strong notes of spicy clove, "banana" esters enter in to assist in balancing. Some wheatiness comes in as well.
The taste was spicy yet sweet yet wheaty, slight "banana"-like aftertaste, sweet dry finish.
On the palate, it sat at/about a medium in body, and was somewhat sessionable. Carbonation seems a bit more subdued than most hefeweizens Ive had, however its still pretty good for the style.
Overall, hey what a nice hefeweizen, glad I tried this and would greatly welcome this again, which says a ton since Im not a true hefeweizen fan.
Bright gold color whith great white head. Smells wheat and sweet. Taste very fresh, pepper and bitterness.

Cloudy golden pour with a fairly mountainous head that lasts significantly and leaves hints of lace down the glass. Lots of wheat on the nose with banana and spice. Theres a lot of bubblegum in there as well upon second sniff. Im also getting some hints of oxidation as well. No best before or bottling date so its impossible to tell how old this bottle is. Theres a huge dose of banana on the palate mixed with some more subtle fruit notes. The spiciness isnt as high as I might like and that hint of papery oxidation persists and theres an added vanillan quality that wasnt evident on the nose. Nice full round mouthfeel. Id drink this again, even if it is a little old.

nice new bottles too - but its whats inside that counts : creamy "average" top German Weisse. My fav since short (used to Maisel & Weihenstephaner). This one fits right in at the top of the German - Bavarian knowledge of beer brewing. 100%. And im belgian, so "i should know"...
Straw, hazy color, with a pillowy head. Fruit and grain in the smell. Hints of banana, clove, and bubble gum in the taste. Medium body. Very refreshing!

Beautiful color and nose and is a very refreshing and tasty Hefe. Banana and clove like no other. The brewery is outstanding and all their beers are top quality. No wonder they are the highest rated Bavarian brewery in the world!!
500ml bottle. Pours hazy good with a large soapy white head. Citrus aroma, white bread. Tastes of ripe banana. Soft at the beginning and a crisp swallow. Wonderfully refreshing. Clean finish.

Bottle, 0.50l, courtesy of CanCrusher. Cloudy pale golden color with large creamy white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of wheat, banana, yeast and herbs. Taste starts with moderate sweet grainy malt, following is refreshing citric acidity with spicy mouthfeel and light bitter finish. Medium body, oily texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Very drinkable, one of the best hefeweizens...

Excellent beer. I have seen this in stores and have never gotten it and today was like "I like beer, I like heffeweizen..why am I not trying this" Best choice of the day. Pours hazy as Los Angeles and right off the bat we have banana, and other soft fruits followed by a pleasant sweetness. Beautiful pillowy head. Taste is unreal. Blast of banana, fruit, and a spiciness that follows. Tastes wonderful. Excellent beer, cant go wrong this one. Prost!
Dorée avec une grande mousse blanche. Larôme du blé, banane, levure et du pain fraîche. Le goût resemble larôme, avec une finition sec et carbonation moyenne. Très bonne.
Smells nice. Light and fruity. Greasy cloudy appearance. A very nice citrus flavor and quite wheaty for my taste yet its still excellent. Easy to drink.

Appearance: this beer pours with a huge head that takes a while to settle down, even when it's settled it's very dense, the beer is a hazy gold color, perhaps a hint darker than the average hefe

Aroma: banana, bread, yeast, lemon, tang, spicy, smells really good 

Taste: banana, bread, lemon, the faintest hint of hops on the finish if you really concentrate,

Palate: tons of froth, soft carbonation to me despite what the bottle says, leaves mouth a bit dry, minimal aftertaste

Overall: this is an amazing hefeweizen, delicious, very aromatic, and looks good in the glass, pleasantly surprised

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I always get excited about opening up a Ayinger beer. Cloudy lemon-honey color pour with a frothy white head. Good looking beer. Aroma is banana pudding, clove, slightly floral, hints of citrus. Peppery and slightly sour on the front, followed strongly by banana, sugar cookie, and clove. Delicious. This beer is not going to last long. Makes me wish I would have bought more. Definitely one of the best if not the best Hefe Weizen Ive tried.
Nice thick head, spices notes with good fruit flavors. Very drinkable. Will definitely have it again.
Pours fizzy in a hazy yellow. Has a wheat and lemon aroma. Taste is sweet with citrus (lemons and lime) and heavy wheat. A smooth flavor and refreshing aftertaste.

On tap at Brews Brothers. Lemon sweet aroma. Color of straw and honey. First thing I taste is banana. Then I can get the nice honey and lemon taste. Like a nice tea. Not usually into this style, but this is pretty good. Maybe its the American version of it I dont like.

One of the first beers I fell in love with. A great creamy head with notes of flowers and lemon and vanilla and the beer itself is so smooth with a hint of citrus and tons of bready wheatiness. Just a damn fine example of a damn fine style.
Fruity aroma, lots of spice. Cloudy banana pour. Good head and retention. More full bodied than most in the class. Drinkable and tasty.

Draft at Moriartys. Cloudy amber pour. Large fizzy head. Not my style of beer at all. Yet, I appreciate that here meets admirably the style of a proper Hefeweizen in the proper German tradition. Bready, citrusy and yeasty. Lemon zested Challah bread. Light tangerine marmalade. Dry finish. Aroma Id a bit ascetic. Ultimately maybe a lemon shortbread with an eggy vanilla meringue top. Nicely complex.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a small long lasting white head and little lace. Aroma is bready wheat, coriander, banana, and light citrus. Flavour is bready wheat, mildly spicy(coriander I believe, faint banana, and some citrus. Great example of a German hefe!

Bottle pours cloudy yellow with white head. Aromas of bananas and fruits and yeast. Similar flavors. Pleasantly sweet with mildly sweet finish. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. Delicious and wonderful.

50cl brown bottle 5.1%abv, pours an off white tart-creamy head, hazy deep yellow body.
Nice interesting aroma of wheat malts, spices, clover.
Tastes spicy wheat alt, clover, ripe banana.
Just slightly watery to palate.
Finishes fruity, malts, berries, cloves, spices. Overall good.
