Head: huge, off-white foam. Colour: hazy, yellow golden. Aroma: citrus, bananas, ripe fruit. Taste: mild sour. Palate: refreshing, smooth, medium sour, lmedium CO2. Overall: very good weizen.

Bought a 500ml bottle at the supermarket. Aroma of wheat, yeast, bananas and citrus fruits. Has a hazy light blond color and has a nice white head, and is like champagne highly carbonated. Taste of yeast, bananas and wheat. Overall one of the best Weizen Ive tasted so far.

Misty yellow beer with big foamy head. Scent has wheat, yeast, banana and some bitter citrus notes. Refreshing mouth feel, with banana, yeast, wheat and some citrus notes to balance this beer. Maybe the best hefeweizen Ive tasted so far!

Cloudy yellow, 2 finger frothy white head dies too fast. Aroma has wheat, yeast, lemon, banana, vanilla, just bit spices, herbs. Dry and spicy, medium to light body, soft palate, fruity, wheat and yeast also stand out, not as much spices in taste but they are nicely there in the finish so this one is quite lively and nuanced. Lively wheat with good drinkability.

Kaatuu vehnälasiin samean kullankeltaisena vaahdon ollessa melko tiiviin oloinen ja parin sormen paksuinen. Hajussa on vahvana perinteiset banaani ja hedelmäpurukumi, mutta myös neilikkamainen mausteisuus huokuu selvänä esiin. Lievää makeaa maltaisuuttakin on havaittavissa. Maku on täyteläisen makean banaaninen ja viinikuminen, loppumaussa mausteisuus tunkee suuhun yllättävänkin hyökkäävänä ja makeus jääkin sen alle. Alusta löytyy myös hieman sitruunaa. Suutuntuma on hieman hiilihappoinen, mutta tämä hefe yllättää täyteläisyydellään, samaan pystyy oikeastaan vain Weihenstephaner. Mausteisen puolellle kääntyvä saksalainen vehnä, jonka suutuntuma yllätti täyteläisyydellään. Loppumaussa mausteisuus iskee jo hieman liikaakin suuhun, muuten hyvin tasapainoinen ja laadukas tuote.

Pale gold with nice hefe yeast haze.  Copious white head.  Nose is light yeasty spice, clove, lemon-citrus, and faint vanilla.  Flavor is clean lemon-citrus with light bubblegum esters, floral spice, and faint vanilla.  Finishes well carbonated an lightly dry with lingering citrus.  Classic.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2013 Frothy head.    Hazy orange yellow pour.  Smells of rich yeast somewhat mustardy some tart and sesame.  Light carb.  Tastes like banana yeast, brine, pepper, and slight lactic hint.  Creamy mouthfeel.
Pale yellow hazy colour with white creamy and persistent head. Good spicy aroma, banana, clove, vanilla. Light sweet and smooth with spieced flavour.
Tap at Gastropub Soho, Tampere. Originally rated 09042012. Colour is clear pale with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Wheat, banana and yeast.

500 ml. poured into a weizen glass. Nearly opaque pear-colored body with an inch of creamy foam on top and active carbonation keeping it replenished. Classic aroma is a nice blend of spicy banana, toast, light caramel, pear and citrus. Flavor is the same with some hints of grape must, baked apple and brown sugar. Light-medium body has extremely smooth carbonation and is well balanced with a crisp finish.

Pours a cloudy pale golden color with a fluffy three finger foam. The nose is round wheat bread notes with nice touches of citrus, lemon, fuji apple and spice. On the palate its nicely balanced and very drinkable. Great light floral fruit sweetness that leads into the wheaty bread like midpalate... quenching citrus spice lingers...
Bottle. Hazy lemon with a 5 second head. Aroma is fruity yeast and wheat. Flavour is fruity and floral, tangy wheat on a refreshing light caramel finish.

Very refreshing and easy to drink; but lacks substance.  Great lemon nose, but the flavor doesn't deliver on that promise.  I'd drink it again, but there are   so many other beers that I'd choose over this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
grass, pale, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, fizzy, long nice finish,
Yellow and unclear. Has a white head, lasting. Sweet and spicy aroma, coriander, coriander and apples. Nice. Flavor is sweet too, light acidic and moderate bitter finish. Creamy, dry texture.

(Flasche) Es hat eine getreidige, leicht orangene Farbe, ist hefetrüb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist hefig, leicht malzig und süß. Der Geschmack ist schlank, sehr hefig mit einem samtigen Abgang.

Poured a cloudy medium amber with a big, frothy head. Aroma of muted banana. Medium to full body, flavour of the banana, quite bubblegummy, but well balanced and not overly spiced. Refreshing and more-ish.

Bottle:
Medium sized, vast and thicker head to lacing on top of a hazy yellow colored beer.
Aromas of wheat, banana, citrus, yeast, some perfume and a herbal vanilla tint.
Flavours of banana, light peach, yeast, cream, vanilla, bitter, some malts, herbs and grainy sprinkles.
Aftertaste bitter, fruity, grainy/malty and vanilla.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, medium body and a creamy texture.
Pretty crisp, just the slightest hint of card board. Nice.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: One of the best wheat beers . Nice and cloudy, with balanced banana and yeast. Just one point shy of their ur-weisse.
Bottle. Cloudy dark yellow with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, banana, fruit and clove. Flavour is malt, yeast, banana, fruit, clove, medium sweet, hop and a little bitter.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a very small white head that remains consistent throughout the drink. On the nose there is a vanilla bread pudding sweetness with some citrus for contrast. Much more complex than I anticipated. On the palate the beer is ultra crisp and refreshing. Little sweet on the open but finishes dry. Perfect for a hot day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. decisamente la Weizen migliore che abbia mai assaggiato, si, anche più delle Weihenstephaner. Il profumo è il classico di banana e lieviti, ma in più agiunge un che di gomma e di floreale. La schiuma è bellissima, imponente se versata correttamente. Il colore è giallo quasi ocra talmente opaco da non mostrare la carbonatazione, che invece è apprezzabile allassaggio. il gusto è fruttato, agrumato per lesattezza, e il corpo medio ma la co2 lo rende un piacere sul palato. sul finale è agrumata e il sapore del retrogusto è quello dei lieviti.

Draft at Les Caves, Corvallis. Pours a cloudy orange, with an off-white head. Nose is slightly zesty, with the barest hint of funk, but bananas are predominant. Body very lively, bananas come back in the finish. A great beer!

Pours cloudy straw/yellow, with a nice foamy head. Nose of banana, fruitiness, and yeast. Aroma of ripe banana, yeast, fruity malts.
Excellent wheat.

Bottled. Pours cloydy and golden with a large white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, banana, fruit, spicy notes and yeast. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry. Medium bodied, oily texture and average CO2. A very nice weisse.  ★★★
Bottle @ Salling. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, fruit. Flavor is wheat, yeast, banana, light spice. Medium body, lively carbonation. 220313
Sample @ Salling Ølfestival. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, banana, wheat malt and hops. Nice and smooth.

March 20, 2013 - bottle from Randalls.  Cloudy yellow pour with big head that lasted. Aroma was yeast, citrus and spice.  Taste was consistent with aroma, but had some banana, clove and maybe a slight sweet vanilla.  Light to medium body with some carbonation, but also a bit creamy.

Ayinger Brau Weisse has a very thick, frothy, white head and a hazy, yellow-golden appearance, which gets even hazier when the bottom contents of the bottle are swished and poured into the glass. There is some lacing left behind, but it quickly washes away. Aroma is of banana, sweet bread, and candy sugar. Taste is of peppery spice, sugar, banana, some coriander, yeast, and white wheat bread. Mouthfeel is mostly light and watery, and Ayinger Brau Weisse finishes dry, crisp, refreshing, and highly drinkable. Overall, this is a wonderful wheat beer, and I highly recommend it. RJT
11.2oz bottle - pours light honey with white head and good lacing. Nose is banana and wheat. Flavor adds spiciness, floral hops and yeast. Sweet. Medium body. Zesty. Tasty.
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2016 Smell is light sweet banana...Good banana and vanilla taste...nice smooth flavor...slightly refreshing but cant drink more than a couple x2
bottle. Golden with big head. Mild hefeweizen with banana and clove. Decent but unspectacular.
Rather cleae beer. Tastes and smells like lemon, very refreshing. Little bit of sweet on the back
Bottle. Golden color with huge white head. It took forever to pour this thing. A bit dry, crisp banana and cloves. Refreshing and light.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090522.
Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of fruits like peach, banana and some apricot, toffee, yeast and mild spice notes. Flavor of ripe fruits, caramel, toffee, spice, yeast and some wheat. Decent.
Bottle from station tap room. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. The aroma Is banana and clove to the max. The taste is very similar with some extra sweetness.
0.5 l bottle as present... Nice cloudy color, good head...  Sweet Weizen aroma, nice mild banana fFlavie... Quite good...
Bottled 50cl. Remarkably pale appearance. Tall, creamy nicely lacing head. Banana and clove throughout. Strong carbonation.
Bottle: pours light straw color, with a thin white head, aroma is fruity and yeasty, taste is wheat, lemon, spices, light carbonated finish

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 Hazy straw yellow, massive white head, spotty lacing. Wheat, orange, lemon, banana, and light yeasty spice. Flavor is a refreshing wheat forward profile with banana and lemon also shining. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, refreshing. Invigorating.

Draft. Cloudy orange color. Thin head that goes away quickly . Taste Lemon orange and weary with spice. Pretty good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2013 500ml Bottle from Whole Foods Bowery. Pours clearer and more carbonated than a lot of weissebiers. Pours golden (not hazy) yellow with a huge foamy head. Incredibly smooth taste with hints of citrus and banana and some spices. Aroma of citrus and floral notes.  A delicious wheat beer, very drinkable and extremely enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2013 Hazy yellow, very fizzy, smells life a hefewiezen. Taste is nice with a medium refreshing body. Not as spicy as other ones I have had. Although the moth feel is really nice, it is a little mellowed out for me and would appreciate a little more bite.

This is a wonderful German Hefeweissen. It has a brilliant aroma with citrus, vanilla, hints of spice and lemon peel. Color is beautiful slightly hazy. If mouth feel is nice, and palate is smooth, with great fruit and spice. One of my favorite Hefeweissens.

Che weizen!. Appare nel bicchiere giallo opaco, torbida con un elegante cappello di schiuma. Laroma è dominato da bubblengum con qualche reminescenza di banana. Al palato corposo con un ingresso dolce fruttato e un senore di crosta di pane finale. Carbonata al punto giusto, beverina, e buonissima. Ottima, ottima weisse.

Pale golden yellow with medium white head.  Aroma lightly fruity with a bit yeast and flowers.  Medium-light body, some carbonation.  Fresh flavor, some wheat but not overwhelming, lemon, overall nice and dry which is the key here.  One of the better if not best of the style which is not my favorite.
Well carbonated Orange hazy pour with a medium  white head . Fine German heffe.

Pours a slightly cloudy light copper color with a rather thick head of foam. Scent is that of heavy wheat that remind me of organic wheat beers. Taste is smooth, mellow and tasty. From the scent you expect a heavy wheat flavor but it is rather mild. Nicely filtered leaving the beer not too light but not too heavy either. A great craft beer for summer with its hints of citrus.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2013 A great weiss, between my favourites!
Hazy amber/golden colour and huge head. Strong spicy aroma, with banana notes. Sweet fruity taste, and a spicey finish. Great weizen.

love the beer great Weiss, smooth on palate. the bottle can use some work but overall great

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Crisp and light. Great citrus and banana flavor.  A very tasty hefe weizen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at old chicago...pours pale yellow...sweet aroma..taste is fruit and some spice...

50cl bottle, Bierzwerg des Monats Dez 2012. - Very sparkly, light and crisp Hefeweizen, almost as clear and thristquenching as a Kristall. Great notes of citrus and vanilla, and as noted before in other Ayinger brews, a definite yeasty note of marzipan - almond bread, rather than typical banana. Nice surprise, will make sure to order this in summer when I cant get my regular Wits (Blanche de Namur, Hoegaarden).

12/01/2013 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Paglierino, torbida, opalescente, schiuma bianca leggera e poco persistente. Al naso sentori di banana, frumento e limone, piacevolmente acidula. In bocca è una classica weisse ma un po sottotono, stranamente timida, con un corpo un po leggero rispetto alle attese e leggermente watery. Non una gran bevuta.

Bottle. Slightly hazzy golden-amber beer with an off-white head. Spice and wheat aroma withlight citrus. Wheat and light spice flavor with citrus. medium bodied. Easy drinking. Wheat and light spice linger with citrus.
Bottle shared with McTapps. Crazy sweet hefe with a slightly yeast aroma. Taste is of fruits and but honey. Very low carbo for a hefe. Drinkable but a little bit sweet and dull.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Milky yellow-golden in colour with low head. Very smooth texture. Nose of sweet yeast dough. Taste of bananas, sweet yeast, low malt and mild grains. I like that smooth body the beer has a lot, but there are far more better Weizen beers around.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur dorée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées sucrées (agrumes, surtout de citron, notes de bananes, de poires vertes et de pêches) aux notes épicées (coriandre, traces de poivre), de blé et de céréales fraîches ainsi que léger de houblon floral et de miel. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture moyennement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes de bananes, traces de poires et de pêches) et légèrement épicées (coriandre, notes de clou de girofle, traces de poivre doux) avec des petites notes de gomme balloune lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé avec un léger goût de céréales sucrées et très fraîches ainsi que des petites notes de miel puis en finale la levure rebondit légèrement et des notes de houblon floral/herbeux (herbes fraîches) sont détectables. Post-goût moyen, composé dun goût de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes doux, léger de pelures de bananes) et de blé.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and dispensed to a Weissen glass with a cloudy, golden straw color, a modest amount of frothy white head foam, and spots & streaks of light lacing. The aroma was pleasant banana, light yeast & spice, some sweetness, and a touch of lemony tartness. Ditto on the flavor with less expression. Light bodied with fairly lively effervesence. No complaints. A pleasantly sessionable Hefe.
pur non essendo le weizen il mio stile di birra preferito direi che questa può essere considerata una delle migliori (se non la migliore) nella sua categoria

Bottle at tasting. Hazy golden pour, thin white head. Aroma is fruity, banana, slightly spicy and with a hint of soap. Flavor is fruity sweet, wheat, yeasty and slightly spicy. Refreshing but a bit boring.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is creamy banana, wheat, some spices. Flavour is fresh wheat, some banana, spices.

Bottle from bierzwerg.de. hazy orange golden color with huge off-white head. Banana, lemon, yeast, vanilla, wheat in aroma. Taste, banana, wheat, yeast, vanilla, hints of lemon. tart finish. Enjoyable Weizen.

Pours a hazy golden yellow on tap with frothy white head and minimal lacing. Aroma of german yeast, wheat, banana, bubblegum, and spicy zest. Taste follows with the yeast, esters, and wheat balancing nicely. Definitely the pinnacle of hefes, the best in the style in my opinion.
Appearance is medium white head with hazy yellow. Aroma is a spicy malt. Taste is a little fruity with some spicy malts. Overall pretty good.

I would agree that this a benchmark for the style. Nice yeast and citrus aroma. Lemon and honey color with creamy foam, also cloudy. Great taste of spice, banana, yeast and citrus. Earthy with grains. Nice weight to the palate with even finish. Well balanced and great option if youre in the mood for any Hefeweizen.

500ml bottle $3.49. Yellow, hazy, good head. Typical hefeweizen aromas, banana, gum, yeast, esters. Flavor follows the aroma perfectly, yeast, esters, spot on for the style. If you like hefeweizens this is pretty much spot on for the style and really refreshing on a hot day. Id like another one but I only have one bottle. :(

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-05-2012 22:56:10
Nice light malt flavor; banana and spice yeast flavors that come out more in the finish for me. Some dirt-like character in the aroma -- its subtle, though.

At first you understand that champagne sparkle and lemon on taste and palate. and the flowers. Later the vanilla comes more dominate and enjoyable. Also at first you get that tang of orange/citris before the banana <<<  This combination plays on the mind throughout the drink while the vanilla comes thru.  I could not get the head I wanted out of this bottle but once I do I will update this rating. Lighter oily texture than Id imagine.
Smells fresh and of lemon (it was served with a lemon). Cloudy golden in color, no head. Has a nice tang on the tongue, excellent citrus weisse flavor.  Really a great beer!

#640
Helles gelbbraun mit nur mittelmäßiger Schaumbildung. Im Aroma verhalten fruchtig. Im Antrunk dann sehr dünn geraten. Ein recht mildes Weissbier, dass wenig fruchtig ist. Der Abgang ist flach und säuerlich hefig. Zwar erfrischend, aber kein echter Genuß.
	
Test vom 6.1.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,9,10,9,9,9 - 9,15

Tap at Tylers.  big cloudy orange with a thin layer of white lace.  Nose of banana, light citrus, lemon cream, bubblegum.  Similar flavor, cereal grains, lots of wheat, lemon.  Fine, but a little on the sweet side for how I like my weisses.
Cloudy golden pour lacey head. Aroma of wheat lemon and vanilla. Citrus flavor full body with a wheat finish.
Bottle. Banana, citrus, wheat malt aroma. Cloudy pale gold with a large white head. Wheat malt, bubblegum, banana, citrus flavor. Light body, lively carbonation. Very nice.

pours cloudy pale yellow with a nice white head, some retention and lacing. wheat, hint of acidity, citrus, but mostly bananas, cloves, spiciness, hint of sweetness, balanced by herbal hops. lively and soft carbonation, medium body - oily, very nice spicy-citrusy finish. anytime.

I definitely get the lemon and vanilla.  Very fresh aroma.  Pours a cloudy lemon yellow with thick white head that dissipates relatively quickly leaving minimal lacing.  Great balance of dry and sweet.  Almost pastry like feel.  Champagne like effervescence.  Very smooth.
From a half-litre bottle. Poured  a cloudy mustard with slight head that lingered. Familiar banana-clove nose and taste. Good mouth-feel. A winner.

500ml bottle. Hazy yellow body, big fluffy white head, ok retention. Aroma of wheat, yeast, lots of spices, including peppercorn, fresh hoppy grass. A very refreshing taste of wheat, banana, cinnamon, floral hops. Intense carbonation, a bit of a sour aftertaste, but in a good way. Gorgeous weisse.

Yum! I think the mix pack I bought of another beer is very bad. I was getting upset and sad with beer overall. This has renewed my faith in the drink. Delicious, and it comes with a nifty glass. Thanks bar! Yum!
Pours a nice cloudy dull yellow. You can smell the banana cream pie a mile away. So good. Nice soft wheat and banana flavours. Lasting sweet flavour on the palate. Nice full mouthfeel. Delicious.
det här var nog det bästa som munchen hade att erbjuda mig, och det här är en riktigt bra öl. Sammetslen med en kryddig smak, kanske lite kanel?, och precis så mustig en weissebier ska vara.
Aroma of bubble gum, banana and clove.  Pours straw yellow hazy and super heady.  Taste is light with lots of banana and slight clove, champagne and wheaty funk.  Great weisse.
Light banana bread aroma. Unfortunately the head disappeared very fast. Subtle wheat flavour and tasty banana finish. A little too subtle for my taste but delicately delicious.
Perfect weizen! Thick fluffy head, aroma of bubble gum and bananas. Sweet bready taste. It doesnt get much better than this. A liquid loaf of bread....
On tap at Ayingers Speis und Trank in Munich.Pours hazy yellow with a creamy head and nice lacing.Spicy,fruity,wheaty aroma with notes of clove,banana bread,spice,citrus and floral.

1/2 liter bottle, 4 weeks dron rackin -  Ive sampled this, and other Ayinger beers, at beer festivals and tastings before and Id rate this small independent Bavarian craft brewer to be one of the best in Germany (which is saying a lot) at consistently hitting the mark and exceeding the parameters and characteristics of the Teutonic beer styles. This particular Hefeweiss has all the bubble-gum, clove and banana esters and phenols in spades and the body and character of the beer is fairly robust for a wheat ale. Big fluffy cap, big flavour - deep fruitiness, some spice, low on noble hoppin but a nice malt mixture is evident without being cloying -, natural sparkling effervescence, quenching with a dry finish  a superior Hefe, if not the best.
Nice appearance with a thin lasting head, a very different tasting hefe with hints of floral lemon, nice and refreshing to drink on warm hot summer day...
Bottle from Baltimore.  Lit olden Color, sligtly but not too hazy.  Fair ead, typical but lit flavors of bananas and not too muc citrus.  ily carbonated.  OK but not great.

Mellow, collected aroma of banana esters, spices, clove, wheat, and the slightest hint of anise and other aromatic herbs. The taste is sweeter than the aroma, with a finish that covers the spectrum of banana notes, in addition to orange and wheat. It is gentle and delicious. Lovely Hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy pale yellow with nice lofty white head. Smell is wheat, yeast, banana, mild spice note. Taste is Sweet, banana, wheat, mild clove finishing a bit dry. Light body active carbonation yet smooth. A very nice Hefeweizen.
From bottle pours a cloudy yellow/white, fairly active, light aroma...lemon, quite refreshing. I definitely get the champagne reference. Not bad at all.

Bottle purchased at the Dundas LCBO. Pours a very active and bubbly golden colour with a massive white head, that dies down to nothing. No lacing either. Nose is fruity and sweet, particularly of banana which I know a lot of people do not find appealing, but I find it welcome. Quite cereal/ bready as well. Tastes what you would want from a German beer, grains and sweet. Very sessionable.
Perfect pillow of white head atop a cloudy pale yellow body. Nose of lemon, citrus zest, almonds, yeast, and wheat. Taste is a tad thin, but this is pretty much perfect for the style.

50 cl bottle @ home, no BBE info (missing back label)
Aroma has citrus, banana esthers, yeast and wheat. Also some bubblegum. Flavour is somewhat sweet  with lots of banana esthers and hints of citron. Yeasty finish. Somewhat stinging CO2 on palate. Very good, one of my favourite hefes.
Cloudy light yellow with bright white head. Aroma has a touch of citrus and wheat. Very dry and crisp with a good citrus bite.

Pour out of 500 mL bottle, slightly hazy orange-yellow pour with nice white head, aroma brought notes of sweet banana, peach, pear, some crackery and buttery biscuit, some slight snappy grass, hints of clove and spice in there as well, slight white pepper as well.  Taste is a mix of biscuit, bread, some banana, clove, touch of spice, hints of pepper, slight grass and earthy tones, very slight peach, finishing fairly sweet. Pretty tasty, slightly on the sweet side, but nice.

Sampled at Biereloth Boxtel. Hazy a bit pale yellow color, medium sized white head. Smell wheat, lightly banana, a hint of citrus and a bit dull. Tastes almost the same: wheat, some banana, a hint of citrus, a bit dusty and a hint of herbs or spices. Low to medium body, low to medium carbonation. Ok for a hefeweizen.

500 ml bottle from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass. 10AU12.
App.:  Cloudy dirty golden with a large white foam.
  
Aroma:  Nice banana esters, a touch of citrus, fairly yeasty, toasted wheat, a wee tang, some boiled cereal, decent.
  
Palate:  Medium body, somewhat prickly effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Plenty of banana, banana popsicle, marshmallow bananas, yeast, wheat, cereal in the background; dry with minimal bitterness and a banana/yeast/wheat finish.

Lacks phenolics, still quite drinkable.

bottle. Pours yellow-orange cloudy, huge head. Liveliest looking beer Ive poured yet, a bubbling cauldron. Aroma of banana, spice, yeast, bubblegum, cotton candy. A sweet, smooth, light taste, again lots of banana. Very nice.

Bottle. Hazy, light yellow pour. Nice remaining white head throughout. Orange and spice, some coriander. Clean mouthfeel. Frothy finish. The flavour is a bit muted, but certainly a solider light drinker.
Happy to find another tasty Hefeweizen at the LCBO.  Pours cloudy and pale.  Aroma of banana, vanilla, and slight spice.  Those items are present in the taste as well, in addition to some lemon.
dough, banana, pale, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, soft carbonation, long finish, creamy, light body,
Lots of banana, clean taste. Good color, not much aroma. A good quality hefeweizen. Will drink again

Bottle [500ml]. Pours a very hazy, bubbly yellow-gold with a large lasting fluffy white head. Yeasty, a bit sweet and wheaty along with bready malt, herbs, banana, lemon and a hint of spice. Flavour of citrus and yeast followed by banana, herbs & spices, honey and more fruit. Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel. I dont love the style but this is a fantastic version of it, well done.

Une bouteille de 50 cl achetée à Toronto.  Un liquide qui présente une robe blonde passablement embrouillée et recouverte par une mousse plutôt fondante.   Un nez qui exprime la bonté dune céréale de blé qui, entre son aspect grillé, présente des effluves de berliner et des capacités citronnées.  Une levure pleinement responsable des esters de banane vanillée et des épices qui me semblent ici bien posées.  Des saveurs qui ne permettent que le meilleur de la hefe: un blé et une levure qui participent au bonheur de mes papilles.  Une belle bouche gonflé par le blé.  Un pétillement modéré et une texture crémeuse.  Une finale qui propose un résumé qui demeure fidèle à ses caractéristiques aromatiques.  Très bonne bière qui accompagne à merveille la chaleur estivale.

A hazed pale blonde weizen with a thick lacing white head. In aroma, classic fruity banana, cloves, berries and light sulfur. In mouth, a smooth sweet fruity malt with banana breads, strawberries, silky and tingly mouthfeel, classic. Bottle from LCBO on Richmond, August 20 2012.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Hazy golden thirstquencher of its highest level, full fruity and honey-like taste and very faint hints of banana.

Bottle from the LCBO. Very hazy straw-yellow with a respectable bright white head. Aroma has bits of the expected elements for the style - wheat, yeast, banana, clove - but also a nice hit of lemon and some herbal notes. Great body, creamy but with enough carbonation to keep things moving. Flavour leans more to the lemony side, along with some hints of vanilla and honey, along with the standard banana-clove and perhaps a smidge of coriander. Finish is herbal, not to long, with a final note of citrus. An excellent beer!

This wheat beer is rich, smooth and features a nice acidic kick up front. It harkens to the Berliner weisse style sour, while remaining very balanced with the Bavarian wheat style yeast flavors. Delicious and refreshing beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Damn good. Tons of banana and vanilla on the nose. Amazing head with great retention. Creamy mouthfeel. Tons of banana and clove, with hints of spices. Very refreshing. Havent had a beer from these guys that isnt top notch, and at $4 a bottle? Its a steal.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2015 500ml bottle. Hazy, yellowish, pale golden colour with average, frothy, white head. Extraordinary citrusy, wheaty aroma with a spicy touch. Taste is wheaty, minimally sweet fruity, citrusy, almost a bit light and watery. Very citrusy, but apart from that neither special nor notably good.
Pours a hazy straw color with a thin white head. Nose is bread, citrus, banana.  Usually not a fan of this style but this one is exceptional.  Nice, clean beer.

Pours a hazy yellow with a thing white cap. The aroma ester, banana, yeast, citrus, cloves, the usual suspects and they play there parts well. The flavour again pretty much the standard weisse profile, with a pronounced banana flavour taking the spot light. Its crisp, flavourful, and refreshing. Everything this beer does, it does very well.

Bottle, served in a weizen glass.  It is a pale straw colour at the slender end of the glass and a hazy golden colour near to the top.  Thick white cloud of a head.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, clove and banana.  Medium bodied.  Malt flavours are inviting and pleasant.  I taste banana, lemon and clove.
Pours a cloudy straw golden with a big frothy white top.  Aroma of banana, wheat and bread.  Taste is big banana esters, chewy yeast and wheat and bright corriander and citrus.  Great beer.

Bottle - big thick peaky head, hazy dark straw color, mild banana and clove aroma and flavor (not as strong as some hefes, so that is good for me), mild citrus flavors also - not of fan of strong banana/clove taste, so this a good hefe for me

330 mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a cloudy apple juice-yellow with a white clingy head. Aroma is a bit yeasty, fruity and mellow. Full flavour that coats your tongue and a nice round palate. This is a wonderful wheat beer, and it goes very well with a salmon salad. I will buy this again.

0.5l bottle from LCBO. Served in a weizen glass. Pours a cloudy orange with a small fine white head. Aroma: Super grassy. Smells like freshly cut hay and grass. Tons of banana, orange, cloves. Palate: Fizzy, medium bodied, smooth, nice finish. Taste: semi-sweet. Strong notes of banana and orange in this one. Very refreshing. Very nice.
Bottle, pours a nice cloudy yellow, aroma is full of fruity and wheaty, lots of bananas and the flavour, very creamy and nice full bodied beer, one of the weisse beers I have had, yummy

Dayton, Ohio, 29th Annual GermanFest Picnic. 500 ML bottle. Lemony-spice aroma. Lasting head. Smooth yet slightly spicy mouthfeel. Heavy clove, Caribbean jerk palate.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2013 Bottle. Pours cloudy, light gold with a frothy, off-white head. There is a lot of orange peel, sourdough, honey and coriander in the aroma. The taste was more delicate than Hefeweizens usually are. Slightly tart and citrusy, with more honey and some hops.

On draft at Churchkey in D.C.

The beer is hazy and straw yellow with but a wee head that leaves virtually no lacing. Several attempts at coaxing a head out of the beer yield little results. As this seems to be an anomaly and likely not the fault of the beer itself, I wont judge too harshly. The aroma is of banana, clove, and wheat, as was expected. The flavor is pretty good. The beer is simple and straightforward, with a pronounced banana presence. The body is quite thin and watery, more so than I would prefer. On the upside, this goes down easily and would be a good hot weather beer, suitable for quenching your thirst on a summer day.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 02-21-2011

Bouteille de 500ml achetée en Ontario par mon ami Pat. Bière jaune avec mousse blanche. Le nez est classique avec de la banane, du girofle et du blé. La bouche a un bon corps, du blé, facile et agréable. De bonnes épices agrémente la fin de bouche.
Hazy yellow colour with enormous head. Aroma is wheat, yeast. Flavour is wheat, yeast. Pretty good.

500 mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy straw color, sudsy white head.  Good aroma, bread and yeast notes mingling with orange and lemon, coriander, ginger.  Dry and definitively wheaty, nice cereal notes with a crisp fruity finish verging on sour.  Easy on the palate with medium carbonation.

It pours ochre and translucent, very cloudy; the head is off-white and soapy. The aroma has notes of: orange-zest, hay, sourdough bread, coriander, black pepper, and slight alcohol. The taste is medium sour that finishes dry and tart; there are notes of: barnyard funk, lemon-zest, toasted oats, coriander, and slight honey. The palate is medium bodied, a little  aqueous, but pleasantly astringent and sour. Overall, its pleasant to see a sour wheat ale.

Took a bit to find my Weizen but it was worth it, what an appealing looking beery.  Hazy golden yellow with a very noisy frothy head. Really strong citrus, cinnamon and chive in the nose. Very mellow with a complex pallet. Waves of taste. Very well balanced.  Now this is what a Hefeweizen should taste like. Refreshing, wet and easy to drink. Not nearly as spicy as the nose would indicate. Really smooth. Citrus, a touch of chives and a hint of Banana. Wishing I had bought more than one of this. Fantastic.
500ml bottle from the lcbo. hazy light golden, lasting white head. typical hefe but tons of flabby unmalted wheat dough flavour. a touch hoppier then other hefes. meh, just not my style.

500ml bottle 
5.1% ABV 
I tried this beer on August 1, 2012 after purchasing from the Queens Quay LCBO outlet in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a hazed golden colour with a creamy snow white head that lingered.  The aroma was light banana, spice, wheat and a wisp of citrus.  The flavour is slightly sweet, and nicely balanced with the yeast notes and the wheat notes in harmony.

Two finger head and orange unfiltered color look for the wheat beer. Looks good. Smell is spice & bread. Taste is fruit that is sometimes a little sour,spice like clove,ect also banana in there. This is my fav style of all wheat beers and its a good one but I have enjoyed some others more. Cheers!

From the LCBO, 500mL bottle. Pours a nice hazy pale gold with a large white and fluffy head. Aroma hits sharply with sulfur, yeast, minor spice, powdered sugar and mild malts. Flavour has some sharpness to it, spice and carbonation upfront, met with a lot of malty sweetness and some mild dryness from the yeast that doesnt really add much balance. A very sweet Hefe, with some spice around the edges. Carbonation is moderate for the style, but still enough that I had to kill off a lot of it. Decent on a hot evening.

500 ml bottle - pours hazy gold with a brilliant white head that lasts and lasts.  Aromas typical weiss, but punchy, lively and fresh; banana prominent with a silky vanilla undertone.  Flavours certainly closer to the bubblegum/banana than citrus side of the weiss spectrum, and I like it.  Carbonation level perfect - just lively enough without being too poppish.  Short, rounded finish.  World class.

Single bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy golden colour with a big white frothy head, disappearing slowly and leaving soapy lace. The carbonation in this one is quite intense and bubbles are bigger than usual. Beautiful banana nose with hints of cloves at first pour. After a bit, it turns to rusty water with citrus notes (going away from beautiful). Very nice creamy smooth mouthfeel. The taste is mild, with a nice balance between the bananas, wheat, vanilla and some citrus and spices. Becomes quite cloudy at the last pour. A really nice Hefe for those starting in the style, and refreshing, because of its mildness.
Oro buona schiuma media persistenza naso fruttato banana lieve speziaturanon molto corpo lieve acidita mela un tocco erbaceo

From the bottle to glass.  Banana, not too spicy, malty sweet notes on the aroma.  Dark hazy golden color with that fabulous wheat head.  Taste is sweet, banana, and very refreshing unlike American wheat beer.  One of the best spring/summer drinks around.  Soft carbonation relative to the brew style.  Overall excellent.
Deep hazy gold pour, big bubbly white head. Solid lemon, clove, wheat aromas. Great carb, and mouthfeel. Big malted wheat flavors, and loads of yeasty esters, with a solid citrus finish. Nice.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a cloudy pale golden yellow with modest-sized white head.  Aroma is full of fruity esters with a little spice.  Flavour is big banana, lemon, tropical fruit and light clove.  Lively carbonation.  Rather nice.

Pours hazy, pale yellow with a full white head.  Sweet, wheat, grassy hops aroma with a little bit of yeastiness. Smooth, lightly fizzy palate. Light, refreshing taste; slightly sweet and lightly fruity with a light citrus & grassy hop flavor. Aftertaste is more of the same.
500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours golden amber in colour, cloudy as heck.  Nice big frothy white head.  Aroma and taste of citrus, banana, clove.  Very effervesent. This is the standard for the style!
clear golden color.  some earthy tones.  Incredibly smooth. mild aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours hazy opaque yellow with very lively carbonation. Aroma is dominated by wheat, bananas, and subtle lemon. creamy texture with bubbly carbonation. A good beer, an exceptional Hefe.

Smells  soft, wheaty, beautifully musky like German cleavage. Pours cloudy almost orange. Good soft wheat taste that fades down on buds. Nothing like celebrator, but a good hefe. Bottle from lcbo don mills lawrence

500mL bottle from the LCBO. Pouts a cloudy pale straw with some decent white fluffy head. Smell is wheat with some citrus and grassy hops, a hint of sweetness as well. Palate is light with really aggressive carbonation. Taste is pretty nice, though lacks a bit of front-loading. Definite wheat flavour. A good hefe, but not the best.

Thanks to Lee for bringing this one over! Thick, hefty, hazy gold pour with a lively, spritely head. Nose is very inviting, yeasty and dry with a reasonable dose of bananas and herbal notes. Full-bodied, billowy just like I want from this style. Taste is quite nice, maybe just a little bit rich in its intense yeastiness, but well done to style.

you cant mess with perfection on a hot day!

Hazy Golden pour with huge Sparkling white head. Fruity and bright nose, vanilla and banana.  Very yeasty. dry effervescent finish.

16.9 oz bottle pours golden with a white head.  Aroma of malt, yeast and bananas.  Taste is classic hefe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a 500 ml bottle it pours a jazzy yellow color with an enormous foam white head with good retention. The aroma gives hints grain, fruits, and yeast. The taste is very similar and vey pleasing. The mouthfeel is medium and creamy smooth. There is a bit of a grainy aftertaste. Will drink again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pours yellowish white head. Smells tastes banana grassy bit tart. Nice carb great beer fresh taste and for price awesome deal good beer.

Another great German hefe-weizen!  Hints of banana, and extremely smooth.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass. Pours a hazy yellow straw color with a thick, dense head of white foam that has great retention. In the aroma I get cloves, bubblegum, banana, and some wood. The taste is a muted wheaty, yeasty taste that is just mildly sweet. Muted bubbly carbonation and kind of a thick beer.

500ml bottle. Aroma is light grassy, maybe hints of vanilla and fruits. Appearance is cloudy orange with a white, fast decreasing head. Taste is sour and sweet. Does have a very balanced carbonation, a great mouthfeel with a long, sweet and light bitter finish. Overall a very good Weissbier.

50 cl bottle at the Helsinki airport, consumed on 8 July, 2012BB 01.13Cloudy yellow color, fluffy white head. Sweet, fruity, banana, spicy scent. Sweet, spicy, banana taste. Very fresh and thirst quenching. Spritzy moouthfeel, medium low bitterness.

Hazy pale golden pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma of bananas, lemon, spice cake, wheat grains and a touch of vanilla. First thing I noticed was how dry the palate is, then the flavor consisting of lots of herbal and lemony notes with the phenols and vanilla coming in later. Great summer refresher.
This is a spot in hefe. Pours a cloudy yellow. Loads of banana and cloves in the flavor. Slight bit of creaminess really seals the deal.

Aroma of slight pepper, gum, light citrus, honey, clove and herbs. Appearance is cloudy tinted gold with decent white head. Flavor is honey/gum/clove up front with some pepper and citrus in the body; the finish is herbaceous. Palate is very bubbly and a bit tacky. Delicious.

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Weizen de Hoepfner. Saboreada en jun´12. Color amarillo pálido y apariencia nublada. Espuma blanca, de burbuja pequeña y capa amplia, tupida y burbujeante. Buena retención. En nariz notas florales y herbales, intenso clavo,vainilla y plátanos maduros. El sabor presenta gentiles maltas dulces, trazos afrutados, notas de pan y textura de banana. Cuerpo medio/ligero y carbonatación suave. Un sutil toque cítrico mezclado con frutas maduras es el único rasgo de lúpulo mostrado. Final prolongado. Cremosa, sabrosa y saciante. Refrescante.
500ml bottle. Hoepfner Weizen glass. Enjoyed on jun´12. Pale yellow color, foggy appearance. White , small bubbled, froth. Thick, close, lively crown. Good retention. Herbal & floral notes, intense clove, vanilla & ripe bananas to the nose. Flavor shows gentle sweet malts, fruity hints, bready notes & ripe banana texture. Light/medium body, soft carbonation. Subtle citric touch mixed with ripe fruit is the only hop character shown. Lasting finish. Creamy, flavorful & satiating.Refreshing.

Pours a cloudy straw color with a thin white head. Banana, clove, bubblegum, and lemon aromas. Similiar flavors with bready notes. Light body with smooth mouthfeel. High carbonation. Finishes dry with just a faint lingering aftertaste.

Pours a hazy yellow with a nice frothy white head and tons of bubbles rocketing towards the top. Aromas of wheat, yeast, and vanilla. Alot of yeast and wheat in the taste with a slight lemon zest and a big carbonation sensation on the tongue. Really no sweetness coming through and has an exceptionally dry finish. Its extremely refreshing but nothing really shines with this beer for me. There isnt really anything offensive about it at all, just another hefe that doesnt really blow my skirt up. I can see how this beer is revered as a great hefe but its another of the style that isnt really converting me to a hefe lover.

from bottle. golden hazy colour. huge white frothy head, looks fantastic! aroma is mainly what i expected: banana, clove, yeast and some pear. quite sweet and fruity hefe, lots of banana. medium texture and low carbonation, which makes it highly drinkable. very decent hefe!
Poured from the bottle into a curved pub glass.   Nice hazy wheat beer smell and taste.   I like wheats especialy when there are fruit notes,  but despite being plain, Its quite good.

Pours milky yellow, with crazy bubbles all around and the classic weisse head, creamy and generous. The smell is rather generic, with a cereal, weathy note, but bit soft. It tasted a bit weak to me, without being in the sweet side nor in the cereal side. Refreshing and all, but I expected more. I found it a bit bland.
UPDATED: MAY 17, 2013 Yellow hazy colour with big head. Aroma is wheat, citrus. Flavour is wheat, yeast, banana, not too sweet.
Pours light golden with medium head. Medium opacity due to a balanced amount of yeast. Fairly muted aroma, fresh taste. Good, but nothing special.

Pours cloudy golden with a huge white head and a banana and lemon aroma. There is a carbonated wheat flavor, very herbal and fruity, with a tasty yeast presence. Everything one would want in a wheat beer.

Nice pouring beer  golden hazy yellow  thick frothy head and aromas of lemon banana and hints of clove. Flavor is fantastic   clean with a creamy type finish and banana and lemon notes   a perfect hefe !  Overall best i can go on a hefe is a 17  and this is the best one i have found
Very good beer, nice and soft, refreshing with a remarkably balanced taste, with a very fruity flavour, good creamy head and beautiful aroma. Overall a very tasty drink.
Bottle: Lemon taste overpowers the wheat-malt goodness. Sweet, fruity and refreshing. Food Pairing: Key Lime Pie.
UPDATED: JUN 29, 2012 Bottle from bar. Surpringly clear yellow color, medium white head. Light taste with banana, lemon and slightly sour finish. Good weissbeer.

0,5l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Cloudy, pale orange color with medium, creamy, white head. Yeasty, fruity odor with citrus and some banana. First the flavour of the wheat appears in the aroma. Later the yeast dominant with citrus, flowers, fruits, some banana and plum. Light bitter-sweet, typical Hefeweizen taste. Medium body with creamy texture an average carbonation. Yeasty finish with some wheat. Complex, deicious wheat beer. Very good, but not better than other premium category Hefeweizens, like Weihenstephaner, Schneider, Erdinger.
(sample) Pours a cloudy straw color. Aroma of banana, bubblegum and wheat malt. Tastes sweet.  Mouthfeel is watery with a hint of hoppiness in the finish.

Bottle by 11.12.  Big estery nose with only slightly fewer phenols for balance.  Very bright and fresh.  Hazy orange body with a creamy, rocky white head.  Crisp, fresh medium body, nice mineral content with restrained fruit.  Semi-dry, bare vanilla in with strong lemon, some mild bready yeast with volume.  Pretty textbook, and it would take quite a string of failures to convince me that Ayinger isnt one of the more competent breweries in the world.

Really like this but I like Hefeweizens, pours a hazy yellow with a generous head that dissipates, aroma is citrus, yeast, with citrus being prominent on the taste front too, feel good on the palate with a smooth carbonation, very enjoyable.

Bottle. Cloudy golden yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma of banana/clove, fruity wheat and straw. Flavor is bready wheat malt, zesty yeast and a light tartness. Medium to light body with average carbonation and a smooth mouth feel. Really nice German Hef, easy drinking and refreshing.
Pours light yellow and cloudy with a moderate head, this has a lot of floral notes in the aroma. Has a light and citrusy taste, too.

The beer is pretttty good. Nice mellow light heff. Some citrus flavor. 

22 from tjs

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft @ WOB - Dadeland. Pours cloudy golden color with white head. Aromas of wheat, lemon, dough, and some spices. Similar flavors. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice and refreshing.

Long Island, NY - 500 mL bottle poured a slight hazy dirty blonde color with lots of head and head. Aroma was with fruity esters, banana and cloves. This was really a pleasure to drink! Highly recommend it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle in a weizen glass.  Pours golden with an off-white head.  Aroma of wheat, some spice, bread and caramel malts, and a little bit of floral hops.  Flavor really good for the style.  Average texture.  A good hefeweizen.

A 330 ml botltle yields a beautiful hazy pale golden bodied beer with large tight white head, that has good retention and plenty of glorious criss-cross lacing.  The aroma is fruity with plenty of orange and lemon citrus, and hints of clove and vanilla.  Palate entry is fairly sweet--reminiscent of honeysuckle nectar, but quickly balanced by a swirling mix of moderate effervescent carbonation and drying tartness.  Mid-palate flavors of the aforementioned citurs, clove and vanilla along with banana.  Refreshing and revitializing.  Very good.
Color is off yellow. With a white head. Aroma is saison style bananna.. taste like bananna an wheat.
Simply the best hefeweizen available in Oklahoma. Pours cloudy opaque gold. Tastes sweet and wheaty with a hint of bananas

Pours hazy yellow with a large white head.  The aroma has banana esters, cream, smooth wheat and vanilla.  Medium smooth rich body with quite a bit of carbonation.  The flavor starts with the aroma traits along with some smooth lemon and orange in there.  The finish has some peppery / clove spice notes added to the mix.  Really nice hefe.
Rather dull and dusty Hefeweizen with an aroma which is too heavy on the citrus. Bad texture too.
Cloudy yellow with a retaining white head. Grain and lemon on both nose an palate. Full flavored and delicious, but with a gorgeous mouthfeel that dances across the palate.

(50 cl bottle) Yellow and hazy color, creamy white head. Yeasty aroma of fresh bananas, floral hops, a touch of lemon and vanilla. Lightly bitter, lightly sweet taste. Creamy texture, dry finish. Crisp and refreshing, feels like summer. A delicious and very balanced wheat beer!

Cloudy whitish yellow with a large white head and a ton of carbonation. Aroma is faint bready yeast and some ripe banana, along with a little bit of caramel malt or molasses. Nice floral hops up front,  creamy and yeasty banana  and spice present throughout.

Draft at Jacs.  Hazy creamy yellow-orange color, massive steady white head.  Creamy, yeasty, clovy, with some pleasant banana tones.  Served in official glass.  Very fresh, quite a treat.  Some light lemony zestiness.  Perfect balance and execution, certainly World Class.  A touch of astringency, smoothed out by the yeast.

Draft at Five Leaves Brooklyn. Aroma of citrus and spice
Creamy mouthfeel , clove, citrus, banana and bubblegum on the palate. A really
Solid beer that you can session

Good ole Ayinger comes through again!  Just when I need it.  I tried some really terrible beers this evening and Ayinger provided some much needed relief.  Excellent aroma of banana and clove on the nose.  Banana follows on the tongue, with a creamy texture that seems to accompany many Ayinger beers.

Bottle.  Nice cloudy gold pour.  Aroma of lemon, vanilla and hay.  Taste at first was a ton of bubble gum.  Then I got banana, clove and other spices.  High carbonation and lighter body.  I dont think Ayinger can do wrong with their beers.

Somehow keep forgetting to rate this one.  Pours an expected cloudy straw yellow with thick white head, decent lacing.  Aroma of wheat, yeast, citrus, and spices.  Flavor matches well and makes for a refreshing brew, especially when fresh.

Straw yellow, nice white head. Bananas, vanilla, green wood in the nose.   Malt sweetness with a slight yeast sourness.  Creamy in the mouth with bubbles on the roof.  Excellent German Hefe.  Had this with a red pepper,garlic, mushroom stratta...great!

Pours a cloudy straw color with a thin white head.  Banana, clove,  bubblegum, and lemon aromas.  Similiar flavors with bready notes.  Light body with smooth mouthfeel.  High carbonation.  Finishes dry with just a faint lingering aftertaste.

Tasted from tall bottle into German stein. Poured a cloudy orange-amber color with huge creamy white foam and lasting lace. In every respect, 100% true-to-style German hefe-weizen. Mildly malty, slightly bready, hints of noble hops, banana and clove yeast characteristics. Mellow and refreshing. Light body, spritzy carbonation, a little chalky. Very drinkable and delicious.
Hazy pale yellow in color... Aroma of cloves, wheat..... Flavor is light and bready, notes of wheat, cloves, banana..... Pretty decent
Bottle. Poured a very cloudy, hazy yellowish pour. Two finger off white head. Aroma was banana, lemon zest and bread. Flavor was citrus, bread clover and banana. Medium body. Better as it warms.
Bottle. Pours a bright straw color with a lasting white head. Aroma is spice, herbs, citrus, and yeast. Taste is banana, yeast, bubble gum, citrus, and clove. Very bubbly. Good hefeweizen overall.

Cloudy yellow/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, yeast, clove, & citrus; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, citrus, some fruit, and spice; Nicely balanced; Overall, very good hefeweizen.

Bottle poured into wheat glass

a: pale straw yellow color, hazy, lots of bubbleing carbonation, foamy head with good retention

s: light hint of the wheat yeast esters, slight spicy ness

t: light wheat, yeast esters provide a sweet front of banana, slight bubble gum, clove. Excellent taste

m&d: light and creamy

Not much to look at, but the yeast takes this one and runs.  Agressive fermentation makes this a bit more punchy that average, and brings some really nice flavors.  A light citrus flavor comes through the expected flavors and all comes together nicely.  Well done.
Poured from the bottle a muddy murky orange color, aromas of what, banana, spice, bublegum and yeast.  Flavor is light citrus, wheat and a touch of spice, nice beer.

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, no bottle dating.  Pours super cloudy golden amber color with a nice 2-3 finger dense off white head with great retention that redueces to a thick cap that lingers.  Some spotty lacing on the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up as expected.  Aromas of huge banana, orange, pepper, clove, biscuit, grass, and herbal spiciness.  Fanatastic and well balanced aromas, with good strength.  Taste of lemon, banana, clove, pepper, orange, breadiness, wheat, grass, and herbal spiciness.  Lingering notes of citrus, banana, clove, and spiciness on the finish for a bit.  Great balance of flavors overall, with no cloying flavors as expected.  Medium-high carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a nice creamy mouthfeel.  Incredibly smooth and drinkable; this will be in my summer fridge.  Overall this is a fantastic, well balanced, and super drinkable hefeweizen; with some pretty big flavor.  I would get this again, it is priced well.

Part of a blind taste off between this and Weihenstephaner. Pours a murky golden. Smell is sweet banana, cloves, and gum. The taste is a lot of coriander, wheaty. Good taste and great drinkability, but I picked it out (even without having it) because it was a bit more sour up front, and had a bit of a funky finish. Whether or not I would be able to notice it if I didnt have the Weihenstephaner there, Im not sure. Overall, still a good beer, but not as good as Weihenstephaner

Hazy golden color with a fizzy foamy whitish head. Smooth, fruity citrus flavor with a slight tartness, mildly sweet. Citrus, banana, spice, Hints of floral hops without bitterness and a crisp finish.
Very light aroma.  Cloudy gold pour.  Yeast, lemon, cloves.  Hint of bready.  Good flavor from the yeast.  Very good.
weizen glass. unclear dark yellow body lots of head but dont last very long. Aroma is farm, hay and lemon. the taste is citrus, hay  and some yeast, very easy to drink.
Bottle poured into the special brau Weiss glass. Bartender swirled the bottle and created some awesome, fluffy head. Poured hazy yellow. Smelled of banana and clove. Tastes fruity buy also dry.
Bottle shared with Sander at his place, while eating a lovely roast chicken from Fairway. Decent hefe. Nothing too out-of-the-ordinary to report. Just pretty decent all around.

500ml from the state store 
Appearance: Pours hazy yellow with a big white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Wheat, banana esters, lemon and spices 
Taste: Wheat, grassy, fruity with a dry finish 
Nice German Hefeweizen, clean and enjoyable for what it is.

On tap at Leons Full Service. Pours a cloudy butterscotch color with a nice, fluffy, white head. The aroma is lemons, coriander, bread, and a bunch of fruity esters and funky yeast. The flavor is very sweet and a little tart. The palate is light to medium, smooth and drinkable. Overall, this is an excellent Hefeweizen,

Ayingers hefe is a hazy pale yellow beer with the classic notes of banana, citrus and faint sweet spicing. Tastes a little bitter at the front while the wheat becomes very apparent towards the finish. This beer is very good, but I dont think the champagne analogy holds up. Tingles on the palate, but does not sting. I wont go so far as to say this beer is overrated, because it is pretty good overall and very refreshing. -

Mild banana, heavy cloves, floral notes in nose.  Pale, slight haze, thick fluffy head. Drank in a weisse beer glass.  Ripe banana taste, a bit light and delicate.  Some sweet, sour and dry interchange going on in the palate that is quite interesting.  Nice.

500ml.  Gentle aroma of cantaloupe and wheat. Pours hazy yellow with lingering lace head. Taste is crisp but controlled hops mixed immediately with wheat/lemon/banana. Mouthfeel is round and lingering.  Great example of this style.

Pours a hazy straw color with an enormus rocky white head that lasts.  Aromas of hay, lemon and yeast.  Taste is the same as the aroma with the addition of light floral hops.  Im getting banana and clove also.  Mouthfeel is creamy.  This is a great beer.

Pours a pale golden color with a slight orange hue a big white fluffy head.   Aroma of lemongrass, banana, and clove.  Sweet creamy lemon taste with some banana mixed in.  Vanilla notes smooth it out.  Excellent.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2012 Aroma almost all banana - not enough yeast and bread for me. Appeared beautifully. strong pillowy head that lasted and lasted. Such nice lacing.  Again, the taste was banana and some tart lime. Again, minimal breadiness which I long for. Palate was decent tho too sharply carbonated. Overall, this is fair but it does fall short of what I like... ( heavy breadiness)

The aroma is very bready with yeast notes some clove notes make it through.  The color is straw bordering on gold and hazy with yeast. A small white head forms.  The taste is malty but has distinct clove notes, very good.  The palate is smooth with a slight wheat tang.  Overall a great hefe.

4.5
   AROMA 9/10   APPEARANCE 5/5   TASTE 9/10   PALATE 4/5   OVERALL 18/20
rjplumer (167) - Providence, Rhode Island, USA - NOV 27, 2011
Has a nice sweet lemony wheat and banana aroma. Creamy head. Feels very zesty on the tongue. Very refreshing with just enough bitterness to not be offensive. Has a nice clean finish. Color is a milky yellow with a hint of gold. Has a creamy mouth feel.

4.2

Comes out of the tap a hazy solar yellow with a thick white head that leaves some good lacing. Aroma strong, wheaty, lemony, and slightly sweet. Wheaty flavor has lemony and yeasty notes and just a hint of orange. Smooth, full-bodied, fizzy texture leaves a wheaty and lemony finish.

4.2

Review from notes at World of Beer - Fort Myers on 10/21/11. Poured on draft into a weizenglass. Appearance: Pours a hazy banana yellow with a 3 finger snow white fluffy head. Excellent lacing. Smell: Sweet banana, wheat and cloves. Taste: Sweet fruity esters up front followed by banana in the middle before ending with clove and other spices at the finish. Aftertaste is very mild. Mouthfeel: Light-to-medium-bodied with a low amount of carbonation. Drinkability: Very high drinkability. You could drink several without much trouble. Overall: Very good beer overall. One of the better hefeweizens on the market.

4.4

Nok ett fantastisk tysk brygg. Fyldig mild og smaksrik hefe weissen. snadder

3.6

tderoeck (995) - BELGIUM - OCT 14, 2011
6/10/2011 500ml bottle @ Pumpkin BYOB restaurant, Philadelphia - no BB date (2011-540) Thanks to Nate for sharing the bottle!

Cloudy yellow to light orange beer, creamy white head, pretty stable, little adhesive. Aroma: some banana, ripe ones, some spices. MF: light carbon, medium body, pretty smooth texture. Taste: citrus fruits, lots of banana. Really good Hefeweizen!

Bottle. Aroma has notes of syrup candi, bread . Golden yellow with a white head and no lace. Flavor is med sweet. Palate is light bodied and avg carbonation. Overall an ok brew.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2011 Hazy golden yellow, orange hue. Firm white head. Aroma of yeast, vanilla, banana, citrus, spice and malts. Flavour sweetish, citrus, malts, vanilla, yeast. Banana and sweetness are not overpowering as with some other Weizen. Nicely balanced. Very drinkable and one of the best Weizen Ive had so far.

Pours a nice cloudy yellow into a big ol dimpled mug, full of bubbles and looks very lively of a brew. The smell is very herbal; lots of clove, bananas and sweet citrus notes. The flavor was VERY balanced, a lot of banana and hops with a smooth mellow finish and almost creamy mouth feel. Quite the impressionable brew this is.

Great refreshing Hefeweizen. Very nice after work beer on a hot summer day.
