Crit (2740) - New Westminster, British Columbia, CANADA - SEP 19, 2011
Cloudy yellow,beige head.Lemony spicy yeast nose.Taste is citrus,spicy yeast, tart mid, sweet wheat malt profile.

Cloudy, yellow beautiful light whitish beige head, very yeasty, citrusy, sweet, very tart and on its way to sour, one of the best german hefeweizens I have had!

Has a nice sweet lemony wheat and banana aroma. Creamy head. Feels very zesty on the tongue. Very refreshing with just enough bitterness to not be offensive. Has a nice clean finish. Color is a milky yellow with a hint of gold.  Has a creamy mouth feel.

Comes out of the tap a hazy solar yellow with a thick white head that leaves some good lacing. Aroma strong, wheaty, lemony, and slightly sweet. Wheaty flavor has lemony and yeasty notes and just a hint of orange. Smooth, full-bodied, fizzy texture leaves a wheaty and lemony finish.

Review from notes at World of Beer - Fort Myers on 10/21/11. 

Poured on draft into a weizenglass. 

Appearance: Pours a hazy banana yellow with a 3 finger snow white fluffy head. Excellent lacing.

Smell: Sweet banana, wheat and cloves.

Taste: Sweet fruity esters up front followed by banana in the middle before ending with clove and other spices at the finish. Aftertaste is very mild.

Mouthfeel: Light-to-medium-bodied with a low amount of carbonation.

Drinkability: Very high drinkability. You could drink several without much trouble.

Overall: Very good beer overall. One of the better hefeweizens on the market.

6/10/2011 500ml bottle @ Pumpkin BYOB restaurant, Philadelphia - no BB date (2011-540) Thanks to Nate for sharing the bottle!
Cloudy yellow to light orange beer, creamy white head, pretty stable, little adhesive. Aroma: some banana, ripe ones, some spices. MF: light carbon, medium body, pretty smooth texture. Taste: citrus fruits, lots of banana. Really good Hefeweizen!
Bottle. Aroma has notes of syrup candi, bread . Golden yellow with a white head and no lace. Flavor is med sweet. Palate is light bodied and avg carbonation.  Overall an ok brew.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2011 Hazy golden yellow, orange hue. Firm white head. Aroma of yeast, vanilla, banana, citrus, spice and malts. Flavour sweetish, citrus, malts, vanilla, yeast. Banana and sweetness are not overpowering as with some other Weizen. Nicely balanced. Very drinkable and one of the best Weizen Ive had so far.
(Draught @ Ayinger Speis und Trank, München)

Rating 2-12-2011, bottle
Like the above, but less fresh and somewhat more banana.
(0,5L bottle @ home)

Pours a nice cloudy yellow into a big ol dimpled mug, full of bubbles and looks very lively of a brew. The smell is very herbal; lots of clove, bananas and sweet citrus notes. The flavor was VERY balanced, a lot of banana and hops with a smooth mellow finish and almost creamy mouth feel. Quite the impressionable brew this is.
Great refreshing Hefeweizen. Very nice after work beer on a hot summer day.
Cloudy yellow,beige head.Lemony spicy yeast nose.Taste is citrus,spicy yeast, tart mid, sweet wheat malt profile.

Bottle (500ml), brought back from Germany.
Banana, cloves & also some lemon added in for good measure; a wonderful smelling beer that is much like most other hefeweizen. Very well balanced and quite sweet with hints of wheat and some malts.

Lighter than a usual hefeweizen, yellowy gold with a massive three-finger seized, foamy white head with great retention

Lots of banana & clove upfront coupled with wheat & some citrus too. Well balanced & easy to drink, there is a banana finish as well & some good hops.

Light side of medium bodied, smooth & refreshing. Carbonation is also on the light side of medium; there is a great feel to this one.

Extremely well balanced & the banana flavour at both the beginning & the end of the taste was excellent & matched the nose very well. Not the absolute best hefeweizen out there but fantastic none the less.

1001 Beers to Try Before You Die Blog:
Bottle thanks to Deanso.  Hazy yellow pour with white head.  Aroma and flavour of banana.  Smooth and good!
A very good Hefeweizen. Fruity floral nose, very dry and crisp taste. A very reasonably priced beer that is worth a try if you can find it.
Bottle in weizen glass. Lemon colour with large lasting head. Banana, vanilla, and grass aroma. Creamy banana and flavour. No bitterness at all. Wonderful coating smooth and creamy palate.

33cl bottle from Ayingers Spies & Trank, Munich.
Thick creamy head.  Slightly hazy blond pour (not very hazy for a weiss beer).  I got a mixed 6 pack of this and the jaarhunderd beer for only 8 Euros to take away, wow!  Well worth it for these 2 beers.
This poured a cloudy yellow colorw ith a white head. Aroma was lots of banana, some clove, yeast and other spices. Flavor was mainly wheat and banana, very light lemon citrus and light clove. Nice.

Lively carbonation builds a 3-finger white head that slowly settles down to form pleasant pillowy shapes, under which a cloudy golden treasure awaits. I detect aromas of dessert spices, wheat bread, and a touch of lemon. The taste is delicate, like an early summer wildflower unfurling its first petals. Sweet and bitter dance amongst playful bubbles, treating the palate to a charming display of vivacious character. Yet the experience fades all too quickly as the lingering aftertaste turns into a pale, watery ghost of its former glory.

Serving: 500 ml bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a hazy light gold with a large, meringue like white head.  The nose is very yeasty with nice floral and lemon notes.  The flavor is very nice with nice light grain notes, some lemon, yeast, florals, and a light spiciness.  Medium bodied with lots of pillowy carbonation and a clean finish.  This brew is a pleasure to drink and is highly recommended.

500 ml bottle.  Pours an unclear golden yellow with a three inch pillow white head that slowly collapses.  Taste is of malt, wheat, yeast, banana, fruit and some spice.  Similar clean aroma.  Has a nice chewy, creamy body that is a bit on the lighter side.  Easy to drink and rather enjoyable.
Alright so I love this beer, tons of bananas and cloves on nose, one of the most refreshing beers out there. Heavy wheat flavors throughout, one of my favorite hefeweizens.
Pours cloudy gold with big head.  Malt, spice, and citrus in the aroma.  Flavor is sweet, with banana, citrus and some vanilla, with a dry finish.  Another great beer from a great brewer.

Bottle. Ap 3 Pours cloudy straw gold with white big head, diminishing to light cap with decent lace. Ar 7 Grain, cloves, banana and light watered down sugary sweetness. T 7 Light body, banada, cloves, grain caramel sweetness and a hint of lemon, all in balance lingering well through the finish. Complex and satisfying. p 4 o 17

Bottle at Helsinki airport. Expensive but worth it!
Big, malty aroma, lemon, banana, clove, pineapple. Fragrant and luscious. Deep, cloudy gold with a high, fine head. Glowing. Rather tart, rich malt, esters there but not out of control, nicely balanced by a lemony tartness. Grainy, bready. Great stuff. Rich yet light body. Refreshing.
Draft.  Very good all around.  Pale yellow, cloudy, white head.   Nice lemon and yeast aroma, smooth feel in mouth but with some carbonation.  Nice finish. Strong recommend.
500 mL on tap at Ayingers Am Platzl in Munich.  Good head on a golden cloudy beer.  Rich wheat aroma.  Hits the palate nicely.
Poured blonde with foamy white head from bottle. Very dry, with aromas of citrus and cheese. Dry and champagne like. Went down really well in this record breaking heat.
UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 Rerating 7.10.2013. Fruity and yeasty smell, cloudy pale amber colour, white head. Fruity fresh aroma, with citric flavours and banana and yeast. Slightly watery. Flat carbon.
Light hazy golden pour with a thick white head.  Floral aroma.  Smooth beginning with some banana and a little pepper towards the end.  Bit of an oily mouth feel.

A sunshine yellow with a sweet, puffy foam. Sweet and fruity with a definite seam of spicy clove and pepper running through it. Smooth, very light a almost too banana-y for me, especially in the finish when it feels a though I could have blasted a bag of banana sweeties.

Bottle. Hazy straw yellow pour with a quickly dissipating white carbonation head. Wonderful aroma of banana, esters, and clove. A little fizzy, and the aroma elements are present in the taste but muted a little. Pretty darn good.

Bottle from John M as free is truly appreciated! 
Pours hazy straw, foamy white head. Banana, grain, sweet esters, yeast. Pungent, attractive strong nose. Flavors of lemon, clove, wheat. palate is light, milky at first, then richer, wheatty  thickness hits the back of your tongue. effervescent carbonation, subtle bitterness and crisp on the finish. Outstanding for style an sessionable.
Bottle from Alko.Originally rated on 11.6.2009. Tasty and quite dry and fruity hefeweizen.
Unfiltered golden, wheaty, dry, sweet, delicious. Nice, foamy, bubbly. Light. Very enjoyable.

500ml Bottle.  Apearance is opaque orangish-yellow color with copious, off-white head.  Aroma is strong is banana, wheat, clove, and some lemon and spice.  Taste is dominated by a strong wheat malt backbone with notes of fruit, banana, lemon, and spice.  Palate is medium-bodied, creamy texture, foamy and lively carbonations, and a slightly tart finish.  This is one of the best Hefeweizens out there.
Aroma was banana, biscuit, crackers, graininess. Taste was tart, doughy, yeasty, same banana note as in the aroma. A good little hef.

Ahhhhh yes, Ive had this maybe 5 times but am just now getting around to rating it. Hazed yellow, foamy white head. Aroma of gum, banana, clove, yeasty breadiness in general, honey. Taste of citrus, yeast stuff again and lots of it, sweat. Very nice crisp, doughy beer.

Pours pale yellow with a full bright white head.  Nose is full of soft fruits like bananas and apples with a strong clove backbone.  Yeast, bread, honey, and hay also compliment the aromas in the glass.  Strong spicy backbone behind layers of bananas and apples wity honey.  Very light and lively mouthfeel.  The finish is a touch dry with spices lingering on the tongue.

On tap at Alibi Room. Pours hazy golden yellow with a thick creamy head. Wheat, herbs, and coriander on the nose. Flavour of wheat, coriander, banana and spice. Nice array of flavours but a little thin.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2012 Bottle 50cl from Quack-Duck thanks a lot. A cloudy golden beer with medium head and good lacing. Nose is wheat like. Aroma is very fruity and perfumed, body is creamy and relatively low with cereal and wheat notes. Good hefeweizen with banana notes, well done and refreshing. 

Re-rated, body is well malty, grainy, creamy, good bread notes, very pleasant sweet and perfumed.

AROMA: grassy, light citrus

APPEARANCE: cloudy golden; white, thin head

TASTE: medium sweetness, light bitter, light sour

PALATE: light, creamy texture; lively; finishes slightly bitter

Cloudy golden with a long lasting white head. Aroma is a little weak with notes of wheat, banana, yeast and a little citrus. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet and light citric finish. Soft and smooth. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2013 500ml. Pours dense hazy pale yellow, one inch rocky head, very carbonated. Not a strong smell but mostly wheat grain, fresh bread, some lightly sweet lemon citrus. The taste is great with just a little touch on everything great in German wheat and yeast. Some citrusy sweetness and bitterness, a little lemon and clementine orange. Some banana and faint clove from the yeast. A little hay and dryness in finish reminds me of a belgian wit, but then i get some bubblegum and banana and citrus and lingering vanilla as it warms. It also slightly dries near a champagne brut with a sparkling zing on the palate that reverts to the traditional German flavors. This is very drinkable for a liquid  loaf of bread, and this needs to be more available on tap in the States. Great in the summer, great all the time.

Sampled at Texas Beerfest. Pours a cloudy orange gold with a small creamy white head. The aroma is yeast and clove. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet malt and yeast with a nice dry fnish. Easy to drink, a good German hefe from Ayinger.
16.9 oz bottle pours a cloudy golden color with a nice white head.  Aromas of wheat, banana and hay.  Light bodies, a great example of this style

On tap at Brauereigasthof Ayinger. Poured hazy yellow in color with thick white head. Banana, wheat and yeast in aroma. Sweet wheat and banana in flavour with some bubblegum feeling as well. Quite well carbonated.
Another classic Hefe and one that I will stock when I see it again. Much better than this is hard to find in a Hefe.

Das optische Erscheinungsbild ist ok. Geradezu turbulent geht es im Glase zu. 
Fruchtige Gerüche mit leichter Ahnung nach Gewürznelken. Ein wenig Metall ist auch vorhanden. 
Im Geschmack fruchtig und vor allem scharf mit säuerlicher Komponente. Kleine Malztupfer im Abgang. 
Trinkbares Hefeweizen, das zu viele übertriebene Geschmacksspitzen hat.

Cloudy golden with a long lasting white head. Aroma is a little weak with notes of wheat, banana, yeast and a little citrus. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet and light citric finish. Soft and smooth. Very refreshing. 090511

0,5 l bottle kindly shared by LHS at Olympen. Murky pale golden with a rocky, four fingers thick, off-white head leaving a poor lacing. Smoke, wood and spices aroma with a hint of banana. Sweet ripe banana and light acidic flavors. Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Light syrupy. Dry, acidic finish.

Schon im Antrunk wird deutlich, dass das Weizen recht mild ist, leicht hefig, wenig fruchtig, dafür um so süßer. Im Mittelteil ändert sich kaum etwas, zum Ende flacht das Bier spürbar ab, das Bier wird kurz noch mal hefig, dann bleibt aber nur eine leichte Säuerlichkeit übrig. Erfrischend ist es, zum vollkommenen Genuss fehlt aber noch Einiges. 	 
Test vom 13.4.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 7,9,8,8,7,8

02.05.2011. 0,5l Bottle at Schouskjelleren brewpub. Golden yellow colour with white head. Aroma is fruity with good hoppy bitterness. There is a very strong flavour of banana and there is some kind of fruity sweetness. This is oneof the best German hefeweizens I have ever tried!
Ayinger has never let me down. Awsome hefe, best one ive had. Love it.

Bottle picked up at Chevy Chase in DC. Served in a weizen glass.

Pours a cloudy light yellow color with a very nice white head with good retention and a nice amount of lacing. The nose brings forward some clove as well as banana and a bit of bubblegum. The flavor falls along the same lines and brings in a touch of light, bready malt. Mouthfeel is light and creamy. Very nice drinkability.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-22-2011

On tap at Coopers Tavern - Pours a hazy golden color with a big foamy white head. Yep, thats how its supposed to look. Lightly sweet wheat, clove, and banana on the nose. The taste is roughly the same, well-balanced and smooth with the spice and a mineral dryness coming through on the finish. Crisp on the palate, and not too carbonated. Wonderfully done--Id get this on tap anytime.

Bottle. Poured a clear pale yellow with an inch thick, dense foamy head that slowly receded to a thick layer. Aroma of lemon, clove, wheat, vanilla, and faint banana. Smooth, lightly tart entry with a hint of lemon leads into a crisp wheatiness paired with a sweet vanilla flavor and undertones of spicy clove and soft tangerine-like citrus fruitiness that lingers into a light finish with an almost cinnamon sweetness. High carbonation and a crisp, clean mouth feel that creates an incredibly drinkable beer. Overall, its a really good beer with a fair amount of nuance and great mouth feel.

A cloudy light yellow, with minimal white head,not much in the way of lacing.

Sweet aromas of bananas,nuts,fruit,very pleasant and inviting.

Sweet,creamy goodness of bananasmaybe some tropical fruits and some other sweetness. Well carbonated,medium body,very appropriate for the coming spring and hot summer days.

A definite session and spring/summer brew. A classic Hefeweizen and solid German beer. Very good.

500ml bottle poured into a pint glass...Nice honey gold pour, white head that rises a quick four fingers but falls to nothing. Light lacing...Slightly disappointing aroma that comes off a little generic. Candied bananas with light cloves, a touch of honey...The taste is better, lots of smooth cloves comes through, a little wheat but simple. The feel is actually nice, pretty easy to drink.
Aroma of wheat and faint lemons. Pours cloudy with a small head. Taste of wheat, lemon, and clove. Theres an incredible freshness to the beer. Finishes neatly. Beautifully produced beer.

Friday afternoon duringh 70 degree March day in NYC.  Pours clear lager yellow but with huge frothy white head.  Aroma is tonso of bannana, lemon, and some vanilla.  taste is more bannana with wheat bread, and finish is clean crisp and dry.  very nice fit for todays March Madness activities

Pours hazy golden amber with a huge fluffy beige longlived haed leaving nice lace. Aroma is citric, sourish, fruity, yeasty, bananas, grainy and freshly baked bread; very nice.Thin body, good carbonation. Fruity, yeasty, wheaty, citrus, bananas, hoppy and candy flavor. Fruity hoppy palate. Finishes fruity fresh and hoppy bitter.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 500ml bottle into a tall weizen glass. The abv is listed on the back label (5.1%) but there is no freshness date.

Appearance: The body has an orange/yellow color with a cloudy haze and some visible carbonation. On top I got a thick and creamy off white head. It is long lasting and makes slick lace ring which slowly slide down the sides of the glass.

Smell: The aroma has notes of sweet bubble gum and banana peel with just a light touch of wheat malt.

Taste/Palate: The flavor is not as sweet as the aroma foreshadowed. Tangy wheat meets the tongue first with a light clove banana yeast notes following. A touch of citrus and spicy/leafy hops leads into the finish which is crisp and fairly dry. The firm medium body has plenty of active carbonation give it a lively snappy texture.

Notes: I love the texture and finish on this beer. Some German Hefeweizen beers get a little to slick on the palate but this one is crisp and feels alive with carbonation. Overall this is an outstanding Hefeweizen.
UPDATED: SEP 20, 2012 Got a fresh bottle of this with the new packaging. Wow. Banana surprise! Banana on the nose and in the taste, clove big time in the taste. Delicious.

Enjoyed from a 16.9oz bottle in a hefeweizen glass.  The beer pours a just slightly hazy deep yellow, with a moderate to high white head.  The aroma shows characters of banana, and a slightly husky grain note.  The palate shows that same husky, tannin-like grain note up front, before some nice banana.  Carbonation is assertive, but not a distraction.  The beer seems to have held up really well, given the long and unintended aging time.  The finish is quite dry, nicely fruity, and again carries a slightly grainy note.  Overall, it would be wonderful to try this beer in its homeland, but an enjoyable drinking experience, just the same.
UPDATED: MAR 6, 2011 Freshest tasting beer I have ever had. Goes down super smooth. Taste is yeasty, wheat, and light banana fruit. Awesome hefe.
Banana and yeast aroma and flavor all around, a fresh tasting hefeweizen, a very good example of the style.

500 ml bottle, BB date says March 2011, into tulip. Pours medium sized, creamy white head that fades to thick firm cloth atop of the hazy pale-straw body. Aroma is rich ripe banana esters in perfect balance with the clove phenols. A bubble gum emerges now and then accentuating the bananaish sweetness. Malted wheat is perceived as faint doughy scent. On the contrary to the nose, the doughy flavor is the dominant one and both banana and clove are far less expressed than in the aroma section. Wheaty texture and suspended yeast donate creamy mouthfeel although the relatively dry finish is prickly due to the decent amount of carbonation.

Unclear light beer with a lively, short-lived foam. Super fresh smell of tangy fermented apples, ripe banana, yeast, apricot, wheat. Enjoyable mouthfeel, good carbonation. In the mouth: More banana, nice round malt sweetness, a little smoke and a dry finish. Very refreshing, even for a non-wheat beer-fanatic like me.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2011 Oh boy.   Complex meat banana,  clove,  fresh sunshine hay, pear skin nose.  Quite potent.   Taste is creamed wheat, bananas, and hay, spice.   Beautiful. Snow head.  Just a well made beer.  Great example of the style.    A joy to drink.
Lovely beer, but it felt a bit light. The color was not as thick as I am used to seeing Hefes. I enjoyed it even after it got a little warm.

Pours translucent yellow with a slight green tint and a large three-finger wide white head. Aroma is of wheat, hops, slight floral hints, and a tad of citrus. Flavor is dominated by the wheat, slight oily mouth-feel, light bodied. A little bit of fruit in the finish.

Bottle @ home.  Hazy yellow-orange appearance.  Slightly light aroma compared to other German Hefeweizen.  Pretty good hazy wheat malts in the nose.  Slight lemon, yeasty, light bodied Hefeweizen.  Lighter than most other German Hefeweizen and not as full of a body.

500ml bottle!
The beer in glass is orange yellow and turbid medium. The smell is yeasty and fruity, subtly clove-like in the background. Starts very yeasty, fruity with dominant banana flavor. Relatively sweet undertone that is a bit annoying with time. The aftertaste is slightly fermented fruit, banana and pleasantly yeasty. The further course is slightly bitter, which decreases slightly yeasty notes.

Great aroma from the open bottle. Pours great. Very bright color. Smells like malt and slightly woody. Smooth and banana like tastes with a spicy malt smack at the end. Huge malty character as you drink it. It leaves a lingering flavor in your mouth. Excellent brew.

Fantastic fluffy bright-white head. Lovely clouded glowing orange body. Aromas of ripe bananas, light citrus and Anglo bubblegum. Not juicy fruit, Anglo. Mind-blowing thick, yet not cloying mouthfeel. Could drink this all day. Find it hard to come by though- does anyone know where you can still get it in UK?

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 [3527-20101228] Tap. Mild cardboard and wheaty fruit aroma. Hazy, light orange brown body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Nice light fruity banana flavour has a lingering clove spice kick afterward. Medium body. Quite refreshing.
(@ Coles, Buffalo, NY)

[5181B-20130401] Bottle. Light wheat lemon yeast aroma. Slightly hazy, light orange yellow body with a long-lasting foamy white head. Light lemon yeast continues in the flavour. Medium body. Good, drinkable. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2011 Aroma: Citrus hops with strong banana.
Appearance: Cloudy gold with frothy white head.
Taste: Heavy sweetness with a hint of sourness at the end.
Palate: Medium body with a creamy texture, lively carbonation and long finish.
Overall: Its a hands down, gold standard brau-weisse.
this has a beautiful honey color with a warm citrus taste that gets stronger the warmer it gets. Slight carbonation with a thin head. It was a nice Christmas treat. I would drink this again!

Pours a hazy golden color with a white head.  Spicy yeast aroma with citrus and banana.  Smooth on the palate with fine carbonation.  Malty flavors carry a touch of lemon.  Prototypical German hefeweizen, exactly what you want in the style.
Botella. Unclear golden, medium white head, good lacing. Pleasant mild wheat fruity aroma. Good mouthfeel. Soft mouthfeel. Good mild wheat and fruity flavour.
Fruity, yeasty aroma. Thick white head. Pale golden in appearance. Smooth to drink, medium carbonation, slight hoppy aftertaste, easy to drink. Not a bad hefeweizen at all.

Színben a világosabb mézekre hasonlít, és szép nagy fehér, kemény habja van. Banános, mandarinos, élesztős és meglehetősen fűszeres (többek közt oregano!) illat, és nem túl erős egyik sem, de azért rendben van a dolog. Elég testes, érezni, hogy nem spóroltak a hozzávalókkal. Banán, citrusfélék és enyhén vanília érződnek az ízében, de ez azokhoz búzákhoz tartozik, ahol a búzamalátának kiemelt szerepe van, az ízében is ez a fő irányadó. A lecsengése száraz, kissé savanykás, és az utóízében ott a kenyér, már szinte jól is lakunk tőle. A téli hónapokra is bátran merem ajánlani.

Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured with peach-golden yellow color with a  medium, white, lacing head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, vanilla, honey, yeast and hops. Sweet start with grainy finish. Medium dense with low carbonation. Easy to drink, smooth, with a yeasty aftertaste. Pretty good one.

Half liter on draft at Hackneys pours up a cloudy yellow with a good head. Aroma of banana with hints of citrus and clove. Flavor is a bit watery then the banana and citrus hit you in the back of the mouth.
UPDATED: JUL 7, 2011 500mL bottle.  Rich creamy golden pour.  Frothy head.  Scents of orange and coriander.  Sweet delicious flavor.  Refreshing summer hefeweizen.
UPDATED: NOV 21, 2010 Bottle courtesy of Bierkrug - thanks for the weisse! Strong banana scent. Good flavor: bubble gum, banana, pineapple. Enjoyable!

4 oz. @ SIB 2010

Notes
"Pours like cloudy mead. Smells like bubble gum. A little flat due to tap trouble. Not bad for a weisse. Tastes like bananas."
Inte så mycket att säga om denna. Fin färg, trevlig men diskreta toner av skumbanan - lite jästig.
Draught at Churchkey.  Strong aroma and flavor of clove and bubblegum.  Good example of the style

Pours a beautiful yellow with a nice thick white head. I marked down appearance because the head doesnt last long enough for me in regards to a weisse. Taste is great. Smooth and delicious. Palate is also top notch.
Hazy orangeish with white head. Smells of yeast and wheat, and taste is full of wheat with some sweet floral and fruit flavors. Excellent hefe.

This is my favorite wheat beer.  Havent tried a ton of them since Im not a wheat fan.  Nice gold color, nice head, what me, a non-wheat fan, would call a more moderate wheat / yeast flavor.  Could drink lots of these if they were in front of me :)

Aroma has faint hints of detergent and grains. Body is bright yellow, has plenty of solid rising head. Flaouvr is sout wheat, ammonia, straw. Has a dry finish and an odd aftertaste. Not the best of its kind out there.
bottle.  Pours a cloudy gold with white bubbles for head.  Nose is of yeast and wheat.  taste is of Belgian yeast and wheat.  Mouthfeel is medium and creamy.  Decent.

Bottle. Poured a murky amber with a medium sized white creamy head that had excellent lacing. The aroma was heavy of bread malts with a meaty doughy yeast scent and hints of citrus. It tasted very yeasty with notes of citrus at first and finished with a nice malty yeast flavor with a nice note of citrus and left the flavor lingering for a nice while. Mouthfeel was light to medium in body and very creamy in texture and had a soft carbination. Overall an exquisit representation of this style, very nice with a slice of lemon.

On tap at Angolo Blu in Rimini. Cloudy gold pour nice head that sticks around as a thin lace. Aroma is citrusy and spicy. Nice palate, not to thin with enough carbonation to tingle the tongue. Nice tart finish.

Great hefe.  I poured this bottle into my recently purchased Ayinger weizen glass, and it looks fantastic.  Though the glass definitely helps out (great ripple pattern), its a real beauty of a beer with a glowing yellow-orange body, hazily opaque, and an enormous white crown of gigantic bubbles and foam.  The aroma is wheat, bananas and spice.  It leans more toward clean, sweet wheat/banana than spice (probably closer to the Weihenstephaner than the Schneider), but the spice is definitely there.  The taste is bready sweet.  Its like a liquid cake with hints of banana and clove/vanilla bean.  Mouthfeel is spot on, and it goes down smoothly and easily.  I would be very happy to drink a glass every day with lunch.

Notes from September 24, 2010
16.9 oz. bottle from Johns Grocery, Iowa City, $2.49

Ar: Classic German wheat aroma.  Big banana-clove nose, lots of spice.
Ap: Pours a very hazy yellow-gold with a huge weizen head that leaves good lace.
T: Follows suit of the aroma: Banana, clove, and a little tart bite.  I would have liked a bit more tartness, as I found this a bit cloying.
P: Nice chewy body with lots of carbonation.

Good hefe, but not a great one.  Well worth grabbing a bottle to try.

500 ml bottle courtesy of liveFREEorRye.  Highly carbonated yellow-white colored body. The carbonation does calm down as it sits awhile.  The mild aroma was malty spicy, banana clove and coriander. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a mellow fruity aftertaste. The yummy flavor contained notes of malt hops banana and floral.  A very good Hefe.  Will buy again.
Cloudy unfiltered golden ale. Scent of lemon and honey. clean lemon taste with a light spicy exit.  Very light airy feel. Great balance. No misstep I can detect for the style.

500 ml bottle @ home. Rated @ 1.6.2009.
Pours a hazy yellow colour with a large frothy white head. Very citrus-driven but weak on the nose with fruits, yeast, wheat and vanilla. The taste is classic Hefeweizen-style: wheat, citrus, malts and fruits. Medium bodied, oily texture and decent carbonation. Well balanced.

500. Pours a hazy dark gold with a towering fizzy platinum blond head. Lots of stringy lace coming down the sides of the glass. Huge tangy banana nose, little bits of clove tucking in behind the obvious bunched fruit notes. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Banana and clove on the mid palate. Long banana finish. Refreshing, tasty. Good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2013 Pours a straw color with white head. Massive banana with spice in the background. Bready medium thin mouthfeel with nice yeast. Crisp yeasty and banana. Very nice on a warm summer day.
A good refreshing hefe. Very cloudy, easy to drink, and a great sparkling palate. Fairly run of the mill wheat beer flavour, high quality.
Cloudy and yellow, some head.  Plenty of bubblegum aroma, but the flavor has a lot of lemon and citrus flavor with the finish having a bit of tartness.

0, 5 l, thanks Mantlesorrow!Poured murky peach-brown with a nice foamy white head that melt down slowly to a small lacing one. Classic fruity aroma of a weizen beer with banana and some citrusses, spicies likke clove, cinnamon and some vanilla, caramel. Smooth mouthfeel, medium body with a fruity flavor. Tropical fruits, banana, orange peel and mild citrusses with spicies like clove and cinnamon, fizzy carbonation. Nice!

16.9 oz. bottle- Pours cloudy golden with a nice two finger head and carbonation bubbles up the ass, beautiful beer. Aroma has a strong lemony spice to it, very wheaty and yeast is abundant. The flavor is yeast, lemon, clove, spice, all the good trademarks of the style, but what grabs me is the smooth creamy vanilla flavor,  I think this is up there with Weihenstephaner, tasty tasty stuff.

Színe ködös arany, tetején egy szépen tömött és csak lassan összeeső, piszkosfehér habkoronával ill. a pohár szélén pezsgő apró buborékokkal.
Illata az erjedt gyümölcsöket idézi, kiegészítve némi szegfűszeges fűszerességgel.
Nagyon picit csípősen kezd, utána válik érezhetővé a főzet lágy és sima teste, emiatt igen könnyen iható.
Kellemes, puha gyümölcsös  íze körtét és banánt juttat eszembe.
Az alapvetően maláta-domináns aromája véleményem szerint nem eléggé komplex és intenzív (ettől függetlenül érezhető, hogy bizony szaktudás van mögötte és nagyon jó alapanagokból készült), összességében inkább lágynak/, "kifinomultnak" nevezném azt.
Enyhén fanyar befejezése fűszeres, citrusos és száraz, mely egy fűszeres utóízben marad meg.
Összességében, ez egy nagyon ízletes és élvezetes főzet, mely szerintem - ha bajor búzasörröl van szó - kihagyhatatlan.

Bottle 500ml. Hazy blond. Aroma of coriander, banana, orange peel and a bit of clove. I also detect flowers and berries which is a nice addition. The wheat and heavy spices (clove) are quite subtle for the style. Great aroma. The flavor are less impressive and unique. Wheat is more present and there is also the usual citrus and herbs. Delicate and refreshing. Palate is light and the carbonation is lively. A very good hefeweizen but not my favourite of the style.

Bottle: Pour is a deep golden color with a nice fluffy white head. This would be my first unfiltered beer experience, so it was an interesting thing to see particles suspended in the foaming head. With that said, this beer shares the typical hefeweizen notes that one would expect: Clove, Spices, Mild citrus, but it seems heavier than what you would typically expect, and for me this actually detracts from the experience.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 Another fine product from Ayinger.  All the yeasty banana-y cloudy goodness that hefe-weizen drinkers often look for. Serving: Bottle

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a small longlasting white head. Has a sweetish fruity wheat malty banana aroma. Sweetish wheat malty spicy banana flavor. Has a sweetish wheat malty banana finish.

Im in the minority, I love hefes and im proud to say it. This had the typical hefe characteristics, clovey/ bready nose, taste was a clean bready mouthfeel. Very drinkable, they have been up to this for some time and they are consistant and a benchmark. Good stuff.
Bottle pours a cloudy yellow beer with a frothy white head. Scent is wheat and banana (typical). Taste is the same with a bit of citrus hints.

Sötét narancssárga színe van és olyan mintha egy adag tejet borítottak volna bele. A rajta termelődő hab, sűrű, kemény mint a puding és kissé piszkosfehér. Illat túlérett banáné, megbolondítva egy kis grapefruittal, malátával és élesztővel. Ízében is jelentkezik a tipikus gyümölcsös, élesztős búzamalátás jelleg, amit egy adag jófajta komló is finomabbá tesz. Elég sűrű, de nem nehézkes teste van és igen szénsavas, nagyon él. Utóízében is jelentkezik a kis plusz komló, és kissé keserédessé és hosszan tartóvá varázsolja a búcsúzást. De nem muszáj tőle búcsúzni, hiszen ravaszul csábít egy következő palack elfogyasztásához. Ne álljunk neki ellent!

Appearance:  rich cloudy gold, big foaming creamy white head.  Aroma:  citrus, spices, banana, creamed corn, cloves, cinnamon.  Taste:  light sweet champagne and bubbly spices, sweet bananas and wheat, with a hint of cloves.  Finish:  sweet, tingly, dry and crisp; lingers pleasantly.  Notes:  oh man, what a great HW.  Sweetest HW to date.  Very nice.  Very carbonated and sweet, yet somehow dry and creamy at the same time.  ZOUNDS!

Lemony aroma. Cloudy yellow with a tinge of orange in appearance. Thick, bubbly white head. Very crisp and bubbly with a dry finish. This beer would be perfect for a hot summer day....bring plenty though cause they will go quick.

Aroma is of entering a florist during a fresh cutting.  Real bright soft dewey aroma of flower petals with a bit of gentle spice and a hint of bubblegum.  Flavor is light spice and unripened banana.  What a gorgeous warm weather brew.  The body and carbonation meld harmoniously and lend to the refreshing quality of the beer with the tiny bubbly thing going on.  Thanks Ayinger.  2010 16.9 oz bottle.

Bottled. Very beautiful, opaque, orangeish yellow coloured beer. Bananic and yeasty hefeweisen aroma. Crisp taste is fresh with fruits and wheat. Not too sweet. A very good and personal, tasty hefeweisen!

Bottle. Aroma is bananas, lemon citrus and spiced dough. Appearance is a cloudy yellowish golden color with an inch of fluffy white head. Taste starts off with strong banana bread and honey flavors along with lemon, green apple and a hint of clove. Mouthfeel is crisp and slightly creamy with heavy carbonation and a dry finish. Overall flavor is tart and lemony with lots of honey sweetness. The clove and spice flavors are very subtle in comparison to other German Hefeweizens. Its smooth and refreshing with just the right blend of fruit, wheat and yeast flavors.
330 ml  bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $2.99 Excellent!

NICE hop aroma, nice gradient cloudy appearance.  Beautiful sweet, roasted carmel weisse taste that finishes great.  Nice beer!!  Too bad it was USD$4.00 for a 1-pint bottle at the local grocery store, but Id do $2, maybe $3 or $3.50 at a pub.

Cloudly, semi-translucent body with a fluffy white head.  Lots of carbonation apparent.  Aromas are floral and citrusy with primarily orange and lemon peal surrounded by a light grain.  Flavors continue the aroma with more wheat flavors apparent and some nice sour citrus,  A nice complex but light beer.

Color dark orange with medium lasting head. Aroma vanilla, grain, wheat, banana. Taste wheat, banana, vanilla.

im not very experienced with hefeweizens in particular, and i tend to like bigger, bolder offerings, making it a little harder to grade this beer. its fairly enjoyable, obviously easy drinking. not to sweet like some other wheats, and a little dry. somewhat enjoyable. im ready for some more wheats.
This is a really really good hefe but not as good as Schneider Brooklyn Weisse.

500mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy orangey golden color with white head.  Aroma has cereal, yeast, and some orange.  Taste is cereal, wheat, yeast, a touch of lemon, and some grapefruit.  Reasonably dry.  Finish has yeast, as well as a bit of cereal and citrus.

Appealing aroma of wheat,grass, lemon and I definitely get vanilla...althiough wish I hadnt read the description because Im not sure if I would have identified on my own or not,  Flavor is a bit more subtle than I expected, but is really clean, soft and nice...dry finish.  Appearance is couldy yellow with a huge frothy snow-white head.  Nice summer beer! Alcohol is imperceivable... doesnt taste a bit over 3%.

Bottle.

Nice Hefeweizen with aroma and taste of banana, yeast, wheat and spices. Very drinkable, nice mouth feel.

This is a Christmas beer that I put off drinking.  I am not a fan of Hef-Weizen.  It is just too sweet.  The beer foam for half the bottle.  The cloudy appearance, no lacing and the head dissapated.  The sweet fruity taste is just not my choice.  This is a 500 ml bottle.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2016 Pours hazy yellow with a high head. Aroma is banana, wheat and yeast. Flavor is light and refreshing, with some wheat and a hint of banana. Very nice for a hot day. (858416) Re-rate on tap @ Bruuveri 2016. Not quite as good but still good.

First rating of a German Hefeweizen.  11.2 ounce bottle from Total Wine in Tustin ($1.79).  Pours a hazy amber with three fingers of white foam.  The nice aroma is sweet with strong notes of (Belgian?) yeast and also fruity esters (banana, lemon zest) and spice (black pepper and possibly clove).  Flavor is full of banana mainly along with lighter notes of fruit, wheat, and spice.  Light body with a dry-ish finish.  (918, 310)

pours with a creamy head and cloudy yellow. good carbonation. yeasty, doughy, some banana with a hint of cloves. belgian yeast like characters. some lemon marangue pie notes in there as well. big flavours.
taste is very fruity and orange cake like. bready, vanilla bean. maybe would have like a little bit more on the mid palate but great brew.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2010 Location: Tap at The Brass Rail,  5/19/10


Aroma: Orange, wheat, banana, peach, spice, clove, and some bubble gum

Appearance: Hazy orange color, lasting white head and good amount of lace

Flavor: Medium-heavy sweet, wheat, yeast, flavorful, but fairly typical of style

Palate: Light-medium body, a touch of dust on the mouth, but a decent feel

Overall Impression: 
Wow, how have I never rated this?   A quite solid, hefe, nothing over-the-top spectacular, but solid and drinkable none-the-less.

A: Cloudy orange and poured with a large bright white head that perfectly rose to the top of the weizen glass. Theres a moderate to heavy level of carbonation and the beer has good head retention.

S: There is a moderate aroma of bananas in the nose  hints of cloves.

T: Like the smell, there are lots of banana flavors in the taste, which is mildly sweet. The finish is creamy and lingers nicely with a touch of wheat present.

M: The beer feels light bodied and rather effervescent on the palate.

D: This beer goes down very easily and is so thirst quenching that I could drink them all day long. This is a great bear to session.
Pours nice golden color in glass with white head. Nose and taste of lemons, vanilla and banana. Some wheats and honey. Rated 6/29/2000

Pours yellow orange with a foamy white head that disappears quickly. The aroma is spicy with clove and pepper. Theres some sweet bubblegum and banana in the background as well. The flavor is spicy with yeast and clove and finishes with banana and bubblegum. The flavors are very big and intense.
Hazy pale gold; thick, creamy head; foamy lacing.  Hints of banana, clove, wheat, and lemon.  Well balanced taste with yeast, wheat, banana, and spice elements.  Creamy, medium-bodied.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of moderate banana, bubblegum, wheat, light citrus, and clove.  It pours a dull cloudy orangish-yellow with a two finger head that is somewhat fizzy and diminishes within thirty seconds or so.  The flavor starts with moderate banana.  The finish has light-moderate citrus, wheaty tanginess, and a hint of clove.  Faint bubblegum comes more in the aftertaste.  Its medium bodied with lively carbonation (can border on prickly at times), but somehow the mouthfeel still remains mostly creamy.

Cloudy yellow pour with a creamy white head. The aroma is great with malt, banana and other spices. The flavor is very nice with the banana and spices coming through. The finish is excellent. Very crisp and clean with a dry finish.

On tap at the Churchkey in DC. Hazy yellow orange pour with a thin white head. Aroma is lemon, citrus, some grain. A little bit sweet on the flavor, some good wheat character from the yeast. Nice beer.

Pours a hazy yellow/orange color with a large white head.  Aroma of banana, sugar, clove.  Strong clove presence throughout.  Some banana and bubblegum as well, but they fade rather quick.  Finish is cloves and some bitterness.  Pretty solid hefeweizen.

Pours a hazy gold, with a nice white head that leaves great lacing.  Aroma consists of banana, citrus, lemon and wet hay.  Taste is fantastic, sweet with the banana coming through and a hint of bubblegum.  Almost a creamy mouthfeel, very refreshing.  One of the best hefes out there.

50cl Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Hazy golden yellow colour, big white head. Aroma of banana, some more ethanolic esters, light hops, wheat. Flavour is light sweet, wheat, banana, light grainy, CO2 bitterness in the finish. Light bodied, firm carbonation. Refreshing, decent, but not outstanding imo.

Pours a very hazy very bright very yellow, & very light color with a big head that really recedes into nothing in a hurry.  Aroma is big and nice with some banana & some nice spiciness, some light lemon zest and lots of yeast notes. I swear I detect a hint of smokiness in the aroma which is weird but works really dang well alongside the other things going on here. Flavor is drier than one usually expects for the style but most certainly does not take away from the classic flavors of a hefe, the banana and clove are there but theyre not accompanied by the remarkable fruitiness or the normal residual sweetness that so many beers in this style lean on. Instead these flavors are complimented by a strong yeasty character, white bread crust,  and some nice mild citrus rind notes.  Please dont get me wrong I love Franziskaner and I love Weihenstephaner but this seems a lot drier than those ones and that seems to set it apart as a hefeweizen. With that I can say that it lacks a bit of the complexity that those beers have as well. This is one remarkably well made beer that while very enjoyable could benefit from a bit more complexity.

Sweet candy aroma of bananas and cloves. Poured the classic hazy yellow that every good Hefe should have with a medium-sized white head that left no lacing. Sweet malty flavors of banana and bubblegum with a creamy mouthfeel. Another great beer from Ayinger, and one of the best German Hefeweizens that Ive ever had.

Bottle.

Pours hazy golden with creamy head.

Refreshing taste of wheat and fruits.

Bottle. Pours yellow, cloudy with a white head. Sweet citrus, candy banana and vegtables in aroma.The taste has got some heavy malt at first, then very fruity (apricot). Well balanced, thirst quenching.
aroma of banana milk shake, with mild clove- refreshing, drinkable, a wonderful example.

Poured from .5 L bottle.  I drank this after having a Julius Echter weiss beer and I must say, this one didnt keep up in the comparison.  Ayinger makes a very good weiss beer, but it appeared to me to be more rich in malt than the standard pronounced fruity notes of banana mixed with clove that Ive come to expect in weiss beers.

This is one of most pleasing beers I have ever had with superb champagne taste (to borrow the reference notes) in a Hefeweizen style. I admired the deep characteristics and quietly wished that I could brew something like this.
Using the correct glassware makes a big difference with this ale for the sweet aroma and the narrowing taste.

500 ml. bottle.  Pours murky light amber, peaches and cream like color, with medium-sized white head, which is soon reduced to almost nothing.  Aroma of honeysuckle, white grape, lemon.  Lightly spiced yeast / wheat flavor with notes of lemon sourness.  Palate cleansing with wheat on the finish.  Very drinkable, medium-bodied, with high carbonation.  A damn good hefe.
pours hazy golden rod with a pillowy white head.  Warm, citrus aroma with some yeast.  Flavor is oranges, yeast, banana and clove. finishes a bit cheesy.  Nice Hefe
Pours hazy yellow-orange with a fading white head. Aroma-banana, clove, yeast, grainy wheat. Tastes just like it smells plus nice carbonation, classic hefeweizen; excellent beer.

500ml bottle.  Pours a light golden color with a foamy white head.  Smell has a pleasant banana and lemon with a hint of clove.  The flavor is very wheat forward, with less banana and clove than expected. Still very enjoyable and very drinkable.
On tap at The Taphouse, pours a beautiful hazy golden yellow. Aroma of citrus and wheat. Flavour of citrus, wheat, yeast and mild banana. Awesome hefe.

nice golden yellow pour with a rich white head. The head shrinks down a bit and the color darkens slightly as you drink. Smell of wheat, citrus, mild banana. Medium body, but very flavorful. Taste of yeast, citrus, banana, and a hint of caramel. Nice carbonation. Definitely a good hefe.

Ayinger Brau-Weisse to me is the perfect German wheat, the aroma is fantastic. Bubble gum, banana, wheat very nice. Cloudy, light straw colored with great C02 and an easy drinker. Flavor cant be beat by any other German wheat in my opinion, bready and very refreshing.

Bottle served in a Weizen glass. An agressive pour leaves nearly all head. It quickly shapes to a murky orange-yellow with an short white head. Aroma of sweet wheat and citrus. Stylish, but not overly complex. Lightly sweet and dry flavor. Medium body, lively carbonation, The medium length finish is sticky and dry. Good hefe.

perfect color and aroma of citrus zest, coriander, and some banana, taste is the same, very refreshing and thirst quenching after some buffalo tenders. in my humble opinion, the wheat beers of germany are the perfect session beers, they dont get annoying in taste, and they dont fill you up, and this is a perfect example of that.
Draft. Pours orange with a big white head. Flavor is banana, clove, corriander with a slightly dry yeasty finish. Delicious.

500 mL bottle from Vintage Cellar. Pours a hazy yellow color with a large head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma is yeast and bready with citrus and caramel notes. Taste is bread, caramel, yeast, citrus, banana and a spicy finish. Medium bodied.
bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  cloudy white with a white head.  banana, cloves and lemon.  smooth palate, huge clove up front and a lemony finish.
(500ml bottle) Pours cloudy orange with nice thick creamy head. Nose of banana, clove, cinnamon and lemon. Taste is ripe banana, lemon, clove and a very dry cinnamon/creamy finish.
A cloudy golden pour- big white head- taste of banana, clove . Smooth and refreshing finish

Bottle from Kenny Road Market, poured into Weizen glass. Appearance is golden with a fluffy cloud of white head. Aroma is banana, lemon, and clove like most hefeweizens. Flavor is pretty typical too. The palate is the highlight of this beer; its creamy while still being crisp and refreshing. What it lacks in complexity it makes up in mouthfeel. Id like to retry this during the summer.
Bottle at Winking Lizard Crosswoods. Cloudy yellow pour with a huge white head. Typical weizen nose of banana, clove and wheat malt. Flavor is about the same, but has a crispness I can appreciate.

MMM this stuff is delicious. Had it out of the 500 ml bottle. Pours a light yellow with a soft head that takes a little while to die. No intense tastes here, but a great aroma from the malt and spicy banana and cloves from the hops. Pretty cheap bottle for being so tasty, too.

Hazy yellow color, moderate, longlasting white head; aroma of wheat and sour citrus and banana; mouthfeel is decent with just right amount of carbonation in a medium body; a bit sour flavor of wheat, lemon and some banana; very refreshing.

Beer poured a hazy yellow with a large, fluffy white head. Lots of fruit in the aroma, with some lemon as well as the expected banana. The flavor is very wheat forward, with less banana and clove than I expected. Still very enjoyable and very drinkable. Not as good as some other German hefeweizens that I have had, but still a very good, above average beer.
bottle - pours hazy yellow with a fluffy white head, not much too add...typical Weisse aroma and taste a little on the bready / spicy side. Nice refreshing weizen.
Its simply another fantastic hefe, characteristic hazy gold color, banana scent and citursy/banana flavor.  Very enjoyable, and its great that it comes in a 25oz bottle!

Poured cloudy yellow with a substantial white head.
Bananas, wheat, lemon, spice.
Think maybe the keg was old, but it tasted a little off.
Shared this one w/SkyCop 32. Pours a hazy golden yellow. Aromas of bread/grains/ and some citrus. Had a taste of cheerios with some lemon or orange.
Cloudy look, golden in color, and it has a a nice white head.  The smell is yeast, wheat, lemon, citrus, and malts.  The taste is about the same as the smell with a little floral thrown in .
very good hefe....light sitrus taste with classic hefe flavor, finishes clean and crisp

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2011 Aroma is mild noble hops, very pale malt, subtle alcohol esters, and a hint of sweet oak.
Appearance is translucent light gold.
Taste is very pale malt, tart wheat, estery alcohol, sweet oak, and yeast-bite.
Body is medium but sticky.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 Very good hefe weisse! Poured with a nice white head and a little lace. Color is a cloudy (yeast) amber. Aroma is malty, wheat, vanilla, honey, spice, and bananas. Lemon really shows up in the flavor which is satisfying and thirst quenching. Nice sweet- tart interplay. Excellent body and carbonation. Super drinkable. Clean finish. Absolutely a session beer.

(Bottle) Pours hazy golden with a fluffy head. The aroma is fantastic - lots of incense  and clove-like phenols alongside banana, peach and strawberry esters. Rader floral as well. Bubblegum. The flavour is light sweet, light bitter and tiny acidic. Typical esters and phenols. Nice pale wheat character. The mouthfeel is clean and light acidic tart with medium carbonation. Tiny citric in the finish. Light to medium bodied.

Bottle.  Banana/Citrus aroma- hazy golden body with a medium fluffy head. Flavor is filled with hints of banana and sweetness, but not as sweet as others... nice carbonation with a dry finish...  could easily drink a lot of these

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2011 Refigerated 16.9 oz glass bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours hazy golden with fluffy white head.  Really good small bubble lacing, medium body, and medium carbonation.  This hefeweizens flavor is dominated by slightly tart banana, some zesty lemon, and a hint of clove.  Very refreshing, and one fo the best hefeweizens I have had.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2010 Pours a bright gold with abundant carbonation and head into a Sierra Nevada weizen.  Aroma of yeasty esters and sweetgrass.  Taste is pretty much the same; Sweet grassy flavors with yeasty muskiness and some honey sweetness.  Light banana-yeasty finish.  I’m not really a hef guy myself, picked it up because I’d heard good things.  Good, but not impressive by any means.
Pours hazy yellow with a foamy white head. Looks the way weiss beer should. Fresh aroma with notes of citrus and lots of banana. Rich full flavour. Lots of banana flavour, slightly spicy. Nice Weiss.
Hazy golden beer with a strong head that leaves lots of lace. The scent is refreshingly fruity and a little yeasty. The taste has some more refreshing fruits and slight hints of vanilla.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2009 Beer from Gillys.

I am a fan of hefeweizens..and wow, this is one good beer.

Sweet aroma, nice hazy appearance for a hefeweizen.  Taste is exactly what a hefeweizen should be.

I need to go back and get more of this beer.

Update:  Had a draft of this beer at Pizza Paradiso on 11/06/09 - this beer is better as a bottle.

Poured a hazy gold with a thick, lasting white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, bread, and a little citrus.  The flavor has a lot of spicy yeast notes, sweet citrus, with bread and wheat malt.  This is the best hefeweizen Ive had so far.
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2010 From bottle; nice golden brown color. Subtle spice and citrus notes with a hint of banana. Very easy drinking. One of my favorite Weisse beers

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 Pours a hazy yellow-bronze with a fluffy white head.  aroma is banana, yeast, citrus, and bread.  flavor is of banana, yeast, bubble gum, clove, lemon, bread, wheat,  and some other fruits.  as a bone dry sweet finnish similar to a champagne.  overall, I really like this hefes nice tart dryness and wonderful banana and yeast flavors.

Pours golden bronze.  Very heavy nice yeast notes and flavors.  One hell of a hefe!  Zest and fruit with a strong citrus character that makes you happy a great mid day beer or anytime in the spring.  Great with bread and jam.

The beer pours out a cloudy golden-orange color with a fluffy white 1" head.  Lots of banana, wheat, yeast and caramel in the aroma.  Bubblegum, wheat, yeast and banana in the flavor.  A nice traditional hefe, and really refreshing.
Poured hazy pastel yellow, citrus yeasty, bready, little bannana, little spice.

very pale cloudy light yellow pour. hardly any head...but what is there is a nice white color. wonderful banana and citrus notes on the nose. Delicious. Banana and bread really come through this one and it is wonderful on the palate. nice smooth mouth feel.

bought this stuff today because i have not had it in about a year. one of the best hefes on the planet in my opinion. fruity and zesty and not overly floral and tart. everything about this stuff amazing, super refreshing and a worldy staple in good hefes today.
50cl bottle, Alko. Citrus, banana in taste, excellent wheat beer with a great aftertaste. Quite easy to drink. Large almost fluffy head. A favourite!

From the 330 ml. bottle with no lot code or expiration date.  It pours a straw yellow with lively carbonation, haziness, and a consistent frothy white head.  The aroma is of wheat, honey, spices, and hops.  The mouthfeel is creamy.  The taste is full of wheat, thin hops, and tart.  A neat Hefe.
I probably needed an orange, but other than that it wasnt too bad. Lots of head, it was out of control. Nice wheat and lemon flavors.

Wheat beer glass @ Tylers Apex. Good aroma, sweet. Wheat, banana, mild spice. Cloudy, pale yellowy gold, color. Ok head & lace. Sweet sharp flavor. Like aroma. Lite body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, dry sweet finish. Tasty, real easy to drink, Id say i like the aroma a little more than flavor, got a little more out of it, though not a significant difference. Might even bring me around to Hefes.....
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2011 re rate 03/11

I am right; everyone else is wrong - this is slightly below average hefe; nothing to see here...

cloudy opaque golden yellow,

some citrus  and wheat in taste
,light bodied palate and light mild hops

will try again as my rating seems low compared to others

Draft at Capones. Pours a cloudy yellow with a slightly thin looking large fluffy white head. Aroma of lemon, wheat, grass and slight corriander. Thinner bodied with average to lively carbonatin. Initial flavor had a large burst of vanilla Carvel soft serve ice cream but that fades wheat and grass with some light lemon and corriander notes. Very enjoyable and excellently done.

Bottle poured into a logoed wheat beer glass produced a thick, white, and long-lasting head with a translucent bright yellow body.  Sweet, creamy, and delicious.  One of the better wheat beers Ive had the pleasure to  drink.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow color with a thick white long lasting big head.  It has the aroma of banana and bread.  It has a delicious creamy lemon and banana with vanilla taste and a wonderful wheat aftertaste. This is a great beer and I would love to drink more of it.

Will pour a five+ finger cream head if you arent careful and it fades slowly to a thin layer leaving some lace. Cloudy amber color with some yeast left in bottle. Medium carbonation and medium bodied.  Lemon/yeast nose. Flavor is lightly sweet lemon and with some yeast, smooth.  $2.25 for a 330ml bottle from Beverage Warehouse Winooski, VT.

Colore giallo biondo e velato, Schiuma abbondante. Aroma speziato forte, con alcune note di agrumi. Sapore di malto,abbastanza buono,un pò zuccherino,frumento e speziato. Una tra le weizen migliori che ho assaggiato

Bottle:  Dark straw colored pour with a finger of white head.  Nose is rich with wheat, yeast, cloves, florals, and citrus.  The taste is indeed crisp with wheat and a lively yeast component.  Lighter in the florals, just a hint of cloves, and some dry lingering citrus in the tail.  Nice.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a very large sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a hazy softly carbonated yellow-white colored body. The mild aroma was malty spicy and banana. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a mellow fruity aftertaste. The yummy flavor contained notes of malt hops banana and floral. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.

500 ml bottle bought at the Utah State Store on Foothill Dr. Pours a fairly cloudy orange color with a very large foamy white head. The aroma is lots of lemons, yeast, citrus and light malts- some spices as well. The flavor is crisp and clean; dry fruity flavors, yeast, loads of spices, light wheat and very clean water. Very nice and extremely drinkable. Once again, I really enjoy the quality, clean, and drinkability of German beer.

Pours a heavy ripe banana/dark golden yellow color with a really large frothy white head that slowly fades into a solid, lasting cap that leaves chunks of soapy lacing in its path.

Slightly sour citrus aroma with lots of ripe banana, lemon and orange peel, corriander, zest and pepper notes. Lots of bready/yeast and subtle clove presence.

Smooth crisp and refreshing wheat beer with a nice medium yeasty/bread body with a very nice citrus/lemon peel and ripe banana flavor balanced out by some peppery zest, corriander and clove spice.

bottle 500 ml from Alko  2,78  EXP 01 10 hazy dark yellow huge head when pouring and  fall in love fruit fly on it when pouring. Taste: banana kicks first then citrus and tickling  dry spicyness. Pleasant aftertaste.
An unclear golden beer with a 3 finger head. Aroma was banana, & wheat. Taste was wheat, banana, acidic, & a little watery.
Havent had this one in a great long time.  A nice solid brew that meets the standards and is alright.
light cloudy gold color, great floral/citrus aroma! i mean great aroma. nice refreshing citrus taste, idont like hefeweizen but i would drin k this one all summer.

.5L Bottle. Pours a hazy golden with a thick white head. Aroma is quite nice: bananas, bubblegum and clove. Taste is also banana, sweet bubblegum with citrus notes. Some tartness on the palate. I was not impressed by this beer like I was by Hacker-Pschorr (Hefe) Weisse. But again,  Im not really into  wheats.
Another great example of a bavarian white beer.  I have had better form the region, but still a decent beer for the rate. Quite drinkable.

Hazy yellow-orange pour with tremendous head response.  Pasty scent with banana-hefe scent.  Little spice on the nose though.  Has a nice natural citrus flavor of orange.  Some dry wheaty elements can also be tasted.  Much better than others I have tried.  Even better with an orange slice.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2010 500 ml bottle in Germany. Gldlen color with an off white head. Aroma was top banana even for a Hefe. A superior Hefe very smooth. One of the best.

From the bottle, pours a hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is quite nicely strongly bananas. Like banana pudding. Taste is very similar. Theres a bit of sourness in the aftertaste that prevents a better rating, but still a pretty good beer.
Bottle.  Pours an orange body with a white head.  Sweet citrus wheat notes, lighter spices, hints of banana and bubble gum.  Sweet a bit bread y decent.
Bottle @ Metro Billiards. 5.1%. Cloudy yellow pour with a frothy white foam. Aroma is sweet, citrusy. Taste is very sweet and dry, quite impressive. An excellent Hefeweizen.

cloudy yellow pour, frothy white head.  aroma is spicy, zesty lemon, orange peel, and wheat.  a bit of honey as well.  mouthfeel is effervescent. flavor is nice wheat with some honey, lemon, cinnamon and vanilla.  Really yummy
Cloudy thick yellow color with a tall white head.  Aroma of spice, orange, and wheat.  Balanced flavor of wheat, citrus and spice.  Very nice beer for a hef.
Has a nice cloudy yellow color.  Smells mostly of citrus and malts.  Taste is full of fruits but very smooth.  Leaves nothing much in an aftertaste.  An overall pretty good brew.
While the aroma is not the "delicious"-ness that the commercial description suggests, it does make up for it with a good taste overall.
Bottle. Unclear yellow body. Head is medium white. In the is is hay, clove and light banana. Flavour is sweet malt, hay and lots of banana. Medium bodied. Average Hefeweizen.

Hazy yellow-gold weisse capped with perfect dense, white head served in weizen glass. Banana, peach and yeasty esters with a hint of cloves in the nose. Sweet subacid fruits in the fore-palate, blending into sweet sourdough bread and finishing with cloves and light citrus. Body is smooth, light and effervescent. A refreshing and extremely well-balanced beer.
We are a group of frineds that taste 8 beers evey thursday in honolulu, hawaii.  We rate the beers on our own personal scales as well as the one created on this web site.

Tap @ Aying. Pours hazy dark yellow with a creamy head and lacings. Lots of sweet and fresh banana and herbs in the nose. Smooth and full body. Well balanced flavor. Nice and one of the better HefeWeizens ive had!

Bottled at The Oak Barrel, Vantaa Airport, Finland.  Cloudy golden, creamy head. Peachy yeasty bandaid and banana esters. Medium sweet with mild custardy malt. Gently spritzy and creamy with good balance between esters and malt. Refreshing!
Hazy golden color with great think white head. Strong banana and citrus aroma. Great and extraordinary drinkable flavor of white, clean fruits, subdued spices, and nice bright citrus overtones.
Pretty solid, light honey flavor, and some tartness.  Clean, refreshing, slight fruitiness to it, slihgly yeasty.  a bit dry.

Pretty damn good Wiesse beer.  Good cloudy color, ok aroma,  but solid wheaty flavor.  So far- the best Wiesse beer available in my area (which has limited access to imports).  Would fair mediocre in a list of solid bavarian Wiesse biers-

Bottle. Pours with a great yellow and hazy color. Wonderful aromas of grass, bubblegum (wintergreen) and spices. Great flavors of gum, banana, cloves and other spices. very smooth, with an intense soapiness in the finish.

11.2oz bottle.  murky yellow pour with a smallish bright-white head.  aroma of banana, pineapple, spices and yeast.  good smooth taste of wheat, clove and banana.  light citrus acidity in the finish.  good crisp summer brew.

On tap, 1/2 liter poured into Weizen. Golden brown color with moderate slowly dissolving head. Very complex fruity aroma, scent of banana and clove. Taste is similar with a very refreshing flavor of spring water. Extremely crisp and refreshing. Definitely one of my favorite Hefeweizens.

Hazy golden with a white head. Nice fruity banana bread aromas. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Same banana bread yeastiness in the flavor with cloves and honey malt sweetness. Great brew for a hot summers afternoon.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Lightly hazy yellow with a white cover.  Banana aroma, bubblegum, cloves.  Sweet fruity malt, bananas/bubblegum and a light spice finish.

500 ml bottle. Finland.
Hazy pale orange-yellow colour with white medium-size head. Banana, citrus, wheat, vanilla, spices and caramel in aroma. Fruity, wheaty and caramel sweet flavour with some spices. Smooth. Excellent Weißbier.

Nice aroma of lemon and wheat with a smooth hint of vanilla underneath. Flavor is pretty complex for a hefe, with fruit notes of lemon, orange and banana; spices of coriander, pepper and anise; some undetermined herb/floral components underneath it all. Mouthfeel is quite carbonated with a smooth finish. One of the better hefes.
banana, citrus aroma , pale, hazy, rocky head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, long finish, lively,
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Midtown. Pours a hazy orange amber with a huge white head, which is the typical appearance of a hefe. Aroma of citrus and wheat malts. Lighter side of medium bodied with a nice refreshing mountfeel. Flavor of pale wheat malts, citrus, banana, and pineapple, countered by a very subtle spiciness. Semi dry yeasty finish with some lingering clove. A little light on the sweetness and could use more banana bubblegum characteristics for my personal tastes- but then I have no idea how long this bottle was sitting on the shelves. Overall, a solid hefe and I am rather picky.
Pours light yellow with thick white head.  Aromas of bananas and pineapple and flavors of orange and lemon.  Bubbly on the palate with crisp clean finish.  Great summer beer.

Pale blonde pour into thick, pillowy white head that dissipates into a pool of bubbly foam on top of the glass. Carbonated bubbles rise into a ring of melting lacing. Aroma of yeasty bread and lemon citrus. Initial flavor of sweet malt with brief hints of banana bread in the finish.

On tap @ the Map Room; hazy, murky dull yellow w/ a beautiful cream white head; aroma has clear-cut banana, cloves, bready-ness and a little citrus; flavors are more of the same w/ a little more sugar; extremely refreshing and easy-drinking- medium in the mouth. Very nicely done hefeweizen

Tasted this at the Emmetts Tavern in West Dundee quarterly beer tasting. Pours a light cloudy yellow with a great head and high carbonation.  Aroma is mostly cloves, light fruit note with a solid yeast and wheat presence. Flavor was pretty dull.  Spices werent as prevalent as in the nose, almost no discernible fruitiness and yeast tasted as if it was an old bottle where autolysis might of started to kick in creating a dulled characteristic. Carbonation was great and very effervescent but I just wish the flavor was there for the bubbles to carry.

From a bottle at The Flying Saucer.  Poured a hazy yellow with a nice white head.  Aroma of yeast, wheat, citrus and spice.  Taste of banana and lemon along with cloves, yeast and some balancing malt.  Tart, refreshing finish.  Nice hefe.

The beer pours a cloudy pale straw yellow and appears browner where the glass gets wider, the one inch of snow white head lasted almost the entire glass and left some nice lacing. Im not sure if I got an old bottle or if this beer is suppose to be like this but the aroma was terrible, a very sharp sent what I can only describe as compost and a very strong sour cherry smell was coming from my glass. Luckily the beer tasted better then the smell. A chalky banana flavor with lots of smooth grassy malts, and a touch of citrus make up most of the flavor, theres something a little off in the taste of this hefe. The more I drink the more bread I can taste, and as the beer warms more banana flavor comes out. I cant decide if I like or dislike this beer, I think Ill settle on liking this beer but not a great hefe and probably wont drink again."

Bottle. Pours a very cloudy pale yellow, with a huge, frothy white head that laces respectably. Nose is full of BANANAS!, sweet lemons, yeast, underripe stone fruits, and coriander. Palate is more banana, with the citrus and a very creamy mouthfeel coming into play. The banana and lemon become more candied as the beer warms, with the yeast and wheat both showing well. A cracking good hefe, though I would have liked a little more hop presence.

Mmmmmm..beer that looks like chicken broth - solid thick goodness! More like a fresh squeezed juice (pinapple) but a bit on the brown side. Huge head that was poured didnt last leaving no more than a ring - more than enough to constantly stick to the glass. Massive banana aroma smells just like the dehydrated candied ones taste, mild spices and a soft pleasant wheat puts it all together. Has a light tangy taste, soft bananas and a healthy ammount of yeast. Adequate carbonation leaves the tongue somewhat tingly with a soft, yeasty finish. Be warned though, this beer has an overall banana quality that can be a bit overpowering. highly drinkable even if it is a little too gassy.

Draught at Capones:  Aroma of dust, brown paper bag, slight lemon, and a hint of wheat.  Poured dark yellow/flaxen in color with a small, dense, white head that lasted throughout.  Very hazy.  Slightly sparkling.  Ok lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet.  Tastes of wheat, yeast, slight spices, slight coriander, banana, and bubblegum.  Light to medium body.  Slightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Yeast, wheat, and light spice finish.  Not bad for a German Hefe, but I prefer the somewhat bolder US versions.

500ml bottle at home. Pours a hazy orange/golden color with a nice white head. Aroma is very fruity with mostly banana. Flavor is sweet with some banana and yeast, palate is quite carbonated but still very well balanced. A good hefeweizen that goes well on a warm summer day.

Bottle- pours a very cloudy golden amber color. Solid white head. Scents of banana, citrus and clove. Flavors of the same with hints of lemon and grapefruit. Very carbonated, almost a tad much for me. Good Hefe overall.

Pours a beautiful hazy peach with huge frothy white head that lingers nicely. Aroma is loaded with grapefruit and lemon citrus, in addition to yeasty spice such as clove and banana. Flavor is an incredible balance of citrus sweetness and caramel malt. Very floral and sweet, finishing with lingering citrus. Palate is very rich for the style, starting creamy and finishing dry and clean. Amazing example of the style.
Pours a nice cloudy golden yellow, nice bright white head. Smells of wheat, citrus, and spices. Very good Weisse.

Bottle (Alko). Pours dark yellowish and very hazy, in my opinion almost too hazy. Head is quite thick but doesnt leave much lacing. Quite rounded aroma is lightly, sweetly fruity, yeasty, tangy spicy, lightly hopped and naturally wheaty. Lightly fruity flavor is somewhat sour, yeasty and in the aftertaste dry and well-hopped. Abundant carbonation is refreshing.

Great aroma of fruit and honey. Excellent mouthfeel. Medium bodied and not too bready as far as hefeweizens go. Really a classic fruity-spicy hefe. Highly recommend.

Enjoyed at Nicks on Central Ave, Newark.

Pours cloudy golden color with beautiful white head.

Nose is typical banana clove, with more clove than usual. Citrus & bread are present as well.  The aromas come up like fresh bread straight from the oven.

Palate is a somewhat light bodied, highly carbonated, with fresh bready banana clove, maybe some papermill or other industrial flavors as well (in a good way).  Light, refreshing hefe.

Excellent example of the style, but not the best imported Hefe-Weizen Ive sampled.

Bottle 50cl. Pours a muddy pale brew with firm and stable white head. Nice carbonisation, refreshing. Great performance. Round and typical yeasty impression, typical for the style but more complex fruit and malt components than other Hefeweizen. Refreshing and complex at the same time, thats a masterpiece. A great brew from a great brewery.

Pours a hazy whiteish yellow with a nice frothy white head. Aroma is intense for a wheat. Bright banana and bubblegum jump out first with coriander, flowers, and clove. Tastes very fresh and crisp. This thing is like all the wheat beers Ive tried all rolled into one beer. This is awesome! Bubblegum, banana, spices, citrus, and yeast. Mouth feel is light and refreshing. Excellent beer, best weise Ive had to date.

50cl bottle.   Opaque yellow with a frothy white head.   Wheat, cream, banana and clove in the aroma.   The flavor is lightly tangy and sweet with a crisp and lightly spicy finish.   Light bodied with lots of carbonation.   As expected, this pretty much nails the style, with a good amount of subtlety and restraint in the yeast department, adding to the refreshment factor.   You can tell that this would be much better still on its home turf.

Pours a golden yellow color with a white head. Aromas of clove and bananas dominate the nose.Very crisp  banana flavor that is quite dry.Nice aftertaste as well. Not my favorite style, but I could drink more of this!

Lovely big head that fades pretty fast.  Cloudy, tan pour and a pleasant, tangy aroma.  Fairly light and sweet hefe flavor with some nuttiness and a touch of salt. Not my favorite from Ayinger or my top hefe, but still a very nice brew.

Aroma is tons of bananas and cream with a slight acidity and wheatiness.
Taste is crisp, low ph, yeast, and lemon.
Finish is creamy, and touches of caramel.
Solid

Poured a medium orange with a murky dark orange "yeast bomb".   Off-white head that dissapated quickly.  Aroma: slightly musty and spicy.  Taste:  strong clove and pepper with faint citrus.  As the beer warmed, the taste of banana increased and the spice mellowed.  Virtually no finish to speak of.   One of the better Hefeweizens Ive had.
Cloudy straw pour, frothy head, medium lace. Sweet, biscuity aroma. Tastes like a tripel, some cinnamon and citrus fruits. Sweet wheat, thick. Very tasty beer, drink again.

Hazy yellow color with a sizable fluffy white head that does not last. Aroma is very nice - bannana, cloves, lemon and spice. Taste is the same. Thin body with plenty of prickly carbonation. Drinkable and enjoyable.

500 ml bottle from GM Liquors. Nose of bananas, yeast, floral hops, light vanilla and cloves. Murky gold with a big, lightly lacing white head. Flavor is pepperiness, banana, an oaky vanilla woodiness that is very light and appears more as it warms. Finish is very light bitterness with residual yeastiness.
500ml bottle. Pours cloudy, a great true hefe with one of the smoothest finishes I have ever enjoyed.

bottle, labelled Bräu-Weisse. Cloudy yellow colour, large head. Fruity nose. Full-bodied, malty with nice banana accents and a pleasant citrusy fruityness, balanced with very shy hints of caramel. Pleasantly yeasty.

500 ml bottle. Hazy yellow colour, big white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana and citrus fruits. The flavour is wheaty, malty, a little sweet, wiht yeast, banana, citrus and spices. Medium-bodied and richly carbonated. Very enjoyable.
Bottle:  Golden colored pour with off white head.  Sweet, yeasty aroma.  Fruity, light citrusy flavor.  I enjoyed this.
Bottle. A pretty good example of the style. A little heavy on the lemon, but otherwise not bad.

16.9 ounce bottle - $3.29 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a dark, straw-colored body with a medium-sized, fluffy, white head.

Smell: Fragrant aroma smelling sweetly of banana juice, malted wheat, clove, vanilla, and a tiny bit of lemon pith.

Taste: Lightly tangy malted with a touch of honeyed sweetness. Spicy clove and nutmeg hits next, with tastes of banana, vanilla, and faintly tart citrus following in tow. Even a splash of pineapple and floral hints midway. Mild hops and accompanying bitterness. Slight touch of acidity. Finishes semi-dry and quite crisp with a lingering taste of grainy wheat bread.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high carbonation. Overall spritzy mouthfeel.

Drinkability: An altogether classic German hefeweizen which would probably be even better out in the hot summer sun.
Superbly creamy, frothy, fruity (banana and bubble gum), and tasting of wheat malt, balanced and very German heffe.
First beer from Ayinger. Was good all the way around. Nice color and went down smoothly. Had a nice bite to it without being overly dominating.
Hazy yellow with a good foamy head. Lemon. lots of salt.Vanilla, but very artificial. champagne-like. interesting but not very delicious.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a medium white head. Aroma is wheat, banana with hints of yeast. The flavour is wheaty with notes of banana and citrus.

Sipped on this one while playing bocce with brickstoredave at Leons Full Service.  Life is good...

Pours a very hazy golden yellow with a huge puffy white head that lasts for ages and leaves great lacing.

The aroma is classic hefe with a massive banana sweetness with only hints of spices in the background.

Taste follows the aroma and is, once again, textbook hefe with a huge bubblegum and banana sweetness with hints of lemony hops up front and spices in the finish.

The mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with tons of carbonation and very smooth.

To call this one drinkable would be an understatement.  Its an exceptionally easy beer to drink and one of the best examples of the style Ive had.  Highly recommended!

Pours a cloudy off lemon color with lots of white head, lacing, and lots of carb action.

Banana, lemon, and bready aroma with some accomodating hops in the background.

Very refreshing bready, slightly lemony, and banana flavor. The bready grain wheat flavor in the background has hints of vanilla and bubblegum. 

The palate is light to medium bodied with a fluffy crisp smoothness.

Very drinkable I can drink this all day.

A- Pours a cloudy opaque golden yellow, head is white and creamy froth that is mostly diminishing, minimal lacing on the glass
