S- Nose is light and crisp, fruit and floral tones with banana, wheat, and spices standing out
T- Initial taste is a prickly and dry banana sensation followed by ebbs of spice and citrus tones, some mild trace of bubblegum and wheat, finishes with a brief hint of dry bitterness
M- Light-bodied beer, carbonation is lively, bubbly, and well-suited for this style
D- Smooth and easy-to-drink hefe that has a bit more complexity and spice than others, this feels like a prototypical hefeweizen that captures the essence of the style very nicely without being to rigid/boring

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2009 Appearance:  quite pale, straw; Enormous, textbook, white, fluffy head; moderate haze

Aroma:  Good complexity; Textbook banana and clove; moderate, well-balanced wheat along with subtle vanilla

Flavor:  Banana and clove are once again the strongest components, but not out of balance; the vanilla from the nose remains in the background

Palate:  Great, long finish!  Great way to end a fundamentally sound beer!

Excellent wheat beer. Has all the notes its supposed to: fruity, yeasty, and that nice nose that good wheat beers have. If you like the style, this is a superb example: if you dont like this beer, then you dont like the style.
A great wheat brew... more crisp than id anticipated. yum, a great fruity taste and finish ill be buying again soon.

verry nice beer plesant scent flavour look and feel. Definately flavourfull to many flavours to mention, definately wheaty, spice, vanilla fruitty. beautifull cloudy light gold color. A damn good beer.

From the Jupiter brewfest.  Cloudy gold with a nice white head.  Aroma is so nice and full of wheat, yeast, bread, fruit, spices and I really get som honey and gum notes.  Flavor follows suit with banana bread, gum, spices, yeast, wheat.  What a nice beer.

Its pretty much a coin toss between this one and Weihenstephaner as my fav Hefeweizen. Beautiful appearance in the glass. Very pronounced in both flavour and smell. Wheat, yeast, malts, banana, cloves, bubblegum, honey, citrus, lemon. Excelllent is every aspect.
Bottle.  Pours a white head with a hazy golden color.  Smells of clove and banana.  Tastes of banana and clove.  Decent finish.

Pours a hazy pale gold with a 3 finger foamy white head that has decent retention. Aroma is of lemon, banana pudding with vanilla wafers and a sprinkling of buttersoctch on top, tart wheaty malt and some fruity esters. Flavor has plenty of yeast, slightly spicy clove banana, a little bubblegum if I search for it and some really nice raspberry like fruitiness. There is a decent amount of lemony, wheat malt and some floury buttered bread notes like a creme horn pastry filled with honey wheat bread, finish is danish with fresh berries and lemon instead of jam. Body is medium thin, dry and astringent, with and unusually dry but fruity finish with a hint of clove and lots of strawberry-banana juice. Definitely one of my favorite Hefe’s that I havent had in too long.

Not your typical hefeweizen by any means. Beautiful golden orange color with cloudiness typical of a wheat beer. One of the most complex flavor profiles I’ve tasted from a weisse beer. I taste new flavors every time I drink this beer. Definitely more depth than just the standard citrus and banana flavors of most hefes.

Pours a cloudy dark straw with a large pillowy white head that clings to the glass. The nose is a solid yet subtle blend of banana, bubblegum and flowers over a soft wheaty malt backing. Light to medium-bodied it is easy drinking while fairly substantial. With a distinctly wheaty mouthfeel, it finishes fairly dry for a hefeweizen. Soft and wheaty with banana, floral and light clove notes in support. This is a very solid and nuanced example of the style.

Very good aromas of bread malt and lemons..murky yellow in the glass with solid head. really surprised me with the taste..I kept my expectations kind of low since Im not much for the style, but Im liking it a lot. Good flavors of lemons malt and a slight pepperiness with the hops showing themselves now and then..Has a creamish palate hinting at the vanilla. Aftertaste is a little less than desirable but still, not that bad I guess.

Ayinger Bräu Weisse is a Hazy deep orange yellow color with a frothy and thin white head. 

The aroma is full of banana and cloves and the flavor is hearty with the same characteristics as the aroma. Lemon citrus is present as well. 

This is a great German Hefeweizen and an all-around good beer.

500 mL. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a large, white head. Aroma of bananas, cloves, yeast, lemon. Taste is relatively light with some citrus, spice and fairly high carbonation. Crisp finish. Excellent wheat beer.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Nast nose.  Syphilis pee color.  Taste is actually aight.  And the name is almost Bra, so thats cool.  Im pretty sure I got a really old variety 6 of Ayinger.  Bummer.

11.2 oz bottle.  Pleasant and fruity hefe aroma with banana cream, pineapple, a good amount of wheat, and some yeast.  Pretty decent pour with a fluffy and bubbling head, very cloudy and banana yellow-light orange in color.  Good overall, medium feel, quite smooth, tastes fairly similar to the aroma, but also with a slightly acidic tropical citrus that lingers into and after the finish, but isnt a bad thing at all.  A top of the line, high quality German wheat that is right up there with Weihenstephaner.

No one does weisse, or wheat beers, better than Germany. There, I said it, and let it be known that I speak the truth. German wheat beers are a breed unto their own to whom others look to for affluence and inspiration. That isnt to say that wheat beers of various styles havent been around for generations, but none as distinct and flavorful as the German weisse beer. Light, refreshing, and full of soft succulent chewy wheat and spices, I hold in my possession today the Brau-weisse from Ayinger, a traditional German brewery who has yet to disappoint.

A huge head almost overtakes my glass and I pause to savor her visage along while allowing time for her to settle in before dispensing the rest of her cloudy orange and golden body. As her head recedes and light lace trails my glass, a subtle nose of freshly cut pears and lemon waft up to my nose. Mingling hints of spice, clove, coriander, basil, and more orange round her out. Unable to contain my thirst any longer, I delve into her golden depths and am embraced by her soft, chewy body bursting with freshly squeezed oranges, tangerines, and lemons. A vibrantly citric start leads into a softer middle and finish with lots of fresh chewy wheat, ripe bananas, and fresh warm dough. In-between quaffs I enjoy a pleasant lingering presence of spices, clove and coriander being the two prominent culprits. As I near the end of my journey, even more of the soft ripe bananas and wheat make their way to the forefront, buoyed faithfully by juicy ripe oranges and crisp citric esters. Amazingly refreshing and even though she is a larger bottle, I could easily enjoy multiple sessions.

It is true that to date Ayinger hasnt let me down with a single brew, but that is no guarantee of a good beer all the time. Thankfully, instead of being let down, I am once again reminded why Ayinger remains at the top of my list when it comes to solidly performing German breweries. Weise beers are notably pawned as summer beers because of their light and flavorfully refreshing palate, but I personally can enjoy a weisse beer any time of the year.

Hazy golden in color with a medium large off white head.  Aroma of banana, spice, light tart wheat and bready yeast.   Taste is banana- on the lighter side of the style, some mild citrus, spices, bready yeast, tart wheat.  Light to medium bodied with prickly carbonation.  Finishes lightly tart.  Nice hefe.

Bottle. It’s hazy and yellow-golden in the glass, topped by an acceptable white head. Really nice aroma with banana and cloves in an almost heavenly blend. In the back there’s some citrusy sourness. The flavor follows the same pattern, but adds a yeasty twist and a nice bitterness towards the finish. A bit thin on the body, and also maybe a bit too effervescent, at least if you want to drink a lot of it. A really nice hefeweizen. (080829)
Awesome!  Nose very sweet notes of light hops and malt  Flavors citrus and light orange.  Sweet ans fruity.  very good,
Bottle. Golden - orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is citrus, ornange, coriander. Flavour is sweet, citrus, orange, coriander, banana. Nice beer.
Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with a white head. Fruity sweet aroma of over ripe bananas and clove. The flavor is sweet banana, clove, and nutmeg. Very good.

500 ml bottle purchased at Beertopia in Omaha, Nebraska.  Pour is slightly hazed yellow golden with a ton of carbonation bubbles.  As the remainder of the bottle is poured, the beer is decidedly cloudier.  There is a billowing 3 to 4 inch white head that crackles and pops as it falls, leaving behind a decent amount of lacing.  Aroma is ripe sweet bananas, fresh cut hay and grainy wheat.  Nice, soft, fresh nose.  Also some nice floral aroma.  Taste is the wheat, fresh and full, along with the banana and some clove taste that was not present initially in the nose.  It all melds together quite nicely, and really typifies a solid German Hefe.  Also some citrus present, which comes across with a really delicate sweetness that complements and accents the fresh grain and wheat.  Palate is medium, fair amount of carbonation and a brief, clean finish.  This was a nice one.

Hazy yellow body with a finger sized white head.  Bananas and hate in the aroma.  Flavor is annoyingly flat, but what there is is sweet like a banana chip with hints of wheat and yeast.  It definitely doesn’t feel as carbonated as the standard hefeweizen, which troubles me mildly.  Overall, an okay beer though.

Pours a light cloudy yellow with a active white head. Aroma of citrus and wheat. Flavor is yeast, wheat, and a touch of banana. The carbonation is very active and tingly on the tongue. Good refreshing hefe.

Pours a cloudy yellow, with a big white foamy head. A strong citrus smell with a hint of wheat. Fruityness of beer gives almost a wine type taste. Full bodied beer, Some sweetness and yeast in the taste, excellent hefeweizen
I could certainly get used to this brew.  Poured cloudy with a thick white head.  Flavor was thick on the wheat side with a touch of citrus.  If I had another, I would be drinking it now!

Pours a pale yellow almost white with lots of carbonation and a foamy white head. Very Belgian like sour cherry, bready aroma with some citrus. Very sweet fruity intro that turns tart and a little dry as it finishes with a more bready flavor that fades gently. The body is very creamy from the wheat and the flavors are all very smooth and well balanced.

Bottle from Kegs & Barrels in McKinney, TX. Pours a cloudy gold with white head. Aroma of bannana and bubblegum with light citris. Flavor has nice bannana notes with light citris and a wheat malt backbone, light sweetness. Mouthfeel is light and soft with high carbonation. Overall a very light, refreshing beer.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2009 (bottle) hazy golden-yellow colour, huge firm white head. aroma has dominant banana and citrus notes, as well as a light hop spiciness and wheat. flavour is mostly banana and wheat, with notes of green apple and light citrus, peanuts and floral hops. medium carbonation, light to medium body. refreshing and well-made!

Another solid and comfortable staple in hefeweizen land. I still prefer Weihenstephaner as Ayinger is less robust and less deep a clove-banana imprint. Won’t pass it up however, refreshing and flowery flavor. Less dirty than the Schneider Weiss but still not as satisfying as the Weihenstephaner.

Pours a pale yellow, like a cloudy pale lager. The flowery, fruity aroma fills the room and is magnificent. Lots of banana. Some sweet, citric malt. Finishes lovely. Really great summer beer, up there on par with Hacker-Pschorr’s hefe.

Very pale hazy straw yellow pour with a thick fluffy white head.  Lots of banana and spicy cloves.  Very pleasant banana flavor.  Slightly sweet.  Very easy to drink with a bit of biting carbonation.  All around great hefeweizen.

A bright yellow color with a huge white head. Very effervescent and lot’s of fruit aroma. A little spice and citrus as well.
Flavor is a little sweet and a little dry. A definite dry finish. Great stuff.

Banana lemon spice on the nose, hints of jammy apricots.  Golden yellow color, with haziness and a huge foamy head.  Haney and malt sweetness, balanced by a little bitterness and some citrus tartness.  Big carbonation, creamy texture, yet crisp.  It also finished nicely, almost seemed  to have a little more of an alcohol burn at the very end?  (in a good way).  Deep and flavorful, this is an awesome beer.

500ml bottle in weizen. Pale yellow-white and very hazy, huge white head slowly depreciating.  Very sweet aroma of banana’s and vanilla. Very smooth with enough carbonation to tickle your tongue. Yeasty sweet taste some nice fruity notes. Good but not enough real flavor the sweetness is only temporarily satisfying.

Bottle.  Golden yellow in color. Good head. Aroma of banana and yeast. Taste is a super smooth and a light taste of bananas, lemon and yeast. Very refreshing. Light texture and low carbonation. I could drink this all day, every day. Good beer. I am in love with german beers

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2014 Re-rate 5/14: Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks troubles.  Cloudy yellow with a big white head. Lovely classic Weizen aroma with quite a bit of banana, some clove and a citric note. Sweetish and slightly tart flavor with fruity esters, yeast and mild spiciness. Medium-bodied. A very good Weizen. 8/4/7/3/15=3.7

(7/3/08) Draught at Ayingers Speis und Trank in Munich. Pale cloudy yellow with a big and quite stable white head. Aroma is wheaty with decent fruity esters. Sweetish fruity flavor with some banana and light spiciness. Medium-bodied. Maybe slightly too clean for a Weizen but still good. 7/4/6/3/13=3.3

Major bubble gum and clove in the aroma.  Huge frothy white head that is fully lasting.  Cloudy murky medium yellow body.  Lightly sweet initial flavor that finishes very smooth.  Light body with a lively carbonation.

fresh lemon, young banana and dry wheat blend for a lucious complex aroma.  4 finger head of medium bubbles took a long time to subside and left nearly no lacing though the array of golden hues in the glass made up for that.  sweet with a wildflower/herbal foundation that finishes a hint tart and dry.  the best hef i’ve ever had.
Cloudy yellow with a tall thick head. Lemon yeasty nose. Medium carbonation. Smooth finish left me wanting more.  Good quality example of a real hefeweizen.

Bomber.  Pours a cloudy golden orange with a medium head.  Aroma of wheat, citrus.  Palate is crisp, with pearly carbonation.  Flavor is Smooth blend of wheat, grain, and some sweetness.  Very nice.  Just solid ingredients that are well brewed.  Another quality offering from Ayinger.
Great tasting beer I tried after a mate from England suggested it.  Flowery and fruity at the same time, I highly recommend this beer to anyone who likes this type of beer.  Well done Ayinger!

Pours ultra-frothy and fizzy head that lasted forever. Nice hazy golden-yellow color, the archetype for the hefeweizen. Citrusy and flowery aroma with elements of yeast, wheat, spices (clove, nutmeg), and banana. The perfect balance of typical hefeweizen flavours.  Yet another superb brew from Ayinger.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Pours a pleasent looking bright golden colour with a nice fluffy white head. lacing is sticky and scattered, a little lemon, wheat and orange aromas. initial taste is sharp coriander spice with a long sweet creamy mouthfeel.Finish is mild. ends rather quickly.
very ligth amber, short lasting head, nice malty notes of ripe fruit, banana, citrus flowers, sweet, and sweet finish.

Bottle poured into a Paulaner Weizen .5L glass. Fizzy head with a hazy straw colored body. Active carbonation that lasted throughout. Flavor was nice, but lacked a little something. Slight citrus notes.
had at 99 bottles tasting in federal way. yellow color, good head. wheaty nose with some traditional german hefe flavors

bottle thanks to metzlers in denton, tx.  poured a hazy yellow with a thick white head that lasted forever.  aroma is doughy and some citrus and banana.  flavor is strong with banana and bread.  overall a pretty good beer.

Pours a very hazy yellow with a lively head that disappears really fast.  Nice yeasty aroma.  Flavor is light malt and citrus--pretty straightforward hefe without some of the other classic flavors, like banana or spice.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick head. Nose of citrus, hops, malt, and banana. Taste great. Flavor is bread dough, banana, citrus, and malt. Very Good.

I found this to be an excellent wheat. I had it years ago and could not find it. Yesterday a girl I was with pulled one from her cooler and I almost fell over. So now I know where to get locally. This is what a sheat beer should be. It is full bodied had a pleasant aroma and a great flavor.

Pours a cloudy, medium gold color with a white, heavily carbonated head which disappears fairly quickly.  Flavor has hints of banana and bubble gum.  Carbonation is the most evident element of the finish.  Overall, a decent Hefeweizen, but not great.
One of my favorite Wheat Beers. Really cloudy with a full body. A good yeasty flavor. Terrific with a small amount of lemon to complement the citrus notes already in the brew.
Bottle.  Bought just outside of Aying, Germany (where its brewed).  Has a nice banana flavor and great with a slice of orange.  Enjoyed drinking it with a Garlic Wurst and a hunk of Brie.
Draught at One Pint Pub, Helsinki. Color is a pale yellow, nose includes banana and wheat. A very refreshing wheat beer with hints of citrus.

Bottle at Union Jacks.
Hazy Yellow. Thin head. Aroma of wheat, banana and clove. Flavor of sweet bread, yeast, banana, lemon. Clean finish.
Speis und Trank, Munich. Gentle peppery banana aroma. Subtly dryish, spicy weisse with sneaking banana and lemon fruit as it warms. Tasty.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy mellow gold color with a large white head. Nice aroma of yeast, citrus and malt. Smooth medium palate. Nice malt and yeast flavor with a citrus finish. A excellant weiss beer!

500mL bottle.  Pours a hazy, golden-yellow color; fluffy, textured white head with good retention and medium-bubbled lacing.  Toasty malts, citrus, and bananas in the aroma; refreshing and pleasantly dry nose.  Medium, fluffy mouthfeel: bananas, soft cloves, white pepper and dry toasty malts; very drinkable and tasty hefeweizen; very nice, refreshing stuff.  Medium finish: some citrus and mineral bitterness, bananas, and very soft, toasty spicing.

0,5l bottle. White head. Yellowish,  light mead coloured. Aromas of citrus, yeast and apricot. Palate is light, decent carb. Flavour is also ligther than your average weisse. Yeast, bananas. Refreshing! Good for hot day.

500ml Bottle - First off,  I was never huge on Hefes - I generally prefer Belgians, IPAs, and of course Stouts, but this is pretty marvelous.  Its light, but its got a lot of complexity.  Pours a cloudy yellow/golden with nice white head - no lacing.  Aroma is bananas, cloves, wheat, spice, citrus, etc.  Taste is much the same with big banana aftertaste, and very lemony notes throughout.  Probably the best Hefe Ive tasted - beckons me to revisit the style.

Aroma is your standard weissebier. Lemon and citrus with some sweet banana notes. Cloudy yellow orange in color with a nice sized head. Sweet and grainy in the start with the spicy citrus and fruit flavors following. Medium body and refreshing. A nice example of the style.
On tap - Capones - May 2008.  Didnt take a whole lot of descriptive notes on this one other than "tastes like banana pancakes".  Floury and yeasty with a predominant banana flavor.
500 ml. Banana and lemon scent. Pale straw color (less orange than some) with super-fluff head. Champagne-like texture. Taste is on the dry side for the style. Mellow fruit and spice.

Draft @ Capones:  This one poured a cloudy bright yellow with lots of head.  The aroma was yeasty and lemony.  The flavor was not a heavy as I thought.  It was a bit yeasty and there were those lemons again.  Overall, a decent Hefe but not the best Ive ever had.

Yeasty aroma, with a hint of spice and maybe a touch of banana. Initial taste is of slight clove and yeasty sweetness. Mouthfeel is excellent with a very smooth and full finish that tastes of banana, spice, slight fullness that remains.
botella 330 ML. cerveza que detras de esa pinta de comprada en el Lidl esconde una muy buena cerveza.
Nice. Much more full tasting than I expected. Pretty thick for the style. Yeasty and peppery flavor. Lightly bitter finish. Highly drinkable and refreshing.

Pours a lightly hazy straw color with a foamy, snow white, well-retained head.  Aromas showed fresh bananas, lemon chiffon, dry wheat grains, and light coriander spice.  Some floral, spicy hop notes come through as well.  Flavors are primarily the same, turning perhaps a bit more dry than the nose indicates.  The wheat really asserts itself, with clean banana and light citrus providing highlights.  Yeasty.  Finishes super clean.  Medium-light bodied and easy drinking, with moderate carbonation.  Nothing special going on here, but its a nice, refreshing summertime brew.  Not bad.

On tap at Track 84 in Warwick, RI.  Pours cloudy gold in color woth a medium white head,  Aroma of bananas, yeast, and light spiced.  Flavor much the same.  Some cereal grains in the finish, but in a really good way.  A vey nice Weisse.

Bottle:  Cloudy golden in color with aromas of yeast, banana and spice.  In the mouth it is medium-bodied, soft and engaging.  I must say...with the added lemon (after notes) the palate is brighter, more acidic (duh) and more quaffable on a hot day.  While a more serious beer without the lemon, it is easier drinking. which can be a good thing given the circumstances.  That said, overall, I prefer Hacker-Pschorr.
Bottle, hazy yellow color with a thick white head. Nice snappy bite on the front. Tastes of earth, yeast.
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 Banana, spice and ginger in aroma. Flavor of dryish banana, citrus, grain, spices and ginger. Palate is quite a smooth and easy to drink.

500ml bottle (Mallaskukko, Turku)
Cloudy light orange, small head. Banana aroma, spicy and light. Simple soft light grainy body, and hoppiness in the mouth too, a bit like perfumed soap. Plenty of banana too. Aromatic fruity esters.

Draught at their tap. Distinct banana aroma. Cloudy orange colour. OK white head. Full banana flavour, slightly fat. Hint of citrus in the finish, almost enough to balance it. But a good and flavourful Weizen.

A very wonderful summer drink overall. Very nice looking in the glass, good head, a citrus background taste and an overall light feel to the beer though it is not. Too much fizz for me but I would put this in my personal top 25 for summer beers.

pours a beautifuly cloudy honey color, with a very fluffy white head
lemon and wheat scent correcly indicates what youre about to taste
strong yeast and wheat flavor with citrus highlights
only downside is that the high carbonation distracts from the quality flavor
Pours with a smallish, white head covering a cloudy, honey body. Aroma is of a clove forward Hefe. Food Lacing. Clove spicey taste with some banana in the background. A bit too fizzy of a mouthfeel.

Bottle. Beautiful white head is dense and rich. Hazy liquid is pale orange to yellow. Light malty aroma is yeasty and medium sweet with banana that is not too offensive. Citrus fruits with light spiciness too. Delicate malt body and silky soft mouthfeel with fizzy carbonation. Low bitteration makes this easy to drink. Definately one of the best hefeweizens that i´ve ever tasted! Very pleasant and refreshing.
Very cloudy yellow color with a very thick fluffy white head. Aroma is quite citrusy with yeast. Citrus fruity flavor, yeast and some spices mixed in. Light and refreshing. A nice all around hefe.

0.5 l bottle. Hazy yellow color with fizzy diminishing head. Sweetish bready aroma with banana, clove, pepper and perhaps soap. Sweetish malty and bready flavor with some banana, clove, pepper and watermelon. Oily yet fizzy palate. Well made.

A- Pours a cloudy golden hue with a somewhat frothy white head that dissipates quickly leaving little to no lacing.

S- Sweet smell of banana and darker fruits hits the nose. Quite a potent smell.

T- Start off with a strong malty taste and finishes very clean leaving a banana taste.

M- Very crisp and refreshing. Slight reminants stick around for a while.

D- Very drinkable. Excellent on a warm summer day.
An awesome hefe and the standard bearer in my opinion. Years ago this was my favorite brew. Banana, other light fruits and spice with just the right body for a weizen. Excellent.
Pours a pale hazy yellow with a thick frothy white head. The aroma was sour, wheaty, banana, clove, sweet. The flavor was sweet and banana, clove, wheat, spice, a little thinner than id have liked.

The color was a lhazy ight golden with a lot of carbonation.  The head was VERY thick, cappucino-like froth.  The aroma was lemon, yeast, and wheat.  The flavor crips lemon with very light spice.  The palate was lively.  The finish was crisp and wheat.

Completely consistent from bottle to bottle.  I really enjoy this beer and it is definitely one of my go tos, because you always know what you are going to get.  Pours a hazy pale yellow with a large frothy, sometimes rocky head.  Typical yeasty aroma of bananas and bubblegum, clove spice follows through on the palate.  Great carbonation, a delicious wheat beer.
Draft. Hazy straw color with big fluffy head. Aroma of yeast and banans.  The taste was the same with light fizziness and semi dry finish. This stuff was goood.

(Bottle on 2007-12-31 and 2008-04-04) More or less yellow in colour and cloudy. White, decent sized head. Banana and hints of hops in nose. Some fizzines in palate that was a bit dry, too. Fruity taste with lots of banana in it. Great wheat beer.

[bottle] Poured a hazy gold with decent sized white head. Aroma was tart wheat with some spices. Flavor was wheaty with a moderately dry finish. Aftertaste has an odd flavor that I cant quite put my finger on. Almost sufurous? Its not overly prominent, but something a little off.

Tap. Hazy golden color; big thick head. smelled of banana, bubblegum, spice, maybe other fruit. tastes like it smells, full flavor, but remains light, and refreshing. Definitely could go with breakfast, or summertime relaxing post-lawn mowing.

Hazy golden yellow, huge weizen head. Nose is yeasty wheat and raw banana. A bit spicy, overall very full and round. Flavor smooth & fruity, apples and wheat. Finishes mildly tart and yeasty with slight hops even. Medium bodied, smooth and strongly carbonated palate. A great, lightly spritzy weizen.
Hazy yellow pour with a white head.  Big banana nose almost like laffy taffy banana.  Taste is more solide banana with other light fruits as well as some citrus.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2008 (GERMANY) Very cloudy yellow color with a very thin white head. There is a vanilla / grain aroma with flavor of banana, spice, and citrus. I dont think the brew is as good as Hacker-Pschorr, But it is full bodied and very enjoyable. If you get a chance check this one out !!!

Sampled during Cellars Wine & Spirits Wednesday evening beer tasting. From bottle pours a semi-hazy golden brew with a thick white head that quickly dissipates to a fine film and white ring. Aroma of typical hefe multi-grain and wheat malt, yeast, some banana esters and cloves. Taste is semi -sweet, some carbonation with flavors of light powdered wheat grain, banana and a touch of citrus zest. Finish remains semi-sweet with a light aftertaste of banana and some tropical fruit.

On draft at Flat Rock Saloon.  Poured cloudy gold with white head that quickly diminished leaving behind what was a grossly undercarbonated beer.  Nose was yeasty with some citrus components, most notably lemon.  Bananas and citrusy flavor.  Would like to try again but from the bottle.

Pours with huge, white head which disappears quite fast but leaves nice lacing. Color is hazy yellow-orange. Aromas are banana, vanilla and yeast. Flavor is fruity with lots of banana and a bit of citrus fruits. This Medium-bodied, a bit foamy and well balanced beer is greatly refreshing.

Appearance: Cloudy to a "T."  Nice, solid white head. Lovely tan colour, very opaque even though not dark.

Aroma: cloves, banana, grass, chamomile, very light cardamom. Nice balance of aromas.

Taste: Textbook without being industrial. Grass, banana, clove, and peach. Very refreshing.

Palate: What can I say? Near-perfect all the way down.

Overall: Lovely hefeweizen, one of the best Ive had. As stated above, classic and textbook without being industrial or boring. PERFECT with grilled bratwurst and sauerkraut.
Hazy yellow with a large rocky head. Light estery, wheat aroma. Flavour is very fruity, lemon and banana. Medium body and overly carbonated. A bit average.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2011 ...not a bad hefe, good orange notes, slightly light bodied and bland out of the 500 ml bottle,  needs more body.  Could be much better, but worth trying.
RR: Had this again recently, and it is much better now that my tastes have developed.  This is a nice hefe brewed true, and with all the obligatory characteristics of a good german hefe-weizen.

Hazy orange, white fluffy head. Fruity aroma with citrus and yeast. Very smooth flavor, has hints of banana as youd expect. Slightly fizzy, quite refreshing. An excellent and very enjoyable brew. And I dont even generally like hefeweizens.

Quite similar to Weihenstephaner Hefe. Aroma: Some citrus, a fair amount of banana, and some yeast spice aspect. Flavor: malt is a little dirty and stale, doesnt have enough bite. Quite a bit of banana, of course. Flavor is pretty weak though.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2013 Bräu-Weisse is beautiful beer: cloudy and light yellow colour, a head is white and big. Aroma of wheat, yeast, lemon, nice spicyness and hint of banana. Taste of wheat, lemon and quite high sourness. Medium bodied, fresh and high carbonation, but not too much. Fresh, sour and lemon hefe, a refreshning beer.

Lemon and vanilla overtones to the slightly lactic (yoghurt-like) aroma with plenty of sour wheat.  Opaque yellow-tan body is topped by a generous, fizzy white head that recedes slowly to a fine bubbled partial cover.  Spicy and floral notes are apparent initially but they are swept up in the lightly sour wheat flavour.  Banana, clove and lavender are notable in the aftertaste.  Bitterness is quite notable also.  Light body is quite dry with fairly strong carbonation that keeps the sweetness and stickiness from overpowering.  Tulip glass.  Fridge temperature.  Bottle (Brewery Creek, Mar-08).

Bottle. Hazy golden with enormous head. Fresh aroma of flowers, orange and banana. The flavor is not too strong but is a nice mix of spices, banana, grain and a bit of sweetness. Perfect dry, soft palate. Sweet-sour fruity finish.

Bottle.Huge frothy, fizzy, white head that mostly diminished, splotchy lacing, cloudy, fast rising carbonation, and a straw hue. The nose was sweet, bananas, spicy, hint of clove, and yeasty.The flavor was spicy, bananas, yeasty, fruity, semi-sweet and a tad thin tasting.Mouthfeel was tingly and slighly dry.Medium bodied.Very quaffable for the style, nice balance, easy to drink, would drink this again, and worthy of a try.

Nice balanced hefe. Nose has a banana bread and citrus note.  Can taste the cloves and hops- finishes a little grainier than most hefes.  Lots of yeast sediment on the bottom, so give the bottle a little swirl just before dumping the last quarter into the weizen glass. This hefe is true to form.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2008 Bottle 0.5 l. Light yellowish beige, cloudy ofcourse with a smallish head for a hefe. Nose is slightly yeasty and honeyish. Only slightly fruity and sweet. Flavor is smoothly wheaty and a bit fruity with very nice yeasty, wheaty and even hoppy aftertaste. Reminds me of some german fresh beers. Very attractive taste, lacks the sourness and overly sweet fruitiness of some hefes. More on the dry side.
Swirling bottom bottle gunk hypnotizing pour. Lighter spicy weisse aroma, almost like artificial banana. At times I think I almost detect shallots. Very nice creamy carbonation. Just fine!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Very good hef.  A little on the lighter side in appearance.  Not as cloudy as most hefs that ive had

Pours a cloudy straw colour with a good, long lasting egg-white head. Aroma is sweet and wheaty, artificial banana notes. Tastes lovely, creamy and light banana. Not too terribly spicy, but sweet and bready with a mild finish. Theres an odd flavour that reminds me of wood glue in there, too. Body is creamy and thick, slightly low carb. This is a tasty, tasty hefe. It would be very heaven in the summer. Hope its still available then here in Vancouver!

draught. tapped a cloudy yellow with white head. smelled like banana, citrus, and wheat. taste was lemony with a hint of light clove. had a very spritzy, astringent feel in the mouth. finishes dry. one of the better hefes that I have had in awhile.
Another perfect beer from Ayinger.  This is just a flawless hefeweizen in my opinion.  Delicious, smooth and creamy... doesnt get better than this.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2008 Poured a hazy yellow/orange.  A creamy white head was on top, but it dissolved into orange swirls.  Aromas of bananas and wheat.  Taste was great, mainly of wheat, but there were some spices that worked very well with the taste.
Little aroma with a medium head. Hazy in the glass. Spicy fruit flavor Accents of banana. Wheat beers are not my favorite, but this one was pretty decent.

Bottle, bought @ Ølkonsortiet, Aalborg.
Pours a wonderful hazy pale yellow, leaning towards brownish oranges. A small creamy white head settles on top, but soon dissipates to a thin film. Lots of bubbles reaching towards the surface, maintaining the film. Aroma is wonderfully fruity and yeasty. Lots of banana, some cloves, some sweet apples. Mouthfeel has high carbonation, but still maintains a nice creaminess. Flavour is perhaps a bit underwhelming when considering the other wonderful parts, but its still very good! Banana, lots of wheat maltiness, some serious spices. But this sure is a wonderful hefe. A bit too sweet places it below both Maisels and Andechser in my book.

on tap. pours a cloudy dark yellow with a nice 11/2 finger fluffy white head. aroma is wheat and malt with banana and a touch of clove. has a medium body with good lacing and just right carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma but stronger. it also has a creamy mouth-feel to it. a very good hefe and maybe better that weinstephaner because it is not overly carbonated.

May 2007 - Cloudy straw color, nice bubblegum and what aroma.  Thick, thick wheat base...I really like that!  Lots of bubble gum and clove, but neither overdone.  The only knock was that it was a bit overcarbonated.

[Bottle, thanks Guerde] Pours hazy orange with a big, white head.  At first the aroma is completely dominated by yeast with banana more of a role player than the star.  As it warmed, the banana did become more evident. The taste is banana up front, then yeast with a bit of a grain. Medium-thick mouthfeel. Finish is decent with banana and grain. Overall it is fairly good, but didnt overly impress. Im not sure on how old this bottle is though, and Im sure the trip over from Germany doesnt help it. Would like to try this fresh some time.

(bottle) Pours a light golden with a large white head.  Aroma is initiially very yeast dominant, and only upon warming do I get the faint scent of banana and clove.  Taste is somewhat lacking, with light banana and lemon with a very yeasty finish.  The mouthfeel is medium, with a short finish.  Not bad, but definitely not that great.
Nice head, easy pour.  Very spicey, great estered nose of clove, fruit and a hint of banana.  This is one of the most authentic Bavarian wheat beers available in Oklahoma.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2009 Bottle. Golden yellow with a huge, white fluffy head. Hazy with the yeast pour at the end. Wonderful nose of spices, yeast, lemon, zest, carbonation. Light hoppiness with a tangy, yeasty, spicy, full mouth. One of, if not the best, hefeweizens. Great beer for hot, humid, sticky Houston summers (and 80F Feburary days too!!).
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Poured a hazy medium golden color with a thick, creamy white head and some lacing.  Wonderful aromas of spice and banana, with hints of citrus and vanilla.  Flavors of wheat and lemon, along with other light fruits.  Very good.

500 ml. bottle poured into scored Paulaner weizen glass.  Cloudy yellow/amber with a moussy white head.  Bready and wheaty aroma with the banana/clove yeast and some mustiness as well.  Rich and classic German HW flavors- creamy bready/wheaty malts, spicy yeast and a mild lemony tartness.  Lively carbonation, full unfiltered palate.  Seems like a classic model of the style.
A very nice wheat beer.  Hazy straw yellow with large fluffy white head.  Citrus, banana, lemon, floral hops, spice, bread, and apple.  Well done and drinkable.
Blonde with a white head, aroma is of a mild banana scent and yeast.  The flavor is a nice balance of fruit and spice.
16.9 oz bottle, nice aroma, golden hazy color, good effervescense, but lacking a little in flavor vs. other hefe, ok but not my first choice
A standard fare for the German Hefe. Its got some mild flavors of normal flavors of Banana and mild wheat. High of carbonation and good fizz. Overall its a very casual drinking expirence.
Hazy yellow of color with a nice huge white head. An aroma of wheat, yeast, fruit and flowers. A flavor of heat, sweets, yeast, fruits, apples abd banana.
big long lasting head, the aroma suggests a potent wheat that delivers if poured slowly, otherwise the head keeps the taste, the rest is watery, mixed properly=great representation

Pours a cloudy, milky tan, small, light head. Aroma is slightly citrusy, with a hint of peanut butter.Flavor is rich and light, very fruity. Lots of citrus and banana notes. Classic wheat flavor, not much on the site of hops though. Overall, good stuff.
Bottle.  Typical hefeweizen beer. Rich aroma,  little sweet flavor , can feel yeast. Normal.

Bottle pour with perfect hefe head, but let down on a pale urine body.  The aroma is too subtle to delight in, though a bit floral with banana and vanilla.  Flavor is solidly average with some mild honey and lots of white bread.  I would have liked a stroger presence of aroma and taste.  The palate was a nice surprise, being only slightly too carbonated for a perfect hefe.  Overall, a lacking but pleasant offering.
Lots of head with lace.  Highly carbonated, and a banana smell.  Smooth and sweet taste with a hint a lemon banana.
Pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head. Light lacing. Aromas of bananas and cloves. Flavors of bananas, spices, and light yeast. Very palatable. Medium body beer.
user_location: Mescal Lakes (wherever that is), Arizona, USA

text: 16.9 oz bottle-A real cloudy yellow body with a nice tight white head and the yeast being suspeded over the beer like a black and tan. It  has an aroma of lemon, banana, yeast, and a little clove. Taste of this light body comes across with the same and a dryness like champagne. The flavors are mile on this hefe but still great tasting.

Strong citrus aroma and flavor and a very nice thick head. Has a very hazy golden appearance as you can see the suspended yeast. The appearance, aroma and taste are great but its not the best Hefeweizen Ive ever had. Nevertheless if you love Hefeweizens as much as I do you really cant go wrong with this brew.

Tap. Aroma of bananas and cloves. Very estery. Pours an orange yellow. Obviously hazy. Flavor is sweet and estery. Fruity and pleasant. Very drinkable. A touch of lemon in the finish puts this one together. A great hefe.

The bottle looks good, typical Ayinger-style. The beer tastes very much like a normal hefeweizen, fruity, sweet - delicous. Only the finish reminds me of a non-alcohol beer - thats not so good. Nevertheless a good and drinkable beer.

500ml bottle-pours a golden honey color with a lot of carbonation. Thin head dissipates fairly quickly. Hints of banana in the flavor. Strong wheat flavor noted. Fairly easy to drink and overall a good brew.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2008 Pour yourself a great hefeweisebier full of foam, Then when it settles down, savor the light, wheat aroma. Ayinger is a beautiful cloudy straw color. It tastes light, and refreshing like light wheat, with a hint of lemon, yet it is full flavored. A very good brew, one of my favorites.

Not my favorite style here so Im being generous. The carbonation was an overload on this one, I actually had to give the bottle a shake. Very lemony and orangy. Super spiced beer. The wheat was super strong. One who likes wheat beers will love this guy, but just not my thing.
Complex fruity-spicy aroma. No thick creamy head as advertised, however. Decent taste, but not my favorite hefe.

From a 500ml bottle--Poured a slightly clouded, but mostly clear deep golden straw color with a fat, snowy two-finger head. Aroma of spicy clove and banana with mild vanilla notes.  Smooth, lush, creamy mouth feel.  Flavor of spicy bananas and cloves with a little hint of sweet apples, cherries and vanilla.  Chewy and full-bodied.  THIS is what a hefe should be!
Luxuriant nose of apples, bananas, clove and wheat. Hello there, new favorite Hefe.

Bottle from Johns Grocery (Iowa City, IA). Poured into my Warsteiner mug. Pours a rich hazy gold that looks really carbonated. Head is amazingly rich and white. Smells like a clove and banana. Taste is deep and rich, a wonderful banana dominated hefe that has a very pleasant sweetness, almost with vague notes of candy or taffy sweetness. Smooth finish that leaves me refreshed. One of the best Hefes around.

Thank you Masn/g2b.dk! Its a hazy, golden beer with a huge, nice, white head. The aroma has notes of clove, wheat and banana. The flavour has a light sweetness, notes of clove, wheat and banana. The body is full, and its harmonic and nice! 2550
Beautiful pour with a rocky head.  The yeast and what make a delicious taste, sweet, almost cookie-like.  This is what I want in a hefe.
This is what I remember from Germany.  A little sweet fruit and yeast make this one great for a summer time treat.
500mL Bottle. 2nd of 13 for the night. Body is cloudy with white foamy head. Aroma is wheat and yeast.  Taste is citrus, wheat and yeast....some traces of banana.
500ml bottle with a couple bros of mine on thanksgiving.  this was sooo $ one of the best hefes i have had.
golden color, cloudy, big white foam, nose is citrus and some banana, some hoppy, flavor is sweet, bitter, good body

Pours a cloudy straw color into the weizen glass with a inch head.  The scent was of wheat, clove, banana and yeast.  A very fruity and spicey taste up front with a smooth finish.  Very flowery with some yeast and wheat in the finish.  Excellent hefe!

Pours to a murky copper wheat colored body with a lasting dense, soapy white head.  The aroma is cloves, bubblegum, and graham crackers.  The flavor is really yeasty with bubblegum and cloves.  Wheat.  Very simple.  Wheaty clean palate.  Dries my mouth out leaving it wanting more.
Had this beer on 10/13/2007.  This is a good Hefe but seems a bit light with a foamy mouth feel and a bit bitter on the end.

This beer pours a cloudy thick orange color to it with a nice and thick head,it also leaves nice laceing on the sides of the glass as you drink it. The aroma is very strong with some lemon zest and citrus with mild hints of vanilla. As you drink it you can taste the weat and how tangy it is initially. Then it is followed by some lemon grass with orange peel. The palte is also very nice with a floral scent which leaves a lasting impression in the back of your mouth for quite some time.

Ive been buying all the German hefe weizen varieties at my local Binnys and trying them.  Im very partial to Franziskaner and Weihenstephaner.  But, you know, I tried the Ayinger and liked it much better than even those.  Why?  The smoothness and mildness of this one, the yeasty bready nose, the banana sweet flavor.  I tried to sip this one but downed a 1/2 liter like it was nothing.   The head on the beer is a lot so you have to pour slowly or the entire glass will be foam.  This is top Hefe in my book, many others are very good, but Ill take this one whenever there is a choice.
Beautiful cloudy golden appearance mild yeast aroma, slightly lemony. Impressive sharpness to the taste. A tiny bit too sweet, but another great Hefeweizen.

Crazy sweet banana aroma.  Very fragrant.  Hazy yellow / brown swirl with large white head. Smooth carbonation, very light and fluffy for a medium bodied beer.  Really like the understated flavor.  Not overwhelmingly sweet like some imitators.  Very balanced.
This is the beer that turned me inot a beer geek.  I do not care what others think, Ayinger is the best!  I am also a hefeweizen fanatic, so I am a little biased.

pours a very cloudy sunshine yellow with a thick 4 finger foamy white head.
smell - wheat, lemon, yeast, spice, fruit.
taste - fruit, lemon, wheat, there is a sweetness on the back-end that is also a bit tart, leaves the mouth slightly dry and wanting more.

Ive yet to find a bad beer from Ayinger (or even a mediocre one - theyre all good).  This brew did not disappoint.  Pours an absolutely exquisite pale golden color with a foamy snow white head.  Yeasty aroma with very subtle banana notes.  I got the slightest clove notes, but that might be my mind telling me that it should be in a hefe!  Flavor was a fruity/citrusy balance that was light enough to be very thirst-quenching.  This hefe skews a bit lighter than others, but there is no loss in flavor.  Just another solid offering from Ayinger.
Bread and butter taste with a slight lemon flavor. Perfect to eat with a nice steak, I love this beer but it is very expensive. Worthy every penny, Love it

On tap at Ayinger in Munich on our honeymoon.  Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma is yeasty with wheat, malt, banana, and clove.  Similar flavors a little fizzy but still creamy from the wheat.  Decent beer.

Pours a hazy amber yellow with a generous sustained rocky white head.  Smells of bananas, lemons, cloves, some coriander and oranges.  Tastes of bananas, some clove, bubblegum and hints of spice and pepper.  Mouthfeel is full.  About as good as you can get out of a hefeweizen in a bottle.

Smells like i expected.  A little creamier of an aroma that most hefeweizens.  Some yeast, some alcohol. Beautiful great white head.  Cloudy golden, great.  Very dry flavor, some fruitiness.  Slightly spicy in the finish and the aftertaste.  Full bubbly mouthfeel.  I like it.  Good beer, would drink it again.

Bottle. Poured nicely with a wonderful, thick  white head.  Head eventually dissipates to leave a very pale, slightly cloudy beer.  What foam remains leaves nice legs on the glass.   Scent of light yeast, reminiscent of a leffe blonde or other lighter belgian ale.   For a beer this light feeling, there is still a luxurious mouthfeel here.  This is a nice beer. Not really a style I prefer, but a great representation of it.  Seems like it would be great after cutting the lawn on a hot day.

Bottle. I expected a little more out of this.Pours very nice. Thick white head that dissipates quick. The flavor is nice, theres just not a lot. Good citrus notes though. Unfortunately probably not worth the price.
Bottle at Hotel in Munich. Creamy yellow and full head. Fruity nose. Really creamy and smooth (almost Czech.) Sweet taste of citrus. Also spicy and prickly mouthfeel. Quite good.

A great hefe from the country who knows how to do it. Pour was a nice murky gold with a 2 finger white head. Aroma was of banana and lemon with yeast in there as well. Taste was banana, lemon and wheat with a nice cold crisp mouthfeel and dry aftertaste> Very great for this style.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 50cl bottle poured into weizen glass.  Hazy yellow colour with nice carbonation and a creamy head that lasts.  Good yeast and citrus flavours throughout.  nice, quick finish.  Enjoyable.
Hazy cream hefe yellow color. I do smell the yeast/fruity banana scent. Better than most wheats. Only a little citric. Not to thin, but easy to drink.
Very lemony taste, I liked it.  Finished extremely well.  Fruity-spicy would be an accurate description.

Bottled sample. Hazy dark yellow in colour with strong carbonation. Aromas of banana and lemons mix with flowery meadow elements, along with a bit of yeast. More bananas and lemons in the mouth, along with some mild wheat malt, yeast, and a bit of hop spice. This beer features an excellent palate which blends the thickness of the wheat with some citric sourness, and very soft carbonation. An excellent hefeweiss.

Aroma: strong yeast, slight lemon, almost a banana peel type of scent, and just a hint of clove. Appearance: clouded amber, highly carbonated, large foaming head with lacing. Flavor: wonderful! Not so bitter like normal beers, just a great taste. Leaves your mouth wet with a lasting flavor.
Draft.  Hazy golden with white two finger head.  Aroma of yeast and wheat malt.  Taste more of the same, slightly pungent.  Lemon and spices up front, moderate dry finish.  Perfect summer brew.

500ml Bottle:  has an orange, gold and honey hazy pour with a large white head that 
took awhile to receed, this beer is effervescent, 
lots of bananas and Bazooka gum powder aroma, fruit and yeast fragrances, 
taste is bread, citrus fruit, some pilsner malt and pepper, 
hops and citrus leave a small bitterness in the finish,
the citrus bitterness in this beer appears to clear off the palate to make a
clean and dry finish, easy to drink.

This weizenbier stands with my top three.  It has all the best attributes with none of the negatives.  Nowhere on Earth can any brewer come close to the Bavarian  ( and some Austrian) weizenbiers.  Once again I will forgo the cliche descriptions since nobody really reads all that stuff anyway.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2008 Solid Hefe that should not displease if youre a Hefe drinker.

Beautiful liquid.
Much better than most hefeweizens out there.  While it has the usual citrus overtones, but has more hops than average.

500 mL bottle, poured in an authentic Ayinger .5 liter swirl glass. Cloudy golden color with a frothy white head. Flavor of hops, wheat and citrus. Taste is same, with a little dryness. Delicious! Perfect beer for a hot summer day.

500 mL bottle.  Milky-gold with a thick, sticky white head.  Usual clove/banana aroma, with the addition of a little citrus and wheat.  Flavour is mild and on the sweet side, with a nice balance of yeast and wheat.  Light body.  Not bad.

Name: Brau Weisse
Date: 06/14/2001
Mode: Bottle
Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta

big bubble gum wheat character, raspy
-------- />
Name: Brau Weisse
Date: 11/07/2002
Score: i to iii
Words: Bottle
Words: Ale Atlanta

Hazy yellow, thin white head, sweet banana aroma with a hint of clove, lots of banana in the flavor, light body, clean finish, 
-------- />
Name: Brau Weisse
Date: 04/27/2005

soft lemony aroma, lots of carbonation, no banana - may need to warm a bit, great spicy malt character
-------- />
Name: Brau Weisse
Date: 06/09/2005

banana is back, 
-------- />
Name: Brau Weisse
Date: 06/08/2006
Source: ww

really nice banana in the aroma and flavor
-------- />
Name: Brau Weisse
Date: 07/05/2007
Mode: bottle
Source: aa

balanced banana and clove aroma, banana flavor has the sweetness tempered by the clove, 

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 14/20
Rating: 3.5/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **4
Draught.  Aroma of bananas, lemon and yeast.  Hazy yellow pour with a white head, good lacing.  Taste of spices, bananas and bread.  Great finish.

Aroma of lemon, wheat and yeast spice. Ripe hazy peach color with a white head that filmed rapidly. Medium bodied with creamy carbonation. Very fine bubbles. The flavor is wheat, banana and light stone fruit. There is floral hop, and hints of peach. The finish is not dry, but not sweet. There is banana and lemon. The mouth is left clean. Its quite refreshing.

Pours a hazy orange with an enclosed white rim and a small white head that reduces to nothing. Strong yeasty and creamy wheat on the nose. I also picked up some surprising robustness in the back of the scent; almost a frappucino-like aroma. Tastes include white rice, cream-of-wheat hot cereal, banana, some bubblegum, and white chocolate chip. Lively carbonation and medium/full body. Good, if forgettable.

Poured from a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass.  This hefeweizen poured a tradional cloudy, golden color with a fizzy, off-white head that slowly faded away.  Some very faint lace was left around the glass.  The aroma of this beer was made up of grassy lemon, wheat malt, with some light banana notes.  The flavor consisted of very faint spice and banana notes, and also some light citrus.  The mouthfeel was light-bodied and very crisp.  Almost champagne like as mentioned in the description.  This was a nice hefe, but the flavor was a bit boring and more restrained than I would have hoped for.

Dark brown colored, medium sized yellow head. Strong sweet banana in aroma, mildly grainy that makes some diference to lighter weizens. Medium bodied. Flavor is strongly sweet also with banana, yeast and grains come up too. Sweetness still in aftertaste, too sweet for my taste.

Aroma is spicy and yeasty.  Poured a hazy gold color with about a half-inch head.  Tastes of citrus, yeast, cloves.  Bubbly, but not overwhelmingly so.  Very smooth, with almost no aftertaste.  My favorite hefe so far.

From a 500 ml bottle purchased in Salt Lake City at the State Liquor Store  this poured a very attractive cloudy golden color with a fantastic fluffy white head that  hung on forever.  Nose is banana and wheat and floral.  Nice clean mouthfeel.  Flavor is very complex, with fruits, cloves, and yeast.  Great finish for a hefe, and good to the last drop.  Best hefe ever.
Pretty good hefe. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a nice fluffy white head. Tastes like wheat and bananas and malt. Smooth finish and watery taste. Not too bad.

500ml bottle, beautiful golden straw color cloudy, nice big white head, smells of fruit, banana, lemon, apples, wheat, very tasty indeed, good carbonation, very good beer overall, better than a lot of others in the same style.

nice gold with a big dense jelly head. strong aroma of bananas, lemons, and cloves with a light apple, hay, and flowers. medium light viscous body. the herbs and cloves really come through and the fruit is not as prominent, but definitely still there. some bread notes and a very smooth malt background. well rounded, smooth, very powerful but not heavy

6/30/07 On Draught at the Seattle International Beerfest.  Aroma is sour malt forward, wheat, peppery with some plasticy esters that are not objectionable for some reason.  Appearance is cloudy straw yellow with a low white head.  Flavor is sweet bubblegum, clovey with orange with a clean finish.  Mouthfeel is light bodied with a slight starchiness.  Overall, this is a great complex beer that is surprisingly easy drinking for all the flavor packed in.
This is a summer beer you can drink any time.  The citrus flavor is not overpowering but its there.  Drink it freely, as long as you are not driving.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2008 between this beer and paulaners hefe you cannot go wrong.  if you like the style, this beer just about sets the standard.  perhaps just a little sweeter than the paulaner.  a fantasitc beer made for the summer time, although I still think Paulaner is the best Hefe made.

(500mL bottle): Pours a very pale cloudy yellow body, big foamy white head, lasting. Fresh hay aroma, malts, some light fruit, like grapefruit. Light taste, watery, light malty aftertaste. Spicy, lemony taste, similar to the aroma. A little weakish & thin, but nice taste.

Draft-A cloudy yellow hue with a white head, with great retention.  A heavy malt aroma lemons and bread. Flavor was sweet at first, but grew very lemony and finished with a slight spice note.  Very heavy, and at times gassy.

Bottle. Nose is citric sourness, yeast and lemon. Cloudy pale yellow with no head. Smooth and clean palate with some sharpness. Flavor is underpronounced citrus, but nice. All around a refreshing hefe with a clean palate, slightly lacking in flavor.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden with a large rocky white head that lasts leaving good lacing. Aroma of wheat, citrus, bananas, yeast, vanilla, and clove. Taste is the same as aroma with a mild spicy tart finish. Medium mouthfeel thats slightly creamy and well carbonated. A very well done Hefeweizen perfect for a hot Florida Summer day.

Foggy, golden appearance with a large, fluffy,white head and decent lacing.  Wheaty aroma accented with banana, clove and lemon.  Yeasty, wheaty, fruity, mildly sweet flavors; muted hops; some spicyness and tartness in the aftertaste.  Creamy, medium-bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel.  Smooth, fruity, long lasting finish.
From a bottle pours a slightly hazy light amber color with lots of fluffy head.  Very light flavor not at all overpowering, very refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2007 Forse dovrei fare un secondo assaggio, ma non mi ha convinto proprio per niente; poco, poco, poco, poco, poco, e un retrogusto paludoso che mi ha lasciato decisamente perplesso. Bevuta al Black Sheep a Brescia, pagata 4.50; non sapevo che mi avrebbero portato perché nella lista cera scritto solo Weisse.

This is a superb hefe!  Absolutely perfect for the blazing summer days.  Had on draught at Blues BBQ in Charleston, WV.  Beautiful cloudy opaque deep straw pour.  It has a 3-finger head that lasts for great retention and leaves frothy lace. Sweet banana, some vanilla and slight clove to the nose.  There are mounds of banana and wheat flavors, with the finish really drawing in strong cloves.  The wheat, fruit and spice integration is almost unparalleled.  The carbonation level mixes with a silky mouthfeel to bring a perfectly contrasting zest to the palate.  For the dog days of summer, this may be one of the worlds best German hefes.  (Formerly, this was my favorite style, and Ive certainly had my share of them.  This offering is "par excellence".)  Prost!
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2008 Very refreshing on a hot summer day!  I really enjoyed this beer.  A nice smell and fruity flavor.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2008 Probably the best HW Ive had so far. Lot of fruit and even vanilla yet not too sweet.  Light, crisp, complex, great balance, soft water. outstanding. Classic summer session brew.

500ml vom fass at Hotel Schlierbergalm. Hazy orange body. Thin, white foamy head. Fresh fruity aroma. Yeast up front followed by a touch of cloves and banana. Moderate to thin body. Very easy to drink. Thirst quenching after a up mountain walk (19.06.2007).

Bubble gum, banana, lemon bouquet. Cloudy, dingy yellow/white pour, with a very thick creamy white head, great lacing. Thin and watery mouthfeel. Banana and cream flavor. Weak clove finish. Clean, pure, and all that a hefe should be.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2007 on tap at mews tavern 7/5/07. pours a golden orange color with a nice one finger head. smells of wheat, lemons, and spicy grasses. taste is on the mild side, some banana like sweetness, some yeast and spices. nice creamy feel, well done beer for the summer.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2013 Pours a light wheat-gold, with an inch or so of cotton-white head. Lacing is light and runny. Smell is of banana, sweet, light fruits, and weed-flowers. Taste starts wheaty, with hay, and hearty, unmalted barley, then blooms quickly into floral nectars, pear, spice, and dry, white grape. Finish is dry, and lightly tart, but sweet and grainy, also. Has a spritely mouthfeel, but is also chewy.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2007 Poured from a 500 ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy orangeish-yellow with a thick, foamy head.  A bit of lacing down the glass.  Small and taste were clove and slight banana.  I liked the subtle banana taste rather than the powerful banana taset in some American hefeweizens Ive tried.  Very refreshing beer.  I could very easily drink several of these on a hot summer day.

On draught, 7/2/07.  Pours a cloudy light orange color with a decent fair lasting head.  Previous kegs have always been a little more yellow with less cloudiness, not that Im complaining.  Nice citrus/clove aroma, nothing out of the ordinary.  Flavor seems to be a little heavier on the banana than I remember.  Either weve been getting older kegs up til this one or there has been a slight recipe/purveyor change at Ayinger.  Again, not that Im complaining, just noticing some subtle changes from the last keg to this one.

Bottle. Pours opaque orange gold with white head. The aroma is mild banana, assertive yeastiness, faint orange zest, and some clove. The flavor is zest, white bread, light banana, and clove esters. Some spicy and herbal hops add a refreshing crispness. Zesty and tingly finish with soft malty aftertaste. I was craving a good German Hefe to counter the intense Tennessee summer, and this hit the spot.
Sampled at the 2nd anual Litchfield brew fest. Light apperance. Creamy wheat taste with a chewy palate.

Bottle courtesy of Plucier: Poured a cloudy and hazy yellow/whitish color ale with a bit foamy head with great retention and some dark lees at the bottom of the bottle. Aroma of pure wheat with some nice ester and floral notes. Taste is dominated by refreshing wheat notes with some medium banana and ester notes also noticeable. Nice body with some low filtration and adequate carbonation and a creamy texture. Very well done overall and quite enjoyable with the warm weather.
A wonderful wheat beer. I especially enjoy this beer after going to the brewery in Aying and seeing their facility. Nothing to complain about with this one.

500ml bottle. pours hazy straw-golden with big white head. nose has nice banana, cloves, and cereal. flavor has banana, orange, toasted biscuit, crisp, light and fluffy, slightly sweet and crisp. very refreshing on a hot summer day. perfectly executed.
hazy golden-orange beer with one inch of white foam, banana aroma, spicy and yeasty with some fruit
Scents of banana and wheat.  A crisp, citrus?  tingle lingers throughout the finish. A lighter bodied offering which proves to be a refreshing example of a German wheat beer.
Sampled at a friends, this is nothing to write home about.  Pours gold with light disapating head.  Bananas on the mouthfeel

Very pleasant wheaty aroma with banana and lemon notes. It pours a cloudy straw colour with a decent white head. Theres a noticeable coriander flavour that makes me think of a wit, but the overal flavour doesnt carry through what the aroma promises. Very smooth on the palate with medium carbonation.

On tap at Mpar Room in Chicago.  A well done hefe.  I put Ayinger, Schneider, and Weihenstephaner at the top of good German hefes.  They are all similar-- maybe just different yeasts strains give each one a slightly different flavor?  Nice on a summer day.

Bottle from Monster Beverage in Glassboro.  Hazy goldenrod pour supporting a hefe-worthy tall white head.  Plenty of thick lacing.  Strong clove, banana and yeast on the nose.  Same flavors follow from the glass with a little lemon, apple and corriander.  Light but not thin texture and a wondefully crisp dry finish.  Nothing extraordinary but still a very good traditional German hefe.

16.9 oz. bottle. Strong, yeasty, classic hefeweizen aroma: orange, lemon, bubblegum, cinnamon. Smells great! Pours a cloudy gold with a large amount of white head and a small amount of suspended particulate. Seems to be even cloudier than a typical hefeweizen. Produces limited lacing. Flavor of bubblegum and skittles as well as sour citrus. Disappointing lack of complexity given the wonderful aroma. Tart. There is a slight touch of bitterness that I would not expect from a hefeweizen in the finish. Little aftertaste. Light to medium body. Lively in the palate. Easy to drink. A good example of a style that is perfect for a sunny late spring or summer day.

Deep golden color, hazy but not quite cloudy, good initial head that dissipates quickly, lasting carbonation. aroma is spice/banana. Flavor retains the spice and banana notes, and adds citrus, more tart than bitter. Very good overall for a wheat beer.
Pours hazy gold, puffy white head.  Aroma is yeasty, banana, and lemon.  Flavor is yeast, banana, vanilla.  Finish is spice.  A lot of flavors, but doesnt do much for me.
Bottle.  I didnt have many notes for this beer other than the aroma was bready and had hints of banana, apple and pear.  Nicely carbonated with a foamy head.   light body. classic hef

Bottle.  Cloudy pale straw color, high white head and mild carbonation.  Buttery wheat aroma with slight lemon zest, just a hint of hops detected.  Tingly plate with a sticky filmy feel.  The filmy feel coincides with a soapy flavor.  A lemony soap taste kind of like the dish detergent my wife uses.  Germans might love to tout the the purity law, but quality control was lacking on this weisse.

Nose of cereal & grain, subtle fruit.  Pours a cloudy straw.  The nice cascade resolves itself into a super colossal white uber creamy and mega stiff head that is fully lasting, and leaves light lace.   The light flavor is malty but not overly so.  The light body is very creamy and soft.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2008 Bottle in Franziskaner glass.  Pours beautiful pale, cloudy yellow/orange with lasting dense white head.  Aroma is citrus, banana and vanilla-like sweetness.  Very refreshing and assertive flavors of banana, vanilla, tartness, and spiciness.  Medium-light body with medium carbonation.  Excellent example of this style IMHO.

Had this again 4/11/08. Deserves more ovall points.  Awesome.

Tap: Lively hazy yellowish pour with an initially large frothy white head. Very yeasty aroma with wheat hints. Sharp carbonation, with a nice wheat malt character, and some sweet banana notes. A decent Hefeweizen; good session beer.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy yellow color with a thick creamy white head. The aroma is a yeast fruit almost banana like, very nice one the nose. Wow fruit jumped out to my taste buds, but still had a nice bready yeast and sour bite that is common to hefe! I adore this one.

color is cloudy yellowwith a tall fluffy white head.  aroma is yeasty wheat malt, merangue, and banana.  flavor is mostly sweet wheat malt and banana, yeasty, dusty, and lightly tangy too.  spice is faint like a pinch of cardamon.  good for its style.

Rated 1/17/06:  Cloudy deep-golden yellow as it pours into my glass, high carbonation with a consistantly thin head and ample lacing. I allowed this one to breathe for a bit and was rewarded with the most aromatic hefe that Ive tried to date. Refreshing aroma of fruits and spices with a more moderate amount of the typical "banana" flavor associated with hefes. As I sipped on this one I was rewarded with a well balanced wheat beer. Just like the aroma all of the nice flavors blended together and complimented each other. No dominant aspect with this one, a truly remarkable hefe-weizen.

Sweet and wheaty aroma. Slightly bitter with touch of citrus rind. Light cloudy amber beer. Frothy white lacing head. Medium heavy carbonation and light body. Light and refreshing in taste. Wheaty with light citrus notes. Bubblegum and alcohol. Clean sweet finish and aftertaste. Easy to drink but doesnt make me want another.
Bottle. Beautiful lemon color. Nice white, fluffy head. Wonderful aroma of banana. Crisp, clean taste. Another great example of the style.

Bottle.
Hazy yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of fruits, bananas, caramel and spices.
Flavour of bananas, fruits, yeast and spices.
(Bottle 50 cl) Courtesy of Grovlam. Pours an opaque golden with a creamy, white head. Distinct aroma of yeast. Medium body, very yeasty with some banana and diacetyl. 230407

Bottle. 1 Pint .9 FL OZ. Cloudy, golden yellow color with big, sudsy white head.  Fruity, yeasty aroma with notes of spice.  Exceptionally smooth palate.  Flavor is mildly sweet with dry finish.  A nice, balanced beer.
Bottle.  Cloudy orange/yellow.  Aroma is citrus and a tinge of vanilla.  Flavor is that of Bananas, yeast, and a bit of citrus.  Pretty solid Hefe.

large bottle at friends house.  Cloudy golden with a thin white head.  aroma is sweet light and citrussy.  Taste is sweet and light and really drinkable, I like this as far as german brews go, but I dont  drink them enough.  Brings me back to Germany.

Pours a pale straw yellow, cloudy, dissipating head.  Aroma is surprisingly vanilla-y like the description says.  Downplayed spices and citrus, but its there.  Taste mingles with breadlike flavors, vanilla, lemon, and light cloves.  Finishes a little tangy at first, then dries out and almost disappears.  Interesting and very drinkable.  Fairly light on the palate, but thats expected.  A good hefeweizen, but doesnt pack quite the punch that I want.
Sample from 50 cL bottle. Pours unfiltered yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is wheat and slight yeast. Flavour of bananas and yeast. Wheat. Finish is soft yeast.

Bottle. Average off-white fizzy head that mostly lasted. Good lacing. Cloudy orange color. Banana, yeast, clove, coriander, citrus and wheat. Medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Flavor was light sweet with hint of acidic from the citrus notes. Sweet finish.

Bottle at Falstaff, Paris. A hazy gold studded with rising carbonation, perched atop is a huge foamy white head.  Aroma is wheat upfront, as well as slight banana, floral, and spice character.  Taste brings up bubblegum, banana, a lingering sour wheat character.  Has an impressive and hard to place varying sweet/sour after that was enjoyable.  High carbonation and pleasing on the palate.
Banana was extremely prominent throughout the beer and the head retention was ridiculously long.  I enjoyed this beer very much but I think after two it would become too sweet.

Pours cloudy light amber with a fluffy white head. Aroma is bread, banana and vanilla, kind of reminds me of a breakfast cereal.. Flavor is creamy, with banana bread and citrus.  A very flavorful, but light beer.  I like it a lot.
Pours a cloudy orange with a small white head. I could smell some banana, spices and wheat. Flavor was a little sweet and wheaty. Good Hefeweizen.

A good wheat beer, very satisfying.  Cloves in aroma, orange in taste as well as lemon.  Good mouthfeel though not the most outstanding I have had for a hefe, banana mouthfeel with little of the latters taste.

I am a fan of the hefeweizens. I liked this beer, but it was too lemony. I am used to a cloudy orange color with a mix of citrus fruit. This hefe had lemon notes to it all the way. The beer poured a cloudy lemon with little head. The beer was creamy and nice. I was impressed with this beer, but it reminded too much of a lager to be a hefe. Sorry Ayinger, but too much lemon.
Taste of smoke and eucalyptus or menthol! Fantastic... very pale colour, thick, white head. Aroma of cloves and wheat, nothing special there.

Tart aroma along with the typical hefe aromas.  Cloudy yellow in appearance.  Not alot of floaters as in some unfiltered hefes.  Excellent flavor - citrusy flavor and very bubbly.  This is a really fine beer.   A real German Treat.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2007 500ml bottle.  Pours a hazy, pale straw color with a bunch of carbonated bubbles and one of the biggest white heads Ive ever seen.  Aroma is beautiful clove, banana, yeast, strong vanilla, lemony citrus.  Very appetizing aroma.  Taste is creamy, crisp and refreshing.  Quite light but has a nice citrusy finish.  I wish this had a bit more punch to it but see how this could be an ideal summer brew.  A solid hefe.

I do see and taste the look and feel of a champagne with this beer.  This was an excellent hefe with a lot of flavor, great carbonation and an abundant amount of sizzle.  One of my favorites that I can drink for a long time.
Draft at Ayinger Speis & Trank. Pours cloudy palish yellow.  Aroma is fruit and sugary, tastes is sweet w/some spice.  Pretty good weiss though not my favorite Ayinger.

Bottle Poured a cloudy golden body with nice size head that stayed. Aroma is of sweet citrus with a slight yeast lingering in there. Flavor was sweet with citrus tones and a yeasty aftertaste. Very good Hefe, very smooth and balanced.

Smallish shiny white head. Hazy opaque orange body. Spicy citric banana aroma, somewhat tart, with faint milky rubbery notes. Very harmonic. Taste is citric fruity wheat. Lots of carbonation in the mouth. Dry, spicy grapefruit aftertaste. Very nice and clearly a well-made weizen. (0.5l bottle.)

From a 500 ml bottle purchased at "Keller’s IGA" in Cincinnati, Ohio - This one pours a golden brew with a long lasting hite head of foam and a distinctly  bananas-clove-straw aroma.Tastewise, YES, THIS IS THE REAL STUFF! A true German hefe, and a damn good one!

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 Bottle. Aroma has light notes of straw, moderate notes of grass and lemon (no I didnt add any), barnyard for the yeast and a bright corriander overtone. The massive rocky head was pure white and fully lasting, and the excellent lacing reminded me of melting snow on a slate roof. the golden color added to the spring-time feeling of this beer. Flavor was slightly tart with a bitter finish. It has a medium body with a creamy texture, lively carbonation and a moderately astringent finish.
Bottle.Lemon,wheat and spice aroma.Cloudy gold appearance.Medium body.Soft mouthfeel.Mellow flavors of pepper,spices.Hints of fruit.A very nice hefe.

Poured from a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass, cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma was of yeast, cloves and banana. The taste was subtle with hints of cloves, citrus and banana and a bready nose. This is a well done wheat beer along the lines of Weihenstephaner. I still prefer the heavier clove taste of Paulaner, but if that is not your thing this is a very fine beer.
on tap @ Pizza Plant Walker. The best Hefe Ive had to date. Thick Creamy huge head. The hefe I compare all others to for now on.

bottle- sampled today in beers of the world class. pours very light golden color, white head, sudsy-foamy and it is slightly cloudy, aroma is strong wheat smell, apples, corriander and some yeast in the background. tastes all that is promised in nose flat mouth feel, dry finish.
Lively carbonation.  Crisp lemon and banana flavor.  Very refreshing.  Gold standard for a hefeweizen.
Very good Hefeweizen!  It had great flavors that really complimented my brisket, easy drinking and smooth.  I would get this again anytime.
Nice rich yeasty banana flavors, with hints of baking spices.  Yet another superb brew from Ayinger.
This beer was smooth, tasty and went well with my steak. loved that it was easy to pronounce a German beer for once. Would want to see this beer more.

This beer is everything a Hefeweizen should be. Pours a hazy pale gold. Aroma is incredibly fruity, spicy, pleasing. Flavor is similar, balanced with lots of fruit, citrus, wheat and spice. Very smooth, easy drinking. My favorite in the style.

On Tap at Drafting Room (Exton, PA) Served in a pint glass. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Beautiful Hefe aroma with the expected banana, clove and wheat. Very crisp. Refreshing yeast and citrus balanced out with a bit of clove. Has always been one of my favorite hefes.

Bottle from Plaza Liquor - Pours a hazy straw color with a good sze white head.  Light lacing.  Aroma is banana, spice, and light citrus.  Flavor is banana, yeast, spice, and light citrus.  A smooth, light to medium body beer.  A very nice German Hefe.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a large bubbly white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, hintos of citrus, bready, grainy malts...overall a great Hefe aroma.  Flavor of Hefe yeast with clove spiciness up front, citrus and banana along with it.  Crisp, carbonated yet not thin like some in the style.  One of the best I have had.

cloudy hazy staw color, with a good two inches of pure white creamy foam. Slight lacing after the head dies back to a quarter inch or less. Good banana in the aroma.

Nice sweetness and some tart lemon in the upfront flavor. Then the lemon fades completely and the sweetness turns to wheat and breadiness. Some underlying clove. A bit of spicy hops right at the end of the flavor.  It finishes thin and a bit watery

I dont know if I was drinking the same beer as all of you, because this beer simply failed to impress me at all. It looks great, with a nice, big, long-lasting head and a cloudy light honey colour. But alas, I found the taste watery. It simply didnt have as much flavour as other wheat beers that I had. What I did taste was all the good stuff, but not quite enough of it.

Pours beautiful golden with small off-white head that lasts. Nose is creamy and citrus. In the flavor I get candied pear/apple, tangerine, and milky caramel, well balanced. I detected a LOT of ETOH in the middle to the end. Aftertaste is mildly bitter and flavorful. Good.

(Bottle) Pours a hazy yellow with a good sized head. Fine carbonation with a fruity and yeasty aroma. Banana and some citrus in the taste. Slightly sour aftertaste. Nicely balanced. One of the best hefeweizens Ive had.
Poured from bottle. Gold color, nice head. Very sweet aroma...Definitely bananans, lemon and vanilla. This was a very enjoyable beer! Very easy to drink.
On tap.  It is a solid bright yellow color.  aroma of bananas are very obvious.  Very smooth and easy drinking.  tons of banana flavors.  Very bready and a slight hint of citrus.
Bottle, 330mL: Pours hazy yellow, weak white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, and yeast. Very satisfying sour/sweet flavor with just the right refreshing mouthfeel. An excellent wheat. Marvelous.

This was my second experience with Ayinger, and I am rapidly becoming a fan!  Wheaty and sweet, with a very smooth finish. I found this to be a very refreshing Hefeweisen, and I am certain to pick it up again.

This is the best Hefeweizen Ive had.  Very well put together.  Solid citrus notes that arent overpowering.  Not watered down, either.  As stated in the description, it is a benchmark for this style of beer.  That says it all.
A very good hefe.  Smooth sweet wheat taste.  Lots of yeast.  Mildly dry finish.  Very nice.
Cloudy straw color.  Very creamy and thick white foam.  Smells of cloves and bananas.  The taste is sweet and "wheat-ey" lol.  Good beer.

This is a new favorite of mine.  The perfect balance of bitter and sweet.   Very smooth and easy to drink, yet a complex palate of bananas and malted wheat with a dry finish.  This has become my favorite hefe-weizen.
Get some spice,wheat and yeast in the aroma.Pours a copper color with a big off white head.Get some lemon with some sweetness in the flavor.Nice carbonation with some sweetness in the finish.
