Bottle. Cloudy lemon color with a nice big white head. Aroma is full of wheat and yeast, hints of lemon as well. Flavor is wheat, lemon, vanilla, and yeast. A pretty decent beer.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2012 Bottle. A hazy medium blonde beer. with a huge, frothy, fully lasting, white head. The aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted bread), lightly to moderately yeasty (dough), with notes of banana, pear, bubblegum, lemon, hint of spices. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, average lenght finish with light to moderate bitterness. I firstly had this one in Aying back in 2006, and since then its always been consistent. Excellent aroma, very fruity and a bit spicy (but somehow more peppery than clovey this time). Really enjoyable.

The commercial description is generally accurate (although the champagne comparison is a tad ambitious). A very pleasant lightweight wheat beer with a distinct lemony finish. 500 ML bottle acquired at Milwaukees Discount Liquor for $2.69.

500ml brown bottle. Lemon yellow colour. Head is large, creamy, rocky, fine bubbles. Wheaty nose, some yeast and faint lemony note. Soft cloves notes, faint banana, abundant wheat malts. Aftertaste has more banana and clove. Creamy body, finely carbonated. Nice hefe.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 12-29-23 re-rate. Wheat and faint banana in the nose. Huge white creamy head. This is the way a beer should look. Murky dark yellow when care is made to ensure all sediment and yeast is poured in the glass. Some citrus in the flavor. A hint of sourness along with some breadiness. Not bad but not as good as my previous rating or those of the collective ratebeer community would indicate. 10-29-06. Excellent banana aroma. Thisis the way a German weissbier should smell. Cloudy orange body whose head disapates too quickly. Head almost fully diminished and virtually no lace. Very lively carbonation. Nice flavor. Seems a little too electric, though. 9,3,8,3,14

Light banana and lemony ester aroma. Furious clearish gold pour. Rocky top of super foam. Flavor, an almost distant smoky sweetness. Plain estery malt, with edges of banana, faint toast and light celery. Nice body. Smacks a little unexciting. Not the most fulfilling of weisses for me. Slight sourness. Light apple skin balance. Smacks of grain husks.
On tap. Hazy yellow, white head. Aroma is coriander, lemon, yeast. Flavor is banana, lemon, wheat, coriander. A bit watery.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2007 This beer pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium white head that dissipates very quickly w/ no lacing on the sides. Flavor is very lemony and zesty with good notes of bananas in there!  Perfect for those summer afternoons when you want a cool refreshing beer!  This beer is awesome for the style.  Love this beer!  Cheers!

From Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with long lasting head. You really can smell the banana and floral aroma in this one. The banana flavor is real evident as well. Body was medium thick just the way I like it. Not my favorite but never the less damn good.

Hazy yellow, good head that lasts.  Flavor is pretty good, fruity, banana, clove, all the expected stuff, little bit of yeast.  Has a real nice texture to the mouthfeel.  Kind of refreshing.  Really good brew that Ill have again.

Bottle pours cloudy golden with a nice white head that stays pretty well.  Good aroma of bannana, clove, and a touch of lemon.  Flavor is yeast, bannana, clove, a little lemon and maybe some bubblegum there too.  Palate is light airy and quite drinkable.  Good, crisp and refreshing..  Nice Hefe here..
Pours a cloudy yellow with a large white head. Nice aroma of lemon and bananas, little bit of yeast. Nice flavor, clean finish. Very good.

Bottle.  Im not normally a wheat beer lover, but this is really good.  Cloudy yellow body with a big white head of small bubbles.  Aroma is light, and lemony with a bit of other fruit (peach?).  Flavor is light, but complex with lemon, banana, and spice.  Best hefeweizen Ive had.
Lemon, banana, bubble gum, clovers, and dough.  Very light hops. Refreshing. One of the best wheat beers Ive had.

draft - Pours orangish-yellow with a moderate head.  This beer smells great with lots of citrus and banana aromas.  The flavor is of yeast and banana most prominently and a mild spicy note.  Its got a smooth feel with a medium body.  The finish is clean and refreshing.  This might be my favorite hefeweizen thus far.

I was over at a local liquor store and they were selling pints of this Ayinger for $1 a piece. I must say, Im very impressed with this weisse.  Very aromatic, smells of banana and spice.  Flavorful; tastes of banana, clove, bubble gum, yeast.  Finishes fairly clean and leaves me wanting another gulp!  Im going to have to get more of this stuff. Bravo, Ayinger!

(bottle) Cloudy orange colour with a huge, slowly lacing foamy white head. Clean and balanced yeasty banana-fruitiness, wheat character and clovy notes. Moderately sweet flavour, well-bodied with a sparkling carbonation. Wheaty and fruity (banana, citrus) taste; fruity and moderately clove-spicy finish. A fine and not too heavy, well-rounded Hefeweizen with session qualities.

Tap at the Acadia Cafe.  This tastes so much like Sprite to me its almost silly.  Quite an enjoyable wheat, though - flavors of lemon, more light fruits, etc.  Maybe ill compare that taste more to "champagne."  Thats a bit more palatable i suppose.
Draugth @ Hardrock cafe, München. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium white head. Aroma is of whete, lemon, banana, and some earth spices. Flavor is mostly the same with some hint of citrus.

Appealing pour of a large, white head on hazy yellow body. Sweet aroma of banana, pear, caramel, clove and grain. Very sweet flavor on top of banana, pear, bready malts and grassy hops. Lively carbonation from a thin to medium body results in a comfortable mouthfeel. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2006 Will definatley try again because I was unable to drink according to specifications, but this wasnt my favorite wheat.  A bit overly fruity and floral for me, tasted like green grapes and apples.  A very nice wheat flavor, great mouthfeel, but just couldnt really apprecciate the fruitiness.  A nice beer, but not my favorite wheat.

Hazy lemon pour with lots of spritzy carbonation.  Buttery nose is layered with sweet breads, vanilla wafers and sweet fruits.  The body is equally sweet, with lots of caramelly malts and banana cream notes.  Really drinkable and well balanced - the yeast plays a secondary role to the sweet malts and makes this really work.  Good stuff.
17oz bottle-pours a white head with cloudy yellow color and effervescence.  Aroma is banana, wheat.  Taste is banana, wheat, clove, creamy.  Mild/OK carbonation.

Hazy light gold with normal sized head. Nose of bananas and cloves. Taste is much the same, with some spice and lemon. Ive never been a huge fan of the original hefes (love pales and ipas), but this one is rather nice...and is changing my mind overall.

Rating 400!  16.9 oz, no date.  Pours a cloudy light golden with a large rocky white head.  Aroma of banana cream pie, cloves, yeast, a little citrus, possibly some spice.  The taste was much the same, which overall is what a hefe is supposed to taste like, though this is done very well.  Highly carbonated--too much--and light bodied.  Overall pretty darn good for a hefe.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Ultra-frothy and fizzy head that lasted forever.  Nice hazy golden-yellow color, the archetype for the hefeweizen.  Citrusy and flowery aroma with elements of yeast, wheat, spices (clove, nutmeg), and banana.  The perfect balance of typical hefeweizen flavors:  wheat, yeast, citrusy, spicy, bubblegum/banana somewhere in there... just awesome.  As close to a perfect example of the style as one can reasonably get.

Bottle.  Lemon flavor- retains a solid acidic lemon flavor from start to finish, neither bitter nor sweet.  Good light yellow color with white frothy head.  Fairly dry on the palate with good cabonation.  A good solid hefe.  Very drinkable and straight forward.
500 ml great banana and citrus aroma, with slight overtones of vanilla.  pours a beautiful golden yellow with lasting white head.  this is a fantastic beer, and one of my new favorites.

Bottle 50F Weizen.  Yeast notes, with very citric undertones very similar to lemon zest, a bit of clove and pepper.  Light golden color almost a cloudy yellow, with a medium white head that remains nicely.  Sweet and sour tastes, good citrus notes, great bread like yeast characters.  Great light and sweet notes very delicious, umm one of the better wheats I have tasted. Medium Palate with high carbonation, nice bannana taste. Good feel on the tongue finishes nicely dry.  A+  A very good example of the german wheat, subtle and complex with great light notes that make for easy drinking. Achtung ganz gut bier!

From the bottle.
<!-- p -->
Pours a hazy yellow with a voluminous white head. The aroma is cloves, vanilla, bazooka bubblegum, a hint of lemon, plenty of yeast. The flavor is more or less as expected from the aroma, only more so - a very Hefe Hefeweizen here, relatively sweet, yeasty, plenty of wheat in the flavor as well.  The mouthfeel is smooth and enjoyable.
<!-- p -->
This may not be my favorite style, but its certainly a very well executed example thereof.

Very typical-looking hefeweizen: cloudy yellow body with a very lush, creamy white head.  Full, wheaty nose, with some citrus/lemon peels. Herbal/grassy flavor.  Slightly sweet finish, yet slightly tart and sour.

Hazy golden with an impressively sustained head - aroma of lemon, yeast, banana and a mild spiciness - soft on the palate - refreshing, with mild sweet malts, some banana and clove - some belgian-like floral qualities and a touch of honey - great summer brew.

500 ml bottle. Should have read the description before I poured: kicks up a BIG head in my small weizen glass. Foam becomes rocky as it settles atop a very cloudy yellow body, almost in wit territory. Smell carries notes of clove and citrus, while the usual banana smell is in the background. Tasting instantly brings up lemon zest, some more banana, and sweet Bavarian malts. Yeasty, but in a good way. Cant find those flowery impressions they speak of, but that would be the first thing to be lost on a long import trip. I can see calling it "dry," but not by much. Certainly does NOT need a lemon slice in it, its fine by itself.
500ml bottle pours a beautiful golden color with a nice foamy head with aromas of lemon ,banana,yeast and malts.Its a refreshing brew on a hot day.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2006 Excellent Beer!! Poured a beautiful cloudy golden with a thick white head. Nose of bananas, yeast, clove and lemons. Tastes wonderful with cloves and spices that have good presence without being cloying as some weisse beers can be. My new favorite hefeweizen!!

[Portland International Beer Festival  Tap]
A unfiltered golden colored brew with a good head.  Liked the wheat flavors along with some other malts.  The hops where noticeable and the beer drank very easy.  Liked this as a good after working outside all day brew.
Another step on my wheat appreciation quest. Poured Murky yellow with a foamy white head. Plenty of yeast, wheat and carbonation. Nice citrus and butter notes. Another very drinkable wheat.
Cloudy orange color with a creamy white head. Sweet fruit and banana aroma. Sweet wheat and banana flavor.

For me to give a hefe a score like this says a lot, as I really never like them. While this still has the clove and banana thing that I dont dig,  great aroma with a bit of lemon in the front without being overly sweet make this outstanding.

Wonderful clove, lemon, banana, yeast, and wheat aromas flowing out of the pillowy, thick white head. The flavor follows suit, with herbal clove and yeasty wheat, that goes down all to easy, with a refreshing, clean mouthfeel.. A classic example of the style, and delicious on a hot sunny day!

Wonderful Hefe beer. Very creamy with heavy yeast taste. Lightly carbonated and very easy to drink....hints of wheat, banana, and small amounts of honey were noticed. Had a large, fluffy head. This beer is by far one of the best!
This is a real nice wheat beer. Pours hazy golden color with a large lasting head. A good crisp sharp taste.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2006 500 ml bottle

At just around $2.50, this was one of the better deals for a quality beer   I have seen around.  It almost rivals Capitals Kloster Weizen for a favorite,   except that I can get the latter fresher.  Still, this one might just be a   close second on price and quality.

Aroma / Appearance - Hints of banana, oatmeal, wheat, fruit and honey   greeted my eager nose.  The cloudy nectarine colored body had a rich   two-finger head with active carbonation bubbling to the top.  The pleasing   looking brew looked like it was going to fit the bill after a long day   outside in 90 degree temperatures.

Flavor / Palate - Creamy ripe bananas were the first thing to hit my   taste buds.  Muted underneath that was a combination of wheat, oats and a   mild bitterness that hit the back of the mouth.  A sweet, pleasant hoppiness   followed not too long afterwards.  The sweet banana taste dominated my   impressions but it was not so strong as to mask everything else.  This was   solid all the way through to the end of the glass.  It might become a nice   summer drinker, especially at the price Woodmans charges for it.  Pick it   up to get a feel for a well done hefeweizen.
Beautiful with big bubbled white head; Malt, soap perfect except for a little metal; Perfect body except from being a bit to creamy; Perfect finish except begin a bit malty, buttery.
Nice Banana to this one,hints of spice, but Banana dominates, some yeast. very easy drinking, great flavor.

Rocky crag floats on the beer, colapsing quickly under its own weight.  Body is a strong cloudy tan orange.  Nose is the classic clove and banana with a hint of corriander.  The mouth is wheat wtih some clove and a nice hallertau freshness.  Tounge fades fast with a residual spice.

Yeasty aroma, with a hint of spice and maybe a touch of banana.

Initial taste is of slight clove and yeasty sweetness.

Mouthfeel is excellent with a very smooth and full finish that tastes of banana, spice, slight fullness that remains.

As soon as I opened the bottle, I caught a rich banana smell and just assumed it was coming from something else in the kitchen... upon pouring, the smell was verifiable as the thick head formed. Bubbles rising to the top, the cloudy deep yellow appearance was a sight and the head didnt subside until half way through, leaving only a ring of head round the edges. The aroma was bananas, citrus, cloves (much more spice than I was expecting), and a touch of yeast. The flavor was the same, but the mouthfeel was disappointingly thin. Sure, its summer and light is refreshing, but I wanted a little more. (Dont get me wrong, Id get another one of these in a flash, but...)

Bottle. Pale golden color, hazy, with huge white head. Terrific nose of herbal notes, yeast, sour citrus, wheat, and some bubblegum chalkiness. Creamy, full mouthfeel with very well balanced flavors of all of the above, slightly fruity toward the end, with a bit of a yeast bite in the finish. Drunk at room temp. This is darned tasty!
Bottle sampled with Stegosaurus. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of Bananas, citrus, and yeast. Flavor is  citrus, bananas , and yeast. Good hefe.
Beautiful golden color with a nice thick head.  Adequate carbonation and a crisp wheaty/sweet flavor.  Clean finish.  Wonderful Weisse!
Pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium white head.  Aroma is of whete, lemon, banana, and some earth spices.  Flavor is mostly the same with some hint of citrus.  Not a bad brew, pretty decent.

Courtesy of Porterhouse
<!-- P -->
Aroma is slightly dusty at first followed by bannana and cream notes. Cloudy muted yellow in color with a huge and lasting, creamy white head. Fore is yeast, bannana some mild citrus and a mildly sweet creamy smoothness. Very satisfying and tasty.
Bottle from Bev Mo La Mesa.  Pours a cloudy medium golden color.  Head is off white and big!   Nose of banana, lemon,  vanilla and yeast.  Flavor is much the same.

Bottle 500ml.  Poured hazy gold, slightly amber at the bottom of my weizen glass, big fizzy-foamy white head - a little too pale.  Damn thats a fine aroma - fresh sweet fruity malt, I get apple, banana, pear, hard candy, light spice, a bit of lemon in the later sniffs.  Taste is pretty similar, plenty of banana, lemon, treefruit, soft sweet spice, and a nice hint of peppery hop bitterness in the finish.  Its a tad watery, but its very soft, pleasingly lightly carbonated, not acidic or astringent at all, has a quick finish and a light fruit linger - sweet, but just right.

Pours a hazy, lemony yellow with a big, fizzy white head. Mostly fading. The aroma is banana, cloves, bubblegum, peaches and ctirus. The flavor is loaded with bubblegum, banana, lemons, apricots, lightly spiced at the end. Medium body with lively carbonation.
ayinger hasnt let me down yet.  this is pretty much a typical hefeweizen in every way, but its got more flavor than franzikaner and weihest.... whatever its called, so i like this more.
Bottle from MoritzF. Thanks! Flowers, citrus and grape juice packed in the aroma. Clove, banana, flowers and citrusfruit in the flavor. Well made hefeweizen, both with drinkability and character.
this beer was excellent.  Nice spring fresh taste  - crisp and spicy at the same time.  This is a perfect example of its style

Bottle, at Delirium Cafe.
Golden, unclear, large white head. Moderate malty (coriander, citrus, heavy fruity), light hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet, light acidic/bitter. Light to medium body, low carbonated (almost flat). Really big!
Bottle: Cloudy yellow, white head. Some bananas, bready, some cinamin possibly. Flavor was similar, really bright on the palate, a little chewy, and a nice dry finish. Very good beer.

Bottled. Sampled at Delirium Café, Göteborg. 
Almost clear golden colour. Wonderfully estery nose that brings a thick fruitiness, plus a little phenolic metal profile. Big flavour with loads of fruitiness in the sesters and also phenols. Low on Co2. Long flavour. This is hefeweizen!

Aroma: So many layers... Yeast, grain, spices and fruity banana and some citrus
Appearance: Cloudy and a lovely straw yellow pours with a huge foamed milk like head which settles with lovely lacing down the glass
Flavor: Sweet wheat, with a slight sour and caramel notes, spicy and finishing with oh so there... banana and lemony flavor
Palate: Light bodied spritzy so that it dances on the tongue... fleeting thru sweet, spicy and slightly sour flavors leaving a lasting dry spicy and fruity finish
Overall: WOW! This is fantastic.... what all hefe-weizens want to be. Dont decide you dont like the hefe-weizen till you try this... well then again you cannot go back 
I would like to try it on tap closer to the source and see how much better it could be. The bottle I tried seemed to have seen effects of some heat...

Bottle: Hazy, yellow-orangey coloured, mid-sized fluffy white head, rather quickly diminishing; sweetish fruity nose: lemons, bananas, a bit grainy with a tinge of yeast; quite sweet flavour with a little sourish touch, fizzy but soft mouthfeel, medium bodied; short, fruity, a bit caramelly, a bit sourish finish. Quite well rounded, chewy Weizen.......

Pours with a rapidly dissipating head and a meak, slightly fruity aroma. Flavor dominated by clove with some mild fruitiness and a watery mouthfeel of a bottle left open too long before pouring. Light and maybe refreshing, but with little tartness to cleanse the palate.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2007 Bottle from Johns Grocery - Lots of citrus taste; backtaste was a little spicey and wheaty; not heavy at all and goes down very easy; a very good hefe!

RE-RATE:

1pt .9oz bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors poured into weizen - Pours cloudy orange gold with a 2 finger sudsy white head; Plenty of wheat, banana, malt, floral hops, and a very slight hint of lemon to the nose; Banana, lemon, a little coriander, and yeast (which adds to the taste in a very positive way) on the initial taste; Spices (coriander mostly), very mellow lemon, bread backtaste; A fairly full palate; Not watery and not heavy, just right for a weizen; Refreshing carbonation that makes it smooth to go down for the most part; Revisiting now that I have a good system in place and have acquired a bit of a taste for different kinds of beer! Not what I remember. Much more complex. Definitely a good one and my favorite hefe that I can easily get my hands on. A standard that everyone should put their lips to.

Hazy honey coloured beer with a tremendous head that took several pauses during the pour so as not to spill. Once it settled, it formed chunky peaks and shapes before slowly fading. BIG aromas of banana, vanilla, wheat. Very smooth mouthfeel, with classic flavours of banana, citrus, and sweet spices with a wheaty-yeasty backbone. Silky finish. One of the best wheats Ive had.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle 500ml sampled with Beerded_one. Pours hazy golden with a large monsterous white head. Aroma of Bananas, citrus, wheat, and sweetness. Flavor is smooth, citrus, banana, wheat, mild carbonation, and spices. Body is a little thin. But a very good Hefeweizen.
pours milky gold, slight haze, nice white head, lemon aroma. lemon wheat taste. Mild flavor, thin mouthfeel. Not a heavy beer, easy to drink

Bottle.  Pours gold with a thin white head with lots of bubbles coming to the top.  Aromas of banana, lemons and clove.   Very carbonated.  Lots of yeast and very mild flavors as compared to the aroma.  More of the same bananas, cloves and wheat.  Carbonated and thin mouthfeel.  Average.

Bottle.  Pours a yellow gold with a slight haze.  Decent head that leaves a fine lacing behind.  Citrus and banana on the nose, but those flavors are mild upon tasting.  Maybe a little bit thin and not as creamy as I had hoped.  Not a very robust hefeweizen, but the trademark flavors are present. A good hefeweizen, but I was expecting better.

Pale gold with a greenish shine; good whitish head. Cloves, some banana and faint citrus - AND wheat, very obvious. Sweetish-fruity taste, and a peppery, spicey finish. Well-bodied, but a bit fizzy. A bit basic Weizen, Id expect better from them.

Cloudy yellow to gold depending on the width of the wheat-beer glass. Big foamy lasting head. Lots of carbonation. Wheat and zesty lemon aroma. Banana and light honey flavour. Lemon finish. Zesty body with a bit of chewiness. Refreshing.

Big banana and bubblegum aroma, nice bready wheat as well.  Cloudy pale yellow, huge white head, took a while to pour.  Sweet flavor, banana, bubblegum, vanilla, bread.  Medium body, high carbonation.  This is a great example of the style that leans towards the banana/bubblegum end of the style (as opposed to those that favor clove/spiciness).  I could drink a lot of this.

Pour is a cloudy yellow with a small white head.  Aroma is is kind of weak but i do get some wheat and yeast.  Flavor is pure lemon zest with a touch of corriander.  This is just and average hefe and the Ayinger dunkel has more of a flavor proflie.
spicy yeast aroma. Pours a very nice cloudy yellow, thick foamy white head. High acid profile. Mouthfeel seems thicker and more robust than some of the lower end hefes. Sour crisp finish. Solid hefe.

Beer pours a clear, light, bright gold with a large, frothy, white, quickly and mostly diminishing head. The aroma is malty with light notes of toasted grain; light notes of banana, clove, vanilla, and a trace note of fake-butter. The flavor is moderately sweet and trace bitter with a short, lightly sweet finish with a teeny tiny trace plastic note in the retro. The body is light, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively.

I wondered what the heck a brau weisse was, but as soon as a tasted it I knew it was a hefe.  Has a nice cloudy pale colour, taste is a bit spicy, had on tap, so didnt get to do all the special pouring the description says, but still a decent hefe.

Incredible hefe.  Pours cloudy dark yellow with a puffy white head.  Aroma of bananas and wheat.  Very smooth and strong taste.  Wheat, yeast, bananas, lemon, and citrus all mixed and balanced throughout.  Highly recommended.

Great head and lacing.  Great aroma of yeast and lemon.  As is Taco Macs style, this was server waay too cold.  After I let it warm up some the real wheat aroma came through.  Taste is, of course, right on for this good example of a German Hefe.  I was glad to see, at least, that the bartender didnt put a lemon slice in the beer.  This is a great beer to have on a hot, early summer day in Atlanta.

This was poured from a 16oz bottle into a huge weizen glass.Its appearance was cloudy and yellow with a nice white head.The aromas of banana and wheat and lemon were awesome and seductive.Then the taste,which included all the aromas,as well as bubblegum made this beer a fantastic beer experience.

Porurs smoothly w/  a thunk like good beer should.  Huge golden to white head.  Initial hoppy smell followed by fruits and cereal.  Cloudy but not murky composition.  Clear enough to see bubbles rising.  Very prounouced sweet banana taste.  Also some apricot, rich heavy cream, and fresh dough.  Very appealing mouthfee.  Smooth like a glass of cold milk.  What little aftertaste there is, is very pleasant.  Not the typical hefe, but very very good in its own right.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2006 Plastic sample cup at the Penn Museum.  Wheat and spices.  Beautiful, even in a little plastic cup.  Taste is fresh grass, mild sweet citrus with a foamy body.  Not as pasty-wheaty as other wittes Ive had.  Worth another try.  4/1/06 - Tried again and rated the same.  Cloudy tea with a glacial head.  Thick champagne with a full mouth.  I like the way the citric carb cuts through the wheat body to make for easy drinkin.
Draught at Ayinger Speis and Trank. This must be the best hefeweizen around. Lots of aroma and taste, good palate and laaaasting finish.

Draugt at Ayinger Speis und Trank. Fantastic hefe. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Yellow cloudy colour. Very powerfull yeaty aroma, one of the best. Average citrus-finsh. A little watery compared to other good hefe.

(500 ml bottle) Pours cloudy pale grayish yellow with a huge foamy white head. Aroma is wheaty, citrusy. Poor spotty lacing. Mouthfeel full, pretty smooth. Flavor is wheaty malt (with the glue-like flavor quality I associate with wheats) with a citrusy tang finish. Nice, refreshing.

Bottle.  Poured a very cloudy gold with a thick foamy white head that left little lacing, but floated on the beer as a considerable head.  A sour lemony smell veiled a more hidden yeasty sweetness in the background.  The flavor is sweet and fruity with a citrus tang to it.  The finish is mildly bitter that does not linger but leaves your mouth watering with its tartness.  Crisp, clean, and refreshing, thoroughly enjoyable.

500ml bottle. Poured murky pineapple gold into a footed pilsner glass with a rapidly diminishing 3-finger white head. Very nice color. The nose is almost all DMS with a little bit of sweet grain and a faind whiff of banana in the background. Sweet graininess at first sip immediately overcome by strong DMS. Medium-long finish with banana and sweetness, a little butter. Very refreshing with a crisp, lively mouthfiel. Thankfully, the DMS flavor fades rapidly after the first sip. Overall, not as good as Weihenstephaner but better than any other bottled hefeweizen Ive yet tried.
[bottle] Pours a golden yellow color. Head fades to a ring around the glass. Not bad, fruity, mildly spicy. Finishes nice and smooth.
Nice fluffy head with a golden, cloudy body.  Tasted fruit & citrus above everything, with it all being underlined by  thick yeast/wheat taste.  Very nice overall.
500 ml bottle. Floral aroma with some citrus and bananas. Flavor is bananas with a crisp citrus finish. Nice carbonated mouthfeel.
UPDATED: AUG 27, 2006 I couldnt really get into this.  It seemed a little watery and lacking in flavor.  A little sour and some banana and bubble gum but altogething not that great.

I had this at a hefeweizen tasting at Bevmo.
Beautiful banana flavor with lemon notes along w/ clove spiciness in both the flavor and the nose. This is a very nice brew.
Fruit (mostly banana) notes.  Healthy head of micro-bubbles that persists.  Nice light golden appearance with swirling yeast.  Light bodied and a little flat with vanilla notes that linger.

I enjoyed this hefe quite a bit. It seems to balance its fruity banana and orange-esque flavors well with spices with no element overpowering the other. I do prefer hefes with more of a quick and a drier mouthfeel though.

Hazed gold, thick rocky white head.    Nice soft nose of lemon, banana and pear, and lesser undercurrents of vanilla, white bread, and hints of wheat.  Flavor is similar with light citrus, wheaty, and grassy tones up front, light fruity spice in the middle, and a very faint bitterness rounding this off.  Light bodied, fizzy carbonation, mild, drying citric finish.  Good hefe for hot summer day in January.  Thats right damn it, the 6th warmest January on record in Baltimore.  Someone please send me some Siberian air so I can salvage my ski season!!

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2007 Pours a hazed tawny color w/ a full, semi creamy froth. Good hangtime. Aroma is brisk w/ mild notes of banana bread. Medium nectar w/ ample residual effers. This one tastes more like banana bread, has a crisp earthiness and a mild fruity character. The finish is slightly tart w/ an acidic bittering.

The aroma is a model of what a German Hefe should be. It has bananas, spice, incense, sour fruit, and wheat. The appearance is a hazy gold with a large head. The flavor is malty and fruity with an emphasis on bananas and citrus. There are also robust bitter and sour elements as well. The palate is typical of the style. The aftertaste is bread like and a little sweet but fairly dry for a Hefe.

Foggy, yellow. Dense, billowing white head transforms to swiss cheese before it settles. Aroma is wheat, yeast, lightly fruity. Same flavor, a bit of banana stands out. Simple but good. Wheasty finish and aftertaste. Medium, creamy body with refreshing carbonation. Aside from the timid aroma, an excellent wheat.
500 ml bottle.  Hazy yellow as expected.  Large head that lingered.  Some banana and bubblegum in the flavor, but not as much as I had expected.  A solid but not spectacular Hefe.
Wasnt crazy about this one. Did not like the flavors of bubblegum and heavy yeast.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2008 yeasty aroma.  hazy white beer with a a huge creamy head.  spices and banana on palate.  the strong yeast element adds to the complexity of this beer nicely although i enjoyed the Ur-Weisse a little more - 1/16/06   6/4/7/4/14.---re-rate---a pretty good banana, clove aroma.  cloudy gold under a huge creamy rocky white head.  flavors of banana, clove, and cream.  creamy palate and medium bodied.  i didn’t like it as much as weihenstephaner but still very enjoyable.

"WOW this beer poured a cloudy golden color. The lasting head was light and fluffy and large. Aroma was of bananas and citrus. Tasted much of the same. Only disapointing part was the mouthfeel, thin. Overall not bad."

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2007 What a delightful beer!  Pours a pale banana yellow with a thick, fluffy white head.  Smells of bread, banana, and yeast.  Taste is very bready with hints of banana and citrus. Extremely smooth beer with a clean finish.

RE-RATE: I still think this is an excellent wheat beer, one of the best, but I dont really like wheat beers much anymore.

Allright,  Im in love - sort of

This beer had such nice citrus and bananna flavors it was almost like drinking a Bannana-weiss.   The only problem is the complexity prevents me from making this my everyday beer.

illini08 shared some of his 500ml bottle with me.  poured a cloudy yellow with a big head.  aroma and flavor was quite strong with cloves with some banana and lemon zest.  a well done hefe, just way too much carbonation for my liking.

500 mL bottle.  Poured a hazy yellow with a big, sustained white head.  Strong aroma of clove, bananas, and citrus.  Flavor was the same with some yeast as well.  Tart finish.  This hefe is right up there with Hacker-Pschorrs and Weihenstephaners hefe-weiss beers as one of the best that Ive had.
Draught. Hazy light yellow. It had a lacing with a rich white head. The aroma is fruity with a wheaty aroma. The flavour is fruity and has a flavour of wheat.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a stiff creamy head.  Strong aromas of vanilla and banana.  The taste is light and refreshing, starting off with a lemon-orange citrus flavor and finishing with a mild but enduring sour fizz.  This is truly one of the great Weisse beers.

17-Dec-05 (22 oz bottle: Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA) Oh yeah, a rerate was definitely in order on this one.  Purchased at a truly reputable store, I have no fears about whether this will be a good bottle.  The bottle opens with a fairly loud phhhttt, and the beer pours about two inches of white, creamy head with tight beading.  Retention is superb as several minutes later, I still have a quarter inch cap, though this is partially aided by significant carbonation bubbles rising through the beer.  The color is medium straw and slightly hazy, so the streams of carbonation bubbles are plainly visible and combined with the wonderful head retention make for a visually stunning beer.  The only problem is the lack of lacing on the glass.  The very enticing nose projects a prominent banana aroma with very light clove and wheat.  Banana again plays a prominent role in the flavor initially, but this fades a bit in the finish to allow the wheat flavor to come to the forefront.  Bitterness is low but not missing, sweetness is mild, and a slightly spicy character makes brief showings from time to time.  The overall flavor is very pleasant and enjoyable, but shows proper restraint, giving an air of classiness.  A small complaint is that the flavor tails off a bit too much late in the finish rather than showing resilience on the palate.  Body is light-medium and very well carbonated for a lively and exciting mouthfeel.  Im not a certified beer judge (yet!), but I consider this to be a textbook example of the German Hefeweizen.  It just needs a better finish to be the "be all, end all".12-Sep-05 (12 oz bottle: Cost Plus in La Jolla, CA) Bought this bottle from Cost Plus, so a rerate might be in order, well see.  It pours a pale orange-golden color and is fully cloudy.  The white head is tall, fluffy and white in color.  Unfortunately, its all downhill from here.  The flavor shows moderate wheat maltiness, and banana starts mild and finishes with more gusto, the clove is in deep hiding the entire time, and it tastes a bit stale and cardboardy.  Not bad, but tastes "old".  The nose is funky and fruity when first poured, with no sign of anything resembling a Hefeweizen, but I guess once the funky aromas subside, Im getting more banana.  Light-medium bodied, and lightly carbonated, but the stale flavor just sits on the tongue.  This beer isnt horrible, but I imagine it is much better when purchased at a real beer store.  It definitely improved the longer it sat in the glass (up to a point, obviously).  Based on my experience with beer purchases at this store, I will not spend my money (on beer) there again. (6, 4, 6, 3, 12, total: 3.1)

500 ml bottle.  Hazy, yellow-golden body.  Aromatic, white, fluffy head.  Lemony, citrus, and bananas, bubblegum.  Apples and flowers.  Smooth and refreshing in the mouth.  Quite quenching with flavors of tart apples and fruity and floral notes.  Candy sweet with banana, apple and bubblegum .  Champagne notes and effervescense.  Dry yet sweet and tart...Second glass.  Got a lot more sediment from the bottom of the bottle.  After activation, poured an amazingly white, fluffy and flagrantly floral aroma.  Great taste and texture.  Orange citrus and lively carbonation.  Almost a Sprite or 7Up flavor, maybe the limon twist.  Fruit, lotsa fruit.  Maybe a little but of a barnyard mustiness.  This could quite possible be my favorite German Hefe.

Filling aroma of wheat, banana, yeast, vanilla. Pours a very pale, cloudy yellow with a bit of yeast on the bottom and a thick, foamy head. Taste is peppery, with banana, wheat, a touch of sweetness and no bitterness. Delicious!
A nice thick head with a nice, spice/clove smell with a hint of bananna.  It was a very crisp beer, with wonderful flavor.
Bottle. Unclear yellowish with large dense head. Straight forward hefewizen; sweet, bananas, cloves, full - a meal in itself. Very easy drinking.

Crystal clear through the golden beer.  Thick and fluffy head created that sticks around for some time. Aroma has a hint of spice with a huge smell of banana, bubblegum and yeast.  The flavor is more light than the aroma had made me believe but still a nice serving of banana and yeast to be found.  Has a little bit of spice and zest in the aftertaste which makes this brau weisse different than the other Ayinger i had.  Again, another lassic example of the style from Ayinger.

Pouring gently from bottle elicits a profuse, frothy white head that is mostly lasting.  Appropriately cloudy yellow and highly effervescent.  Aroma was of slightly green bananas.  Nice and light on the tounge, a little tart like sourdough bread.  Has a clean tart finish, not especially hoppy.  Would recommend!
has a nice sweetness to it and it still has a nice flavor to it. this is good example of hefeweizen

This pors a cloudy and effervencent golden ellow with a sizeable and firm, rocky head. Careful while pouring! The aroma is yeasty with clove and some lemon, mixing with subtle malt and hops. The flavor lives up to the promise with well integrated lemony, fruity flavors, with hints of banana nd clove followed by a pleasantly dry finish. Not bone dry, but well balanced with a short, fruity finish. An excellent example of the style.
Richer than some of its brethren, with expressive clove and citrus bouquet luring into moderate banana/fruit aroma and decent sweetness and body.
Cloudy gold color with a long lasting head. Strong banana aroma with mild spicy clove flavor.

European Bottle Pour - Large white head atop a lovely bright amber body.. cloudy like a good weizen is *grin*. Head lasts for a good while..several swigs. Aroma - light banana, flowery with a few spices thrown in. Taste - More distinct banana and spices dominate the initial sweetness. Dries on the finish with a slight bitterness. Light body... closer to a Kristalweizen in that respect... not quite so heavy. Very tasty. Nicely done!

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2006 On tap at Firkins, Libertyville, IL and bottled version from Armanettis, Mundelein, IL. Tried tap and bottled versions both equally great but tap version slightly more flavorable and aromatic.  Cloudy dark yellow hued wheat bear having long-lived large white creamy head. Intense spicy, citrusy, flowery hoppy aroma.  Light-to-medium bodied that starts with light sweet and tart malty flavor with slight hop flavor and quickly finishes dry with light hoppiness.  No discernable bitterness.  A very little aftertaste.  A very enjoyable, refreshing wheat beer, one of my favorites.   I can drink this every day and never get tired of it.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2005 Lots of carbonation, head didnt last so long for me unfortunately.  Smells of citrus and wheat.  Tastes of yeast and lemon and wheat and a little spice.  Does have some tart in the finish.  This is an ok beer, but not one of my favorites.  I was disappointed considering all the good reviews and the high ratings for this beer.

*Edit: 11/28/2005:*

 tried this beer again and it was better than it was previously.  Maybe I got a bad bottle.  Now the spices are a little more pronounced, getting a nice clove/coriander type of spicy taste.  Something odd about the taste though.  It has a really earthy type of taste to it.  Still pretty tart though, and tons of carbonation this time around.  Not bad, but there are others I like more than this one.

Pours murky yellow with lots of bubbles and a thick white head that lasts for a long time.  Yeasty and floral aroma with scents of honey, wheat bread, banana, and citrus.  Refreshing flavor features tropical fruits along with the citrus, vanilla, and a hint a spices.  Has a creamy texture but it is also quite thin and light-bodied.  Slight amount of sweetness and not as much carbonation as I was expecting from the pour.  Has a crisp, clean, dry finish with no bitterness or sourness.  This will make for a good refreshing summer beer out on the beach.
Cloudy yellow body, thick creamy and tall white head. Dusty old banana and sweet wheat aroma. Sweet, candy-like banana bread and a little lemon essence.

light straw color tightly cloudy huge frothy white head w/ some lace.  hefe style yeast and clove aroma some light fruits and other spices.  very lighty paalte w/ some good coating and light carb.  Flavor is yeast, bannanas some candied sugars and a touch of spices.  Prety good hefe.

Pours a cloudy pale gold with a large, fine bubbly white head that lasts forever. Fruity nose followed by complex flavor of clove, citrus, and yeast. Light body, but excellent mouthfeel. Tart finish with light hop bitterness. One of the best hefeweizens out there. I love this beer.
Bottle. Cloudy gold with a large white head. Aroma has wheat, cloves, fruit and banana. Highly carbonated, crisp and refreshing. Nice sweet/bitter balance, citrusy and spicey. A superior Hefeweizen.
A very good beer. I tried a lot of different hefeweizens over the summer and this was the absolute best.

On tap at the Huber Haus. Pours an amazing cloudy light gold with a cloud-like white head. Aroma is delightfully fruity and banana-like. Flavor is at first overwhelming banana esters, followed by a yeasty bolus. Slightly tart at the finish, but mostly a smooth balanced wheat beer.
Medium white head.  Yellowish opague color.  Sweet with a slighthly bitter signature.
Large foaming white head. Very noticeable aroma. Foggy off piss yellow color. Tartness is noticable but not overpowering. OK but not going to buy again.

Hefeweizens are typically a boring breed, but this one is as good as any gets. Pours a murky golden yellow with lots of thin fizzy white head. Smells of wheat, honey, citrus, and spice. Taste is more of the same. Nice amount of spice and banana esters but without being too overbearing like many Hefes are. Mildy sweet and thinner bodied. Very refreshing.

500mL bottle.  Label is slightly different than that in the picture.  A hazy gold pour with a big, fluffy off-white head.  Lots of bananas, yeasty tanginess, wheat and some clove in the aroma.  The long-lasting head provides some creaminess to this otherwise crisp beer.  Starts off lemony with a yeasty tang.  Finishes with a delightful wheaty/banana aftertaste.  More banana present than other hefes.  Light and refreshing.  Great beer.

Nothing compared to the celebrator...but a fine beer none-the-less, just lacks pizzazz and i like hefeweizens, but when I described hefeweizens to those- not-yet-one-of-us and then present this as the example--they thought I was crazy----no flowers, no fruit, no pepper but extra dry. Bad to form but good to drink.
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text: I was totally unimpressed with this brew.  I am starting to despise German Hefeweizens.  It made me feel like I had a cold.  Odd taste to it.  Not impressed.
Pours yellow with a white head.  Has a strong smell of banana.  The taste has a hint of banana and is nicely carbonated.
Robe blonde très voilée. Arômes de bananes, de levures, de citron. Saveurs de bananes et de levure. Bon corps.

Pours a murky off yellow colour, and wow crazy bubbles...and big boom head, nice and frothed..unpleasing smell, but for the style aver at best..sweet in taste bananna ramma...a classy brew with impressive lacing.

If your looking for an excellent wheat beer this is one of them!Aroma of bananna and slight clove and a hazy brighter yellow color make this berr a very good choice when looking for a hefe.Very refreshing on a hot summer day,but not too carbonated.Easy to drink more than a couple!

From the bottle this pours a hazy yellow with a tall fluffy white head. Very fizzy carbonation gives it a very light mouthfeel and nice spicy finish. The banana esters overtake the clove in both the nose and flavor. Very refreshing with a lot of flavor.

Bottle.  This is a great hefe.  It was nice to look at with its cloudy yellow color and nice frothy head.  The aroma was strong of banana and clove, just the way I like it to be.  The flavor didnt let me down either, excellent taste.  As I continue to sample as many hefes as I can get my hands on, this one ranks very high on my list so far.  Once again, a great hefeweizen.
Good estery yeast aroma, some banana. Hazy and milky yellow body, medium white head. Yeasty flavor, quite weak, estery.
On tap @ the Falling Rock poured a cloudy yellow with a white head. Aromas of bananas and clove. Flavors were bananas, clove, and bread.

Pale yellow, but an amazing hefe,  nonetheless. Nose is a bit of a detractor. Dusty nose with some banana spiciness. In the end, loads of cloves and creaminess, but a bit thin on the palate. In all, a very tasty hefe.
First of all this is a really good hefe.  Fruity not to much banana in it, and very sweet and refreshing.  More complex than the other hefes that Ive tried.  Really good. Yum.
Poured a cloudy pale white yellow color.  Aroma of lemon and citrus.  Flavor too was off lemon with a banana finish.  Sweet, lively and acidic.  Pretty refreshing.

What a great summertime beer (esp) here in FL.  Definite lemon on the nose with a slight hint of vanilla.  A great hefeweizen-almost dont want to add a slice of lemon to it-nice to watch the carbonation react with the acid.  Vanilla on the finish.  Light, golden color with a fizzing white head; little lacing.  Medium bodywith a refreshing finish.
UPDATED: JUL 28, 2005 Pours a cloudy golden body with a huge head. Aroma is citrus, vanilla and banana. Flavor is a wheat beer dominated by banana with a hint of vanilla. Its very smooth.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2007 Pours light golden and slightly hazy with a big foamy white meringue head. Spicy aroma of banana, clove, light smoke and crackers. Tastes of lovely wheat, yeast and banana. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, creamy from the wheat and yeastiness, with lively carbonation. I could drink this every day, easily one of my favorite hefeweizens.
Taster @ PIB.  A wonderful yellow gold pour.  A yeasty, bread dough aroma.  Strong clove and banana flavors come through in this beer.  A full, sweet, mouth feel follows.  Not dry in the least.

The bottle poured a slightly hazy straw colored beverage with a fine white heat that lasted well and left good lacing on the glass. The aroma was a pleasant combination of vanilla with a banana fruitiness. It had a medium body with lively carbonation and a slightly grainy texture. The flavor starts off with a tart fruity character maturing to more distinct wheat and banana flavors. The finish was long and refreshingly light.

Light golden-yellow with typical yeast haziness.  Nice bitter-sour initial taste with fizzy and perfectly refreshing carbonation.  Little thin on mouthfeel is only downside.  Then comes the expected wheat malt, bananas, and yeast, in perfect harmony, leading into a lingering and wonderful clove spice finish.  Very, very, very good.
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2007 Tastes best at cellar temperature. Nice clove, and banana accents...Summer...nothing beats it in this category Ive tasted thus far.
Bottle. hazy straw yellow pour.  Heavy carbonation was a bit overpowering.  Nice balance of banana and clove esters with some spices.  Also some other citrusy elements - lemon.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2005 Cloudy pale color with nice head.  Smells of banana, clove, and citrus.  Banana and spiciness throughout.  Pretty taste beer but still no match IMHO for Weihenstephaners hefe.

Thanks to ambergirl for this one!  Cloudy pale golden pour with a sizable white head.  Just a little sediment in there.  Aroma has some banana esters as well as some citrus, honey, and floral (overall very sweet).  Sparkly and well-carbonated, so light on the palate.  Flavor had a wheaty base that was followed by bananas and citrus.  Sweet banana/honey finish.  Very easy to drink and perfect for the season

Cloudy pale yellow with a generous white head. Aroma is banana, yeast and wheat. Flavor is sweet, banana, a little clove and a hint of bubble gum. A touch of lemon in the finish. Smooth watery palate. ( Im not crazy about banana and bubble gum in beer).
Bottle. Golden color with a white head. The taste is sweet and yeasty with the obligatory wheaty pattern. Fruits and light citrus flavours balances the flavour and palate.
A most excellent hefeweizen.  After playing ultimate frisbee in the hot sun its nice have either one of these.
In 90 degree Alabama summer heat, this is definitely one of my most craved beers.
Have grown to love this refreshing hefe. A great foamy head and fruity spicy flavor. I bring a case back whenever i visit my  mom from DC as i cannot get it where I live at all.

Nice medium head. Body is a light golden, cloudy with lots of bubbles. Aroma is lightly bitter with some citrus. Taste is fruity citrus, balanced malt sweetness. Lots of bananna esters, finish is slightly bitter and dry. Very tasty and balanced.
Opaque yellow with a soapy, short lived head. Crisp aroma of citrus and bananas with some lingering vanilla notes. Tart and effervescent with a long banana cream pie finish.
On tap. Poured a darker and cloudy golden color with an averaged sized white head. Aromas of stronger cloves, bananas and citrus. Tastes of wheat, bananas, lemons and lighter spices.

17oz - Sweet wheat/yeast aroma with some citrus tossed in.  A bueatiful golden yellow with a huge head that slowly fades leaving just a little lacing.  Constantly bubbles like champange.  Flavor is candi sugar, lemon, orange, wheat and yeast.  Smooth slick palate is great for a summer evening.

Poured a Deep, cloudy gold with a tight, creamy white head. The nose was of wheat, banana and clove. The taste started with malty wheat off the top. Cloves and nuts follow. The end had a banana creaminess with and citric tartness below. The finish was spicey and peppery. This beer is very refreshing. I like to pour a pint then swish around all the yeasty goodness left in the bottle. Highly recommended, especially if you like hefe-weizens.
Bottle. Cloudy amber with large rocky white head. Aroma of wheat, clove and banana. Medium body with medium sweet finish. Flavor is medium sweet with refreshing character.
Draught. Hazy yellow colour, mediumsized white foamy head. Wheaty and fruity aroma. Sweet wheaty flavour with fruitish hints. A bit bitterish fruity finish. Sticky palate afterwards.

On draught at Winking Lizard, served with a lemon. Hazy orange/yellow color with a medium thick white head and thin lacing. Aroma of yeast and spices. Light-bodied and well-carbonated with fruit, wheat and banana flavors. The finish is fruity with a bit of malt. Hefeweizen is not one of my favorite styles but this beer is well done.
Bottle.  Hazy pee-yellow brew with thin head.  Lots of lemon - but short on banana in the aroma.  Delicate flavor, very pleasant acidity, hints of bread.
Hazy gold beer.  Poored a big head but it disapated...not a strong aroma but solid clove/spicy taste....
Cloudy golden color with a big head. Fruity and spicy beer. It it a good beer.

This beer held a cloudy, wheat-colored body with tiny floatables under a recurring white head. (After the pour, I was called away for a bit then sampled it at room temperature.) A banana background to the aroma with a frontal acetone-assault of lemon nail polish remover.  Bitter and sour in flavor with light acidity in the finish. After-effects were interesting with a thin mouthfeel and a buttery aftertaste with roof-of-the-mouth chalkiness.
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot, Orland Park, IL<font size=-1>
Banan and apricot aroma. Hazy orange appearance. Sweet, yeasty finish. Overall a nice wheat, with a lot of different hints of spices.

Pours a thick, rich gold.  Taste is an immediate rush of wheat, hops, and banana.  Lemon is not needed, for this provides the added sparkle usually sought after with the said fruit.  Nice clove aftertaste.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Bottle. Hazy golden color with a good size white head. Strong clove aroma with some banana and citrus. Flavor is also dominated by the cloves along with the wheat and some banana.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2008 Light and sparkling with a banana and musty yeast nose. When someone says Hefewiezen, this is the beer I think of. Lightly cloudy yellow with a thick white head an light banana malt body, this brew is the perfect hot-weather  brew. Spicy clove aftertaste.

BIG puffy white head. Cloudy. Not much aroma. Sort of disappointed in this one which I had high hopes for. Not much bubblegum flavor but a healthy amount of spicy yeasty banana flavors. No citrus flavor at all. Bought two bottles. Ill drink the 2nd(obviously) but there are better hefes out there. This one is most likely 2 and done, unfortunately. I really wanted to dig this one.

Poured into a Paulaner Hefe glass.  Light orange at the top, hazy yellow at the bottom.  Pour with a full head the faded to a cap.  Light phenolica and esters.  Well balanced.  Notes of oranges and pepper.  Med body with light carb.  Good show.

Hazy dark straw pour with aroma of hopcit, lemons, banana, cloves, bubblegum.  Tastes hefe, with a good, firm, complex mouthfeel....a lot going on here.  Finishes hopcity, yeasty, with some cloves and a semi fruity dryness.

I fear I may have gotten a bad bottle or something, but it poured nicely- big, foamy head, golden body.  Aroma was of vomit, however, which completely turned me off to the beer after the first sip.  Flavor was decent, despite the smell.  Just couldnt get past that smell.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2005 Bottle:  A very good looking weisse, kind of standard on color think hazy browngold.  A very large head, for a hefeweizen, Has a nice citursy scent, and although its in the description I do feel there is some creamy vanilla scent and taste(the first taste you notice), also can taste hints of honey.    The aftertaste is a bit carbinated for a weisse.  Overall a pretty good beer.

Bottle: Pale yellow, murky, large white pillowy head, settles somewhat quickly, fairly nice lacing, well carbonated. &nbsp Wheaty nose, bready, cloves, citrusy, subtle banana. &nbsp Spritzy/bubbly mouthfeel, wheaty taste, very clean. &nbsp Bready finish, lingering spices. &nbsp Very well balanced, great body. &nbsp I could drink this all year long and never get tired of it.

Pours a clear bright gold with a fizzy thick white head. OK, its clear for the initial pour. On subsequent pours it gets progressively hazier. Smells strongly of banana and clove. Some underlying sweet wheat malt and yeast aromas.

Taste has a very pronounced rip banana flavor followed quickly by nips of clove and other spice. Smooth finish but a bit fizzy on the tongue. Slightly bitter peppery finish. Medium bodied and creamy. Light bitterness in the aftertaste. Very smooth and drinkable. A tasty brew that goes down dangerously easily. Im not an expert of the style but this is the best Hefe-Weizen Ive had yet.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a big white head. Sweet yeasty banana aroma and a sweet banana wheaty yeasty light citrus taste. Medium body and a sweet light dry finish.
Hazy pale yellow with a big white head. Wheaty sweet aroma with yeast and some banana. Nice sweet flavor with some yeast.

2004 bottle.  Golden-hay appearance, very cloudy, though settling out to a straw yellow, with some moderate haziness and a huge, foamy, yellow flecked white head.  Aggressive bubbles.  Nose is restrained and only has lightly dry bananas, dry bubble gum esters, hay, light corn flour and lovely hops.  Im not getting much fruit that they claim is in the nose.  Flavor is initially sweet and malty, with almost a stickiness to it.  It lightens up a good deal, with bananas and light clove drying out the malt, as dry, countryside-hops provide a pleasant and restrained bitterness.  Yeast is quite restrained, though apparent, with a dry champagne-like chewiness, bits of dough and light corn-bread.  Medium-full body for the style and just wonderfully well done.  Now if I could only get in to that Celebrator. . .

Aroma: Spicy, Cloves similar to corriandar, some citrus, well balanced Phenols
Appearance: Pale Straw yellow, cloudy to style
Thick bright white head
Flavor: Bubble Gum, citrus and spice
Starts full bodied, finishes light and clean with bubble gum notes, tartness from wheat.. after warming slight honey flavors
Mouth Feel: Med-light, high carbonation
Overall: Solid example of style. Clove flavor is missing and bubble gum flavor is predominant....

This beer explodes with flavor.  Very full mouthfeel that caresses the palate with a prickly fizz.  The taste is tart, fruity (apple-banana), earthy, spicy and semi-sweet.  A good complex mix of flavors that comes on strong with its effervescence and settles nicely to finish smooth and gentle on the palate.  Leaves the best of its flavors in its wake  fruity sweet aftertaste. [$2.79/500ml]

What a fine beer!  A classic unfiltered heffe in many respects.  Nice head, beautiful golden-honey colored, cloudy, and plenty of character in this one.  There is just so much going on here and all of it is good.  I love wheat beers and this is as good as they get.

Nice looks, this one is cloudy and golden proposing a large white head, foamy and mostly lasting. Heavily wheaty aroma, almost oaty. Typical though mellow banana, lemon and milder cloves phenol aspects. Rather sweet fruity profile (honeymelon bubblegum). Bananas are a bit more prominent in mouth, pairing the bready yeast nicely. Mouthfeel is clean, fresh, creamy and proposing a fine bubbled carbonation. Straightforward weizen, not quite a flavorful as I expected, though ayingers typicall flawless execution is there. Thanks Clark.

Decent aroma, but not as strong as other hefeweizens. Ditto for the flavor. Appearance is lovely, but the head dissipates too quickly. I could drink this all night, as its quite good, but not worth the premium price. I paid $2.99 for a bit more than a pint. Harpoon, Brooklyn, and Boulevard are probably a better bang for your buck.
This beer lacks the sour smell prevalent in so many hefe-weizens.  It pours with a real nice head, and the liquid is very cloudy.  The taste is great.

Aroma of fermented yeast. Had a good head to start with but flatened out. So the carbination wasnt there in my glass. Dry spice flaove that made it a little heavy on the palate. May have to get another one due to the facts on the commercial description I didnt pour this one properly.

5ooml bottle, wiezen glass...pour carefully!  crazy racing carbonation, nice frothy head.  Smells of bananas, lemons, with a faint allusion to sweet basil...Light and refreshing with its somewhat tart/acidic finish(although I dont feel it is pronouncedly acidic)...it doesnt offer me much in the way of pondering flavor, but this isnt a beer to think about.  Its certainly dry and bubbly, this is one to just gulp down.  Im not somebody who drinks wheat beers of any form very often, but I can see this coming in handy on a humid Nebraska summer day...
White head, cloudy orangeish body.  A sweet and sour aroma.  The taste start slightly sweet and ends kind of acidic.  The acidic taste dimishes though when the beer gets warmer.  Id try it again.

Cloudy yellow/orange with a thick white head. Great aroma of clove, banana and yeast. Flavor has notes of banana, lemon/citrus, clove, coriander, spices, wheat and yeast. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Great head retention. Nice beer but I would have preferred it a touch sweeter.
Great beer, and nice example of the style.  It really did not seperate itself from other wheat beers, though.  Nice light citrus taste.  Id drink it again.

500ml bottle, no date code.
Pours out like a hazy yellow sunset, light orangy yellow at the top of the glass, fading to pale straw towards the bottom.
Head is large, thick, creamy and long lasting. As it slowly fades it leaves a a thick pattern of lacing.
Aroma is banana pudding with a vanilla wafer crust, a touch of pepper.
creamy smooth doughy mouthfeel.
Flavor is spicy first, (pepper and clove,) then a touch lemony sweet in the middle,  banana and pepper on the finish.
It was a warm day today and this was the perfect refresher.

Pretty decent hefe with all the characteristics I would expect. Nice hazy yellow body. Little disappointing in the taste and aroma though. While the cloves and citrus and bannana were coming through, I found this hefe watery and very low in taste. Still good, but I expected a little more from this brewery.

Avg Weizen pour,cloudy with modest head.
Nose is of mild vanilla frosting with hints of lemon. Medium bodied. Tastes pretty much how it smells with a hint of sweetness in the finish. Not bad.
Cloudy gold with a white foamy head. Sour dough in the nose with lemons and spice. Banana esters. More of the esters in the flavor with some wheat and lemons. Smooth, light and refreshing. I like it.

Hazy bright yellow, big fluffy white head. Nose of rich sweet malts, citrusy crisp hops & nice wheat esters. The flavor is highly carbonated & savory with typical & traditional hefe ester. Delicious example, welcomed change of pace for sure.

Bottle.  Pours a light orange-golden color with a typical tall slightly off white head. Light banana, clove and vanilla aromas...typically hefe.  Fruit gummy and dry all in one shot....lotsa wheat and cloves.   Nice yeasty character.  Quite good.

Cloudy pale amber with a big fluffy white head that rapidly diminshes to a thin persistent cover.  Lots of yeast in suspension.  Aroma is pleasant fruity and yeasty, maybe a little musty.  Flavor starts a bit tart, but quickly smoothes out to a silky, light, refreshing delight. Fruity and floral, the yeast reminds me of the strain used in the Unibroues.  Tasty, clean, a bit dry as hefes go, and highly enjoyable.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2006 Really good beer, is almost as good as the best weath beer I have ever tried!. It is tick, and very weiss. I liked it.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2006 Cloudy yellow with a frizzy, short-lived head, this has a fairly spicy aroma for a hefeweizen.  The flavor echos the aroma, banana, cloves, white pepper, a twist of lemon.  Fairly refreshing, if not great, wheat.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot, Orland Park, IL<font size=-1>

Until swirling the dregs, this beer poured a bright dark yellow with a massive rocky head that did dimish to a medium thickness blanket.  Quite a bit of sediment came out after mixing a little beer at the bottom and re-pouring.  Effervescent banana aroma with subtle clove hints and some musty horseblankety yeast.  Clean refreshing taste that included sweet, estery banana and some soda water.   The tiniest hint of bitterness.  Light to medium body that drank very well with lots of carbonation and a clean ending.

Pours a hazy golden color with a thick white head and thick lacing.
Aroma is yeast and fruit.
Flavor is fruity, wheat..not bad but Im just not a wheat beer fan.
UPDATED: AUG 17, 2006 Hazy translucent gold, prodigious white head, yeasty aroma, sour-smooth wheat flavor with green banana, smooth vanilla, refreshing but more silky than crisp.

Murky, bright gold in color.  Fizzy, lively head.  Smells of yeasty sourdough bread, borderline sour milk.  Also smells slightly of a banana/orange juxtapose.  Taste is crisp and refreshing.  Sweet vanilla and cloves.  Caramel nodes and traces of some citrus elements, namely lemon and orange.  Great carbonation balance.  Creamy head stays afloat throughout the entire beer, which contributes to an undisputedly awesome feel on the palate.  This is by far the creamiest hefe Ive ever had.  Damn, Ive had a great streak with hefes as of late.
Great floral aroma,spicy unbelieveable head. This wheat beer will wake up your taste buds,late tingle on the palate, very nice
Wonderful wheat with rich vanilla aroma and flavor.  Super-refreshing.  Great big rocky long-lasting head.  I like.

Bottle.  Poured a huge white head that lasted longer than a pornographic sex act.  Huge aroma of citrus and tropical fruit...even notes of cheeries, slightly sour.  Perfect champagne gold color.  Taste is fruits and honey, lingers smooth and long.  Somewhat weaker taste than that perfect aroma.  Late tingle on the palate of spice, but very subtle.  Almost perfect hefe, just lacks a bit of yeastiness for my taste.

Very nice hefeweizen. Pours a hazy golden color with an inch-thick white head. Aroma of bananas, maybe a touch of clove. Flavor is classic hefeweizen, yeasty, malty, thick on the palate ... very tasty brew.

Bottle shared with jercraigs.  Cloudy dark yellow colour, with big fluffy white head.  Very strong aroma of banana with a little something sweet in it (kind of like a banana split) - very appealing.  Crisp, yet full bodies, this beer has flavour to no end - totally consumes your tastebuds with a perfectly balanced blend of banana, malt, and bitterness.  Slightly yeasty as well.  Very enjoyable.

Bottle - 500ml. Nice hazy blond body with huge foamy head. Good yeasty aroma with spicy and floral notes. Taste is dominated by yeast. There is also some fruity (citrus, banana) notes. Decent finish. Another very nice Hefeweizen...

Bottled
Hazy yellow color with small but steady head. Average weizen banana nose. Crisp, medium-bodied palate. Not very sweet but not bitter either, lots of wheat flavors. Another well-made Ayinger.

Pours an invitingly hazy (nearly opaque) golden color with abundant carbonation and a huge foamy white head. Aroma is mostly wheat with hints of hops, yeast, banana, and lemon. Flavor is perfect. Honestly, this is my favorite wheat beer. Starts off with a mouthfull of wheat malt, grainy with flavors of banana, lemon, cerial, and hops. Finishes dry with a slight pepery aftertaste. This is a great example of the style. Overall, highly recomended as a perfect introduction to wheat beer.

Bottle.  Banana, peach aroma.  Light yellow color with light cloudiness.  Moderate malt flavor with light clove and banana.  High carbonation.  A bit light but overall an enjoyable Weizen especially given I bought it in the states/

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2005   What a great Hefeweizen.  The aroma is dominated by lime and malt.  Too much wine in the taste and the palate, but good anyway.  It took a second shot at this beer to really rate it.  The yeast is wonderful in this beer.  Good but nothing like the Weihenstephaner Hefeweizen in my opinion.

Ahhhhhh wheat beer and hot hot food.
I had this one with cuban black beans and rice, what a combination!!! The cumin-vinegar-cayenne flavors were a perfect opposite to the sweet wheatness of the Hefe -Weizen. The pearly yellow cloudiness is consistent thru the beer. The carbonation is perfect, the aroma of the wheat is just right. This could possibly be my pale wheat beer nirvana.
Pours light yellow with a huge white head.  Excellent lacing as the head remains throughout.  Aroma of wheat and a hop nose.  Wheat and yeast flavor.  Palate is mild.  A most drinkable brew.

from the bottle. poured a cloudy staw color with a white head. aroma sour, lemony, floral, fruity, yeast, hints of pepper. flavor,grapefruit with sugar on it, other citrus flavores, some bananas, wheat, with a hint of lemon. I am not a big fan of this style of beer but this one might be my turning pointe, this was very refreshing and easy to drink.
this style is growing on me.  typical banana with lots of lemon.  quite sweet.   i would have this one again.
Good body, good head, the hazy goldish color is terrific.  This was a great beer and I would recommend it to everyone.

A hazy pale gold that sits beneath a huge white long lasting head.A spicy and grainy aroma  with a touch of vanilla.The flavor repeats that vanilla with  moderate banana .this is my first Hefe-Weisse and will not be my last. I cant wait to try some other versions.
Stron banana aroma, very intensiv aroma. Pleasant but not too intensive taste, malty (toffee).

Had at Ayingers in Munich. A wonderful thirst quenching beer after a long walk all over the city of munich on a warm fall day.  Great aroma, great flavor and it looks great too.  Long lasting pure white head and moderate to strong carbonation.  Smooth and delicate with a great aftertaste.
One of my favorite wheat beers.  Lovely hazy yellow color is topped by a light fluffy head.  I get the spicy banana hints, but the lemon seems lost on my taste buds.  Very pleasant to drink.

Draught at Mono in Glasgow. Served a little cold for my taste, in correct glassware, but glasses frosted (hmph). Usual wheat yeast banana pear apple nose, good body, taste pleasant, masked somewhat by temperature and carbonation. I suspect this could be very good if less chilled.
Pours a hazy bronze with a lasting diminutive head.  Very pleasant aroma of wheaty banana and spice.  Taste is light and refreshing, simple and straightforward.  Ayinger is tantamount to perfection.

Opaque, hazy gold color with a fluffy, white head.  Crisp, sweet banana with a touch of clove, lightly tart wheat and a bit of lemon.  The body is full and refreshing without being too thick for a summer day.  The flavor is tasty and fairly balanced, if not overly complex or mesmerizing.  A solid, drinkable hefeweizen.

Poured golden yellow with a fizzy white head that dissipated quickly.  Aroma has a fruit and spice character.  Initial taste has a definite spice character that is hard to describe--cinnamon, cloves, and other sweet aromatic spices come to mind.  Underlying the spice is fruit such as banana.  Body is fairly standard for a hefeweizen.
11.2 oz bottle: Aroma is standard weisse with a hint of vanilla. Pours honey yellow in the glass with a sustained white head.  Good mouth feel, with a fairly complex taste.

Cloudy, golden-orange colour. Superb lasting thick head. Fine yeasty, banana aroma. First impression is that this beer is incredibly smooth for a weizen. Fine carbonation. Yeasty, banana, slightly citric, fruity with a hint of spiciness. Pretty sweet in the finish for a weizen. For me the best weizen.

With Ayinger Weisse it is becoming increasing hard to find fresh bottles. It seems like this beer doesnt sell very well in the states and there are old bottles everywhere.

Cloudy Grapefruit.

Zesty, barely there aroma with notes of cloves, fruit and orange.

There isnt much here. Citrusy, with notes of banana, clove and orange, along with a nice musty yeast taste and a fairly nice finish.

With many if not most wheat beers the hallmark flavor overwhelms anything else that might be present and leads to a heavy, bland brew. However, this beer is somewhat different - presenting many enjoyable elements to complement the wheat taste. I personally prefer a wheat beer fully carbonated straight from the bottle as complementing flavors seems to come through better. From the bottle Ayinger provides a strong lemony kick and some allspice like elements; from the glass the flavor is more bland but still okay. For the record, it pours a well-defined head that lasts as film to the end of the glass. Aroma is very strong wheat-grass (nice if youre into health food) but also very vinegary. Sort of a candycane aftertaste.
A great hefeweizen. Sweet and lemony citrusy.  Beautiful hazy yellow color.  Right up there with other Hefes.
A light hefeweizen. High carbonation and hazy yellow color. Lighter in taste and aroma than most hefes. Slight clove flavor complements the wheatiness rather than overtaking like some wheat beers.
Tastes very much like a belgian wit. Hazy golden colour and a nose full of flowers and citrus. Th flavour is very refreshing, slightly sour with notes of citrus and spices.
Nice yellow hazy hefe color.  Lemony citrus flavors all over and yummy wheat and yeast mix together.  A really solid hefeweizen

Appearance: hazy, lemon-rind-yellow hue, with a towering, snow white head.
Aroma: super fresh! Ahhh!!! Lemony, soft, luxurious, delightful!
Luxurious mouthfeel, at first, until I realize that Im drinking the foam. As for the actual beer, smooth, but complex, and delicious wheaty texture. Just enough grit and resistance to keep the tongue busy and happy. 
Though the body has plenty of substance, the overall nature of this brew is light and breezy. Citrus flavor continues through and is felt long through the satisfying finish. 
No lemon needed here, its plentiful in this beautiful brew itself ( and is also extant in the Thai shrimp pad thai that this blissful weizen is helpful to wash down).

Typical Hefe apperance, cloudy golden body with a massive white head. Aroma of biscuits, malt, some clove like spices and some sourish citric notes with some light banana. Very well rounded taste and smooth mouthfeel. Light citric crispness leads to full malty and wheat body, light sweetness and banana near the end. Finishes up with a light crispness. Nice hefe.

This heffe-weizen poured to a very large dominant head and was quite lively and bubbly. It has a hazy golden yellow coloring with a fair lace around the glass (although the head died quickly). The smell was kind of a fruity/citrus with a hint of banana. Quite aromatic. The taste was slightly sweet and had a dry finish ? with a little bite. Not very strong or distinctive flavor though. It is a drinkable beer, but I got bored quickly.

Pours a foamy white head on a hazy golden body. Heavy yeasty and wheaty aroma, actually too heavy and cloying. Wheat, yeast and citrus flavor with obvious banana notes. Foamy mouthfull. A nice, easy and smooth weissbier.

Draught, at Muggs Ale House, Brooklyn, NY.  Rustic unfiltered brown colour. Aroma is strong yet approachable with bubblegum and banana notes. Then comes the flavour, well the aroma doesnt prepare you for the sharpness and astringency of this beer. Sour and sharp the flavour packs quite a punch.
Pours a nice cloudy unfiltered golden color. Has a nice fruity taste with a little bit of a spicy kick. Good refreshing brew.
Poured cloudy yellow with a rich head...smelled lemon (didnt get any vanilla) and yeast...tasted like a Hefe...ditto Lumpy...
Bottle. Cloudy straw yellow color. Banana flavored. Stinks. Tastes like every other Hefe ever brewed. Blah.

Although Ive been having a lot of hefeweizens lately and am starting to get a bit burnt out on the style, this is a very good one. All the elements of a good hefe are here: nice cloudiness and good banana/clove presence. Very easy to drink too and would make a good summer beverage.

Pours cloudy light yellow with a nice white head that has decent retention. Has a champagne smell to it which I didnt much care for. Very great tasting especially during the summer. Has a fruity taste with a little spice. Mostly banana with some lemon. One of the better beers I have had.
Pours hazy unfiltered golden with a huge white smooth head.  Sweet honey wheat aroma.  Mouth feel is smooth with a little carbonation.  Sweet, malty, lemony.  Very refreshing and very drinkable.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2004 Unflitered & golden in color. Large head. Aroma is overwhelmingly banana and clove. Taste is the same, but very smooth, refreshing and drinkable.
From the Sharp Edge Beerfest a nice light hefeweisen... a lot of banana and cirtus in this,  kinda light... i expected a lot more from this
A solid hefeweizen that shows all of the things one should be.  A little dry with a refreshing taste.  Requires just a touch of lemon which brings out the perfect fruit flavor.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2008 [bottle - Great European Beerfest 8, Sharp Edge Tavern - East Liberty, PA] Poured a cloudy copper color with not much of a head. Mostly wheat in the aroma with a touch of citrus zest. Good wheaty taste with a slight sweet touch at the end. Very bubbly and light. I agree with robertsreality that it was more of a witbier than a hefeweizen.
Cloudy Orange Coloring.  Frothy White Head.  Wheat. Yeast.  Damn white wheat beer if ya ask me laddy!
Nice white foamy head. Good cloudy light colour. Smell is not to interesting. Good big bubbles. Taste is mildly fruity with a very clean finish. Extremely drinkable.
On tap at Andys. Yellow in color. Crisp.  Well balanced beer. Banana and clove. Light bodied. Excellent. Smooth. Refreshing.
Well not much to say about this one other than it is balanced and easy to drink.  Great alone or with food.  Often overlooked at the store, but should not be.  Pick some up and see for yourself.

Nice carbonation and great head. The flavor is buttery bananna and estery goodness, but there is also a hollowness to the taste. I think this is best explained by the lack or limit of the spices one usually associates with a Hefe. In so doing, this beer is offering more malt and yeast flavors than most. And while light-bodied and hay-scented (not the fern) it is a wholesome and refreshing beverage. This beer would taste best after a day of bucking hay under the hot summer sun. Good Things.

An interesting example of a German Hefeweizen- the banana and clove flavors are toned down, and tangy, somewhat sweet wheat malt tends to dominate with notes of apricot and peach.  A solid hazy-bodied yellow-orange beer.

Bottle: As the beer pours out you can see the haze. Copious head formation at onset. Lots of yeast stuff floating around in glass to be sure. The look is classic Hefe with  a yellow cloudy appearance. There is a yeasty aroma with spicy banana hints. This beer has a refreshing banana fruity flavour with some spice added for good measure. HEIL HEFE. There  is a watery finish but just enough to cement this beer as a classic Hot Summer must have in frige beer. I really like this one and its good to the last drop. Happy Hefeing. Cheers!

500ml bottle. 06.07.04  Pours a rich, pale golden with a frothy white head and sporadic lace; hazy.  Aromas are bursting with bubblegum, clove, yummy yeastiness and light graininess.  Flavors are mild, average even; but, Ayinger claims this to be a style benchmark.  If that is the case, then this average is just what a German hefeweizen should be.  One thing it is, is sweet and thick for a hefe - I like it.  There is some winey dry bite to the finish that is a bit of a surprise, but very tasty.  Decent stuff.

First of all, teh aroma is completely enticing.  Doesnt not smell like a beer at all, but something much better.  After that, read the commercial description.  If only all descriptions were that close to the truth, shopping for beer would be much easier.  This is a very polished beer and should not be approached by immature beer drinkers.  Definitely resembles champagne.
