Pours a cloudy gold with a thick, foamy, white head.  Aroma of hay bails.  The taste has hints of malt, more wheat and yeast, and a lemon note at the end.  Very nice wheat.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2011 This beer is high on the list of favorite hefeweizens for me. Sampled from a 16.9 oz bottle this beer pours a cloudy pale yellow-gold color with a large white head that lingers and left good lacing. There is a fairly strong scent of wheat, bubblegum and clove with a yeasty undertone. The flavor is creamy malt, wheat, and hints of citrus, bubblegum and clove with a bready yeastiness that lingers. Well rounded body. Excellent.

A quintessential summer beer.  Beer pours cloudy dark golden color with the requisite big fluffy egg white head.  The aroma is as it should be:  banana, clove, and wheat.  Flavor is right on also.  Light fruitiness, light lemon with some spice.  The mouthfeel is perfect for a summer beer.  Light, effervescent and yet still sustantial.  I will be buying many more of these throughout the hot Texas summer.
This was a great hefe. Smooth notes of wheat, banana, and barbecue. I had one bottle, but will have to get more.

One of my usuals...sweet aroma of vanilla.  Murky appearance with yeast debris..yum, but (I like the yeast so I roll the bottle around on the table).  Thick, creamy, smooth head with a great flavor with a hint of bannana and cloves.

One of the best Hefes Ive had.  Had a great head when bottle poured, very murky, with traditional wheaty/lemon aroma.  Taste is exceptional; crisp, resfreshing, dry, with no lingering bite.  Very drinkable.

Aroma is bananas, lemons and freshly baked bread. Appearance is a murky yellow with a large head. Flavor is a banana fest mixed in with some whipped cream and lemons. A somewhat crisp and dry aftertaste. If I enjoyed German Hefes Id be all about this one, but I rarely find any that impress me.  Not a fan.
Clear and yellow with the standard big poofy head.  Citrusy-yeasty nose.  Big time banana candy flavors here, with an usual spicy twist.

A cloudy yellow color withloads of action in the glass, a big foamy white head. Nice spice, banana & cotton candy aroma. Sweet wheat malt gives way to banaan flavors then lastly, a nice lemony zest. Mild cloves, not overpowering, barely noticeable. A very good, if not quite a great Hefe.

Ahh, what a refreshing beer.  No lemon please.

Wheat aroma (of course) comes through in the pour.  Further investigation brings out bubblegum and banana.  Light cottony head, great lacing.  
I didnt quite get the spice, might be my palate tonight.  

Very nice beer.
cloudy gold, fluffy white head.  aroma of wheaty malt, lemon and a bit of clove.  taste exactly as it should but just doesnt seem to have a lot of soul.  still good though.

My brother gave me a bottle, and I was happy he did.    Excellent look to this beer and surprising smooth flavor.    Lemon aftertaste makes this a solid hefeweizen.   Worth sampling at any time of the year.
yellow colored with a thick white head.  looks nice, smells lemony.  this is a pretty good weiss beer.  better than most.  i got 2 other ayingers to drink tonight. mmmm good stuff

An unclear orange beer with a fine white collapsing head. The aroma is of wheat and bananas. The flavor is sweet wheaty and fresh with notes of chewing gum. A very nice hefeweizen. Thanks to Alex (fiulijn) for bringing this to Denmark.

Bottled: Light yellow coloured. White head. Spices, yeast, banana aroma. All the wellknown hefecharacteristics, but just not strong enough for my likings. Same goes with the flavour. Yeast, wheat, spices etc. are all there, but a little too watery. Dies quickly on the palate.
Mild aroma of wheat and some banana. Thin flavour with notes of yeast and wheat. An ok wheat beer.

Sweet and spicy aroma, with hints of lemon.  Pours a golden tan, with a large white head.  Complex flavor - wheat, yeast, lemon, bananas, spices...the list goes on.  Very refreshing, one of the best Hefeweizens I have had.  Ayinger has yet to disappoint me!

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2008 bottled: this is a classic, refreshing, delicious....mmmm, mmm,mm!! weisse beer. this is what the germans do best and nobody can top them. i love this wheat nice and light with lots of flavor. hazy tan yellow with a nice white rocky head in a glass. lots of wheat and bread smell in the nose with a little tingle in the nares with a deep inhalation.  banana, spices and lemon on the palate. way smooth and easy to drink. this is probably a little lighter then some typical weisse beers but the best for hot summer days to quench that complex thirst we all have....best of the lights.
Thick, white head, cloudy gold looking beer. Sweet, wheat, yeasty aroma, nice pleasant malt notes.  Very nice full texture, fresh, true weizen set of flavours. Pleasure to drink.
All yeasty and yummy. Huge and lasting head. Very fruity and piney notes. Robust for its looks. Easy too drink for such a complex beer.

Huge snow white head of fine bubbles.  Frothery and lasts a long time.  Very plesant aroma of lemon, wheat, yeast and hay.  Color is a slightly cloudy, pale gold.  Flavor is light and crisp and very refreshing.  More lemon flavor with a hint of spices.  Not dominated but yeast which is very nice.  Finish is clean and refreshing.  A great summertime beer that is very eary drinking.
Fine wheat aroma, some good spice notes too. Hazy golden, small white head. Mild wheat flavour, small bit of clove. Light bodied, creamy. A well made beer.

Cloudy, light yellow pour, with a huge, lasting head.  Very light aroma.  Yeast, wheat, banana are evident.  Nice, creamy mouthfeel.  A bit heavy on the banana, but the vanilla adds a bit of complexity to this brew.  Excellent, smooth finish.  Extremely easy to drink.  An excellent hefe.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2013 2013-04-01. Hazy dark yellow body with a nice white head. 3+ Sweetish yeasty wheat aroma, modest esters, fruit, banana. 7+ Flavour is similar sweet fruity wheat character, mild yeast and banana eaters. 7+ Average plus bodied palate suits it. 3+ A touch mild even for a weisse, but quite enjoyable. 7/3/7/3/15+ Bottle from the LCBO, Toronto
Re-rate Unintentional re-rate, but I am glad I did. Bottle from Premier Gourmet. Slightly vigorous pour yields a massive white head on a hazy pastel golden yellow body. Yeasty, slightly citrusy bready aroma and a fair does of banana. I thought I god some bubble gum at first sniff but I couldnt find it again. Sweet, with the slightest hint of wheaty tartness, very slight citrus in the flavour. Excellent mouth feel is full bodied with the occasional lighter moments. Finish is banana with an alcoholic follow up. Very nice. 8/4/7/4/17
Pre-Ratebeer Rating Fairly clear body. Bit of light clove in the aroma. Has notes of the usual wheat beer flavours of banana and yeast but not much of either. Light, not exceptional wheat beer. 6/3/5/2/13
Cloudy yellow. White head. Yeasty banana aroma. Light, grainy feel--could be livelier. Yeasty, grainy flavour of banana, peach, wheat & cream.

Poured out of a standard Hefeweizen sized 500 ml bottle.  Aroma is very faintly banana.  Looks decent with a cloudy pale golden body, but the head is a bit too small for the style.  The head also dies out very quickly and little to no lace is observed later.  Lively carbonation and light mouthfeel.  Taste is light on the bananas and clove, and much more leaning towards lemon, orange peel, and pineapple.  Very refreshing and crisp, but lacks the creaminess of some other hefeweizen beers I have tried.

Wow--who knew that Weissbier could be this good?  The subtle hints of vanilla and citrus in the flavor and aroma lead up to a refreshing taste that all beer lovers are predestined to love.  Really.  I'm not kidding. You don't have a choice.

This honey-colored dream pours murky with a dense white frothy head that laces well and lasts.    Very yeasty in aroma and flavor.  After the doughy sweetness crosses your nose, a moderate citrus and floral scent appears.  This beer doesn't impress with sophistication - just balance.  The creamy (yet dry) and soft mouthfeel (lacking any bite) makes this soooo drinkable.  A true pleasure.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2004 This beer looks fantastic with its large foamy frothy white goodness of a head [ein sehr grosses Schaum]. The head does not remain long [dauert nicht so lange], but the flavour is so mild and pleasant and refreshing that you do not care so much. Its appearance is of a cloudy, thick, creamy opaqueness, a light golden. Ovreall, a positively delightful brew, not overpowering or offensive, but completely compliant, tasting of vanilla, bending and willing to quench your beer-thirsty desires, to satiate your ever-expanding beerthirst [Bierdurst]. This beer ranks with Oberdorfer as oen of the best Weissbiers I have had. "Even the burp tastes good. Holy crap [heilige Scheisse]."

A really nice hefe. Not the best, but better than most. A very fruity, lemon-like flavor. Lighter in flavor and mouthfeel than Schneider or Paulaner, but not the lightest. Overall, one of the better hefes out there if you find it. Quite refreshing.

This isn't amazing or nonstandard in any way.  It isn't over the top.  It isn't new.  It isn't extreme.  It's straight up hefeweizen and all that that implies.  If you don't care for weizens, this won't impress you.  If you do care for weizens, this is an excellent quaffable beer.  Ich liebe Bayern!. . . . .they know how to do weizens right.
Pale yellow, orange cloudy color.Lemony-wheat taste and the finish was dry. Very good wheat beer.

Cloudy light blond color; giant head. Strong spicy aroma, with some citrus fruits notes. Quite good malt, residual sweetness, good wheat character, spicy. Undoubtly one of the best weizen on the market.
Fairly light colored with lots of bubbles that are not felt in the mouth. Strong lemony aroma and taste. Overrides a lot of the beer. Light and refreshing with a little banana.
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2004 (Bottle)  Pours a hazy yellow with a thick frothy white head.  Refreshing citrus taste that would be great on a warm summer day.
Wonderful pale yellow, orange cloudy color.  Poured a nice fluffy head.  Very nice and citrusy.  It had a nice light, smooth mouthfeel and it was very refreshing.

Initial observation was that this beer very pale colored, unfiltered, almost milky.  Nice head that never quit.  The most striking thing about this beer was its potent aroma.  Fruity, apples, a lot of esters.  The nose didn't reflect on the taste at all.  The flavor was very dry, the champagne description hit right on the spot.  Very bubbly and effervescent mouthfeel.
Nice frothy head that lasts with a golden cloudy body. Wheat and yasty nose with sweet under tones. Sweet wheat taste hints of lemon and aftertaste is a little yeasty. Light palate that is crisp.
Draft at Ayinger Brauhaus - A somewhat overcarbonated, very typical German hefe. Fruity aroma with generous amounts of banana flavor. Great head retention.

Beautiful.  Great flowery nose with a ton of zesty yeast to balance it out.  Nice hazy off yellow color with a constant stream of tight little bubbles flowing to the underside of a rocky, thick, brilliant white head.  Snappy tart flavors jump all over your tounge immediately and turn dry and lemony finish.  Nice yeasty finish to cap it all off.  Just leaves me wanting more.
Wonderful aromas and tastes of bread, yeast, spices; a well-balanced thirst quencher.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2008 Soft cloudy yellow with a very decent.  Very mild spicy aroma of lemons and coriander... the vanilla that it describes is barely noticeable, but nice.  The spiced flavors mix well with the carbonation, and the finish is light and crisp.  A good one indeed.
Good hazy yellow color with the appropriate head for a Hefeweizen. Good nose of fruity banana and spice. Smooth and satisfying. I've never had a bad one from this brewery.

Bottle.

what's the point.  This is a to German Weisse what Bud is to American Pilsner.

This beer poured a yellow color with a nice white head and left no lacing on the glass.  Very clear with nice carbonation.  This beer represents what I think a hefeweissen should be.  Aroma is fairly normal for what you'd expect from a hefe, but a little stronger.  The flavor was very smooth and enjoyable.  Very wheaty and a bit sweet with a grainy feel.

Big head upon pouring that took time to dissolve.Nice wheat and banana taste with plenty of body.Certainly
one of the best wheat beers I have tried so far.

Nice white gold beer with a great foamy white head. Looks like a Hefeweizen should, muddy. I smell vanilla, citrus, bubble gum, banana. Nice flavor, much like a belgian white, slight citrus flavor, apple peel, leading to a very mild slightly dry finish. Quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2008 (Bottled) Opaque yellow-orange with a medium, foamy, lasting and lacy head. Fresh aroma of vanilla, dryish banana, and yeast. Some witbier character, too. Banana-fruity, dryish flavor with a strong vanilla feel and some lemony floweriness. Medium-bodied, refreshing palate with fizzy but soft carbonation. A real summer thirst quencher, somewhere between Schneider Weisse and Hoegaarden, with a twist of Liberty Ale. Should appeal to women as well. Definitely among the very best Hefeweizens out there.
(Bottled, rated 1/24/2004, was 8-4-8-4-16=4.0) Yellow, muddy color. Small, mostly diminishing, white head. Heavily yeasty aroma with vanilla, close to white wine. Sweet and acidic flavor, quite acidic finish. Medium-bodied with soft, dry and oily mouthfeel. A very enjoyable and complex weisse.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2006 Im not that big a Weisse fan and I didnt find the aroma of this stuff to appealing,but the taste was surprisingly good, banana, lemon hints and it didnt leave that oily feeling on the tongue. This one I would recommend.
Strong citrus taste, interesting color.  very crisp and refreshing. Light white head and leaves a nice lace.
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2004 Wow. Very Nice beer. Great bananna taste. Dominated by citrus. If this beer was a little bit stronger it would have been a perfect five
So far my favorite bottled hefe. Has some hints of banana and it's crisp. Good taste, refreshing.
I had this with Christmas dinner, and was impressed with the color, malt/hop/spice taste and champaign like dryness.  Highly recommended.
user_location: Lake in the Hills, Illinois, USA

text: reminds me of hefeweizen widmer brothers beer not much to say but it works i got it as a gift.it does have a tart clean crisp taste

Whoever came up with "American Style Hefe" after having one of those should be bitch-slapped. They ruined a beautiful thing.

I finally get a chance to use my glass from the Spring Beer & Wine Fest (Portland, OR)!

Pours a beeauuutiful whiteish yellow with a huge head that lasts the entire glass even while leaving behind a thick lace.

Smells strongly of clove or some other fragrant spice. Even the scent is refreshing.

Tastes of sweat spice with a hint of florals. It's very complex but I really can't pick out much else specifically.

Mouthfeel is foamy yet crisp and clean.

Drinkability is pretty good, but I gotta be honest and say that I couldn't have too many of these. It's almost over-carbonated and a tad too sweet to have more than a few.

Very tasty, and my first experience with this brewery. At only $2 a 500ml bottle, I'm heading back to try the others.

Golden hazy color with a huge frothy white head. Bountiful nose of fruits, spices and yeasty-cloves, lovely. Banana character really  shines through. The taste is creamy and refrshing. Finishes on a high note, fruity and smooth. Don't tarnish this beer by putting a lemon wedge in it. That lemon will just hide the flavors and aroma that come together. It's time to rate a classic.

Pale yellow color with lines of very fine bubbles rising to the surface.  Spectacular white rocky head.  Very strong aroma of fresh but spicy banana and orange.  Complex flavor of wheat, spicy clove and malt.  Very delicate palate at the start which comes on stronger and more noticably towards the finish.

Hazy golden color with a good creamy head and a fruity aroma, apples, oranges, a bit bready. Medium bodied and tangy with tasty wheat and citrus flavors. Spicy clove and ginger notes rounded this one out and the finish was short and on the sweet side. Another quality brew from Ayinger.
spicy aroma; pale yellow with a long-lasting head; some spiciness in the flavor, but it tastes watered-down

Ayinger always a favourite brewer of mine.
Comes in the typical Ayinger slopped 500ml brown bottle..same simple label..and painted cap.
Very nice loking beer bright yellow and hazy with a very large pure white head.
Lovelly german hefe aroma..but this has more "spiciness" than bananas..also more wheat sourness is detetcted than usual.
Tatse is very nice as expected from the aroma the banana taste is muted..but theres an attractive creamyness to the beer, slightly bitter aftertaste.
Strangelly for it having a creamy flavour the mouthfeel doesnt hold out..it becomes rather watery near the end.
Drinkable summer beer..but far from the best of the style

Cloudy golden appearance with a VERY rapidly diminishing white head.  Aroma of a hodgepodge of spices and fruits - namely bananas and oranges.  Flavor is just lacking, in my opinion - after such a strong aroma, the tastes are bland in comparison.  Lacking complexity, but nothing offensive I suppose.

Sudzy-white head atop a whitish and cloudy, yellow-orange that glows brilliantly in front of a light. Citrus and fresh yeast aromas exude in the nose. Light mouthfeel with a lively carbonation. Malts are slightly sweet, doughy and yeasty. Notes of orange, lemon, yeast, biscuit, banana, whole wheat and spices, with some sourness thrown in to round things out. Finishes on the dry side. Overall, has quite a bit of flavors and aromas going on, but none of them are very intense. Nevertheless, enjoyable.

Pours out to a nice thick off yellow color with a head that hung around.  Aroma of yeast, fresh cut wheat, and a touch of fruit.  Flavors were that of slight lemon with touch of banana and yeast.  This is what a hefeweizen should look and tast like.

Pours a hazey whiteish yellow with a real nice head and some lace.  The aroma is yeasty, wheaty, ripe bananas, and a touch of clove spice.  The flavor is clovey with a less developed banana flvavor as in others of the style.  The flavor is nice and dry and quite refreshing.  The palate is right for the flavor.  Overall, this is a very good Hefeweizen that I will seek out as a summer beer.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2004 Hazy, banana color,  soft white head, and a body that bubbles like a fish tank aerator is hidden in my glass. Aroma of citrus, kiwi, and fresh bread. Clean citrus flavors with a touch of bubble gum and butter on the tongue. A refreshing and tasty palate cleanser and pleaser. Another worthy beer from Ayinger. Great summer beer that goes well with sushi.

Pours a cloudy medium straw color, with a huge frothy white head that mostly lasts, leaving good lace on the glass.  Aroma is quite big and nice - banana, lemon, cookie dough, honey, some clove. Flavor is also quite large - sweet start with a good bit of banana and honey, some spiciness in the middle and end, and a slightly sour, acidic finish.  Medium-full bodied, but not heavy at all.  Lively carbonation.   Supremely drinkable, perfect for quaffing on a nice summer day, out on the boat fishing...and would pair equally well with said fish at the dinner table.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2003 Meringue-like head, didn't stick around terribly long, though.  It reminded me of one of those stupid snake "fireworks" you'd have as a kid in the way it solidly rose above the rim of the glass.  Spicy-citrusy aroma.  Has the color of watered-down apple cider.  The flavor starts with a citrusy malt flavor, and finishes with a dry huskiness.  What I dislike is the dry aftertaste, it doesn't seem refreshing enough for this type of beer.
Cloudy, but low head retention. Banana and clove aroma. Nice malt and good carbonation. Refresching. This one rates with the best.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Light pale cloud of whiteish yellow with a two finger high head off white tight pillowy cream, the very top much like a moonscape that settles as slowly as sand in an hour glass to a thin steady foam always present; lace is drippy. Smell has a strong sense of banana at first pour with the clove, but subsides as it sits it becomes more of a regular hefe aroma but still favorable of dullish lemon, yeasty must, and the banana and clove not so potent. Taste is mild and full of a soild hefe, good heft with a frothy bold wheat start that leads into the lemon citrus brigade, quite smooth, lightly sour, calming banana and musty yeast takes some grip as it pushes through into the finish with nice lingering clove. Feel starts easy and smooth and fills up quickly to a pretty solid fullness with a substantially lasting finish. This is one very nice hefe, quite enjoyable, refreshing and flavorful. Another one to keep around in the fridge during the summer; heck, any time will due.

A really awesome german wheat.  Grainy golden pour with a huge head.  The taste is very acidic and dry, slightly brut.  Nice hop aroma retains itself throughout and even into the aftertaste.  the mouthfeel is full and very very dry.  Extremely tasty, and something I will look forward to trying again.
Great German wheat. Great mouthfeel, complex, dry. Very good, but I'll take the Belgan wheats over this one.
Citrusy and yeasty. A Solid wheat beer. Not Ayinger's best, but good nonetheless.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2004 [on tap] Deep golden and hazy, with a tall and persistent head. Aroma is strongly yeasty, moderately citric and hoppy. There's a good malt texture here, but the beer doesn't get too sweet for this. Dry and slightly sour. Low to medium body. Moderately bitter finish. [re-rate, bottled:] The bottled version is equally great; crisp and full of taste. Better than Weihenstephaner. I'm slightly raising my rating.
This beer was quite spritzy with a light quenching acidity to it.  There was some fruitiness and it was appropriately hazy.

Great lemon-yellow color with a lots of bubbles and head.  The aroma is sweet and light with bold wheat scents and vanilla.  The flavor is lighter, and maybe even a little watery.  The finish is very smooth.  Excellent beer!

Hazy golden blond with a strong pillowy white head. Lovely yeasty and malty nose. Great stuff! Some spice and citrus hiding in the background as well. Wonderful taste! Refreshing blend of spices, citrus fruit, and yeast. Finishes very smooth. Highly recommneded!
Yeasty, malty aroma on a pale amber beer.  Citrusy, yeasty flavor, and all around a pretty good wheat beer.

Quite good it is not a stand out weiss beer but it is not a bad one either. The rating is high as I love this style of beer so even its middling offers are better to me then most. Smooth and quite nice.
Complex fruity-spicy aroma. No thick creamy head as advertised, however.  Decent taste, but not my favorite hefe.
7/15/03:  bottle.    nice, light-yellow body with a thick creamy head.  cloudy.  citrus and hops to the nose.  flavors include citrus (mainly lemon) yeast and even a tinge of sour dough.

A cloudy, pale yellow color with a thick creamy head. Some lacing. After reading the description, honey describes the color of the body perfectly.
Very spicy and yeasty aroma with a nice wheat-lemon undertone.
Delicate flavors. Wheat, lemon, pepper, and yeast. A slight fruit taste at the end. Very balanced yet subdued beer.
Carbonated like champagne and smooth. This is a beer that helps you in consuming it!

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2008 Nice carbonated feed to the head in this banana colored wheat beer.  Beautiful aroma of fresh banana breeze. but the flavor was blase--a light mixture of banana and wheat--slightly bland, and a dissapointment.
Re-rated: Golden wheat decent head. Nice whiff of yeast, banana, clove, and wheat. A good standard for the style. Body could use more effervescence. Overall 13-14.

A fairly standard hazy yellow and large white head start off this brew.  A nice nose, with strong yeast/wheat elements and some spice, as well.  Flavor is pretty mild, and it's a pretty nice, easy drinking wheat.  It does lack real depth of character, but it's still a good brew for a hot summer's day.

Had from bottle on July 7th, 2003 - Day 7 of Blake's Beer MonthThe beer poured with a hazy yellow/gold color with a nice thick head - the beer is extremely carbonated, but still an easy drink.  The aroma is of malts and spices and the German Wheat beer doesn't disappoint in the flavor department.  The malts are evident with a slight bit o' hops and a good citrusy (lemon) flavor.  An enjoyable beer - easy to drink - nice for a hot day like today.

(o,5 ltr Bottle) Cloudy, straw body with a thin white head. There are some great Ayingers out there but this isn't one of them - this is average at best. Yes, bananas et al but not of the true complexity I am accustom from this brewery...

UPDATED: APR 3, 2008 Very hazy yellow-straw pour with a tall, creamy, white head.  Big nose of bananas and cloves.  Light pepper in the background.  Rich bready aromatics along with honey and vanilla.  Sweet bread and bananas on the tongue; spicy and peppery towards the finish ending with a drying herbal aftertaste and a touch of vanilla.  Creamy but dry body with champagne carbonation.  Not quite as spectacular as I remember, but still very good and refreshing.  Overall score went from 17 to 15.

50cl bottle, bbe 10.08.

Hazy yellow in color with a fizzy, frothy white head.  Extremely carbonated.  Smells of moderate malt (sweet bread) light hops (flowers, lemons) and light yeast (dough).  Also a hint of bananas.  Moderately sweet, moderately acidic, and lightly bitter throughout with an average finish.  Med-light watery feel.  Very refreshing brew and one of the tastier wheats Ive had.  Less overpowering bananas than Hoegaarden.

Everytime i see an Ayinger i can only think of,what a shame it is to tear that bottle cap off.It is by far the most artfull bottle cap i have encountered yet from any beer.Anyway here we go Cloudy straw color,small white head that faded quite quickly leaving a slight lacing on the sides.Malty sweet aroma with a mild yeastiness and a strong lemon grass smell.Mild to light medium spice as well.Sweet taste with a mild malt presence,mildly spice and very fruity  with the fruit being in the lemon grass arena,with maybe some hints of banana,fairly strong carbonation,the after taste is mildly hoppy but definatley has a decent lemon tone to it with a little spice coming through at the tail end.A very nice brew thanks to Wawood for this one as well.
Puors cloudy yellow, witha big white head. smells of citrus. flavors of vanilla, ginger, banana, and lemon. Finishes smoooooooth and mellow.

Lt gold color. Large head. Aroma is malty and fruity. A light bodied Hefe-Weizen. Malts are fruity, banana, cloves and peaches. Smooth and creamy. A really nice mouthfeel, the rest of the beer is kind of ordinary. Light and refreshing, but very drinkable. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Draught:  The beer pours a hazy, golden color.  Fairly decent head.  The aroma is somewhat fruity: definitely citrus and mainly lemon.  Fairly decent body.  Good wheat taste, with some citrus taste also.  VERY GOOD!
I'm not a big fan of wheats but this one is pretty good.Cloudy yellow color.Lemon aroma.Taste has a bit of bannana in it with the obvious wheat flavor.  Nice sweet finish

Cloudy yellow body, a fair amount of carbonation with a lot of frothy lace. Lemony yeast aroma. The flavor is lemon and wheat blended well with the somewhat sweet malt. The taste is light and the finish dry. Im not a huge fan of wheats but the light flavor of this one is very good.
Lemony spicy aroma with a pale straw yeasty appearance.  Effervescence lifts the bitterness and soft wheat body smack into yer pallete.
Pale standard German wheat beer appearance, with a slightly citric bitter aroma. Bitter and slightly orange juice flavour.  Overall a very pleasant beer.
Bottled(500ml). -nice german wheat beer, cloudly honey-yellow colored, fruity-spicy nose, great rich lasting head

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2004 Milky white and a nice head. Thinner body than a few other hefeweizens, but more than satisfactory. Citrus, wheat bread, cloves, and yeast flavors in the beer are also noticeable in the aroma as well. Not as "wheaty" on the aftertaste, which I actually prefer (but by no means is this beer flat either). My favorite German Wheat beer in the world. Prost!
I'm very impressed with this beer. The color is a little light, but the flavor makes up for that.

Pale yellow and murky, big white head. Not much in the aroma. Pretty standard hefeweizen, citrus/yeast/banana flavor, sharp acidic and a lot of carbonation. Little sweet at first, dry finish. Not bad, little thin and lacking in flavor, but not bad.
Murky pale yellow color with a massive white head. The aroma and flavor were typical clove/banana/ bready tones. Nice average wheat beer.

I was not impressed by this beer. The taste was pretty bold but the aftertaste was rather foul. The aroma mimicked the aftertaste. There's a decent amount of flavor when you first taste it but once that foul taste kicks in it ruins it.

Sweet and wheaty aroma. Slightly bitter with touch of citrus rind. Light cloudy amber beer. Huge frothy white lacing head. Medium heavy carbonation and light body. Light and refreshing in taste. Wheaty with light citrus notes. Bubblegum and alcohol. Clean sweet finish and after. This is a nice wheat, though less substance in body compared to Paulaner, Franziskaner, etc.  Quite good.

(Bottle). Cloudy light golden colour, large head. Typical hefe aroma (which is good), cloves, flowers and some citrus. Light bodied, typical hefe flavour but there's just too little of it, thin mouthfeel. Finish / aftertaste is definitely too thin / weak. The Ur-Weisse is a better choice.

This is a really nice Weizen. It has a beautiful golden cloudy body and a snow-white head on top. Nice wheat malt flavor and one of my favorite overall Weiss/Weizens. I am constantly impressed by the abundance of great beers coming from Germany and especially the Weizens. This one ranks with Paulaner and Schneider. You won't be dissapointed.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: As strong as I tried to be there is no way to ignore the comments of my beer drinking companion that kept repeatedly saying "this is good. This is SO good. This is good". While may not be ALL THAT, it is indeed good and in possession of those Bavarian weiss traits - clove, banana esthers. Also helped that somehow it seemed fresh. Big thumbs up.
Nice wheat beer.  Fruity, banana, and vanilla flavor. Finishes dry, clean and crisp.
SOLID wheat beer, very good, refreshing wheat.  Very impressed, but still prefer Paulaner.

Cloudy yellow wheat beer with lacy white head.  Thin in the mouth, light, and spicy.  Little fruit or banana in this wheat beer; rather, it has the characteristic spiciness, with lots of pepper and clove.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2003 I had my first Ayinger this evening; it was exceptionally good. It contained a good deal of sediment in the bottle, which made for a cloudy straw color when poured. Fairly strong wheat aroma and taste.---Rerate 6/20/03--- I have picked up upon a creamy, oily palate, as well as a banana, and vanilla aroma. Quite nice overall, this is one of the better wheat beers that I have indulged in thus far.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2004 Gold and cloudy.  Thick white head that stays until the end.  Scent of grapefruit.  Very strong taste of  wheat with some citrus.  Thick and full bodied.
Bottle.  A hazy golden orange color with a foamy white head and lots of rising bubbles.  A spicy vanilla and citrus aroma with a wheat vanilla flavor.

Light nose - not much there, cloudy khaki color, big bubble head. Nice hefe flavors with untertones of oranges and other citrusy things. Little vanilla too. No bitter at all. Creamy mouth feel, meaty and smooth. Maybe too sweet, but I don't care - I liked this.
Oranges, lemon, vanilla and yeast nose. Cloudy orange color´, little head, liveley carbonation. Ripe banana taste, interesting, refreshing, but more like a juice. A bit to sweet for me.

I had my bottle poured over a lemon wedge in a Weissbier glass and it was heaven.  The lemon smell with the smooth texture or the beer my it a very pleasurable experience.  Only now after reading the description I wished I saved some to drink without the lemon to enjoy all the beermakers efforts with this brew.  Next time.

This is certainly a high-quality german-style wheat. Refreshing, for sure. Nice golden color. Well balanced malt and hops. A bit of a champagne like quality complimented by fine streams of carbonation. Dry finish is too short and somehow feels a bit hollow. There's not much bad to say about this beer. Not the most exciting thing in the world but well executed.

Great semi-opaque colour, slightly orange, slightly yellow. Some lemony smell, also a noticable 'pear' smell. Definate wheaty characteristics on the smell and appearance. A good taste, but somewhat strong initially. The flavour subsides and you are left with a smooth wheaty taste. Not my favourite wheat, but not bad at all.
This could be called the ideal wheat beer.  In a tall glass with Lemon, no aftertaste just good beer.

Cloudy yellow colour, with a big head (not really persistent, actually). The taste is spicy and yeasty, quite delicate. Surprisingly the aftertaste is fruity, with traces of banana, lemon and orange. A really particular and interesting Wheat beer.
Vigorous white head. Yeasty aroma. Slightly cloudy pale gold color. Hint of banana.   A dry finish. If you like weissbier you should love this; it just isn't my favorite style.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2003
Very nice aroma.  Has a lot of clove but not much banana.  Well balanced.  High quality.  Slightly sweet.  Sweeter than Franziskaner.  Light in color

with some wheats the better quality ones can be the least interesting to drink. this is quite delicate. plenty of vanilla in the aroma with a taste of some chicken stock, helles bier and a riesling aftertaste
Big Banana.  This is an incredible wheat, no so sharp and dry but with a nice syrupy banana taste.  very sweet and nice.  hold this up as one of the finner beers of the style.
Pale, straw-yellow colour.  Stale, bready, yeasty, slightly candyish aroma.  Mellow banana flavour.  A little spritzy.  A classic German weiss.
Not as good as I had hoped.  DrunkAsASkunk has the description on this one down perfect.  Not a bad beer by any means, but nothing special.

An interesting smack of aroma right from the start....lemons, yeast, fruit, something barnyard-like...id call it hay, sweetness but not maltiness...and that ever apparent wheat smell..pretty complex and intriguing. The pour begins a golden colour, but this is very short lived...for within lies the secret of the little floatie yeasties!!! The danced perilously around my glass, clouding up all i could possibly see and creating an impenetrable gob of golden cloudiness. A head stood above this cloud practically 3 inches high!!!! Foamy, with mild creaminess it stood there like a champion throughout the majority of my enjoyment. The taste begins with a wheaty, yeasty, and spicey smack in the middle of the tongue. Very little sweetness here so the mid portion of your tongue is in for quite an awakening. The finish is interesting, with various fruits becoming apparent which were hidden nicely in the aroma. I catch something orangey, some banana, citrus, and peach-like, and grapefruit (which could be incorporated into the citrus-like category). It ends mildly dry, but not too dry. Probably my only knock here is the carbonation. Its mildly apparent in the pour that this is going to be filled with little bubbles...but the carbonation is a very huge deal here on the way down and inhibits drinkability just enough for a few marks downward on the scale. Those yeast floaties make all the difference in the taste, go grab yourself a bottle and youll be satisfied. Ill grab one if i see it again.
Pours out to a cloudy gold in the glass.  Aroma is that of banana and yeast.  Taste is that of banana, cloves and nutmeg.  A very nice hefe.  Highly drinkable.

Another good German wheat beer. Pours a cloudy, pale yellow color with a big, lingering white head. Leaves good lacing down the sides of the glass. Nice yeasty, fruity, wheat aroma. Medium bodied with a perfect amount of malty sweetness balanced with spiciness. Very smooth and delicious, one of the best wheat beers.
Light golden color with a typical tall slightly off white head.  Light banana, clove and vanilla aromas.  Fruity and dry all in one.  In the top five in my hefe list.
A great wheat beer.  Nice citrus aroma and fruity taste.
Very nice wheat.  Tremendously cloudy with a light head and citrus smells.  Sour yeast dominates more citrus flavors and a nice grassy taste.
One of the better wheat beers Ive had recently

Delicate head with sweet ethereal aroma of cloves.  Very light hazy, golden color.  Light body.  Good mouthfeel.  Fruity wheat taste.  Sweet finish.  I have mentioned this yet in my ratings of other Ayinger beers, but I like the bottle cap artwork.
Perfect for the Bavarian Tradition of "Frühschoppen". Goes well together with Weisswurst and Brezn. Fresh and inspiring

Big white head.  Pale in complexion. Light fruit aromas.  Complex, bananas, vanilla, dry and acidic, light to medium bodied, light dry hop finish, lingering fruitiness.  Decent and definately quaffable, I feel its a classic weiss.
My favorite German Wheat beer.  The best !
Cloudy and golden like a wheat beer should be with a large white puffy head.  Lots of banana and clove aroma as well as flavor.  The body has a nice balance of malt and goes down pretty smoothly.
(OCBP) Bier Prost tasting , nice wheat,acidic,yeaty, notable choice.

Probably an old bottle that had also been frozen once or twice in the cooler at Buffalo Wild Wings in Noerthwest,IN.  They arent the beer geeks that the staff in INdy are!!!  Big lemony nose, but head wasnt all that big. Some acidic zestiness (almost soapy) hides behind the big lemon/wheat flavor.  Im sure this is much better fresh, and correctly poured from a tapper!
Hazy lemon color.  Thick head quickly disappears.  Pretty much a standard German wheat beer, but with some tart/acidic tones.  Fairly interesting.

This is your typical wheat beer.  A cloudy light brown/tan color with a spicy smell.  Taste is of wheat and light spice with an extremly full smooth wheaty finish.  Overall, it is a typical wheat beer.

its true to the style, sure, but the chalky yellow pour isnt attractive to me: looks like the glass was lined with vaseline, or a water sample from a cairo subway. the head gave it a fluffy white bib, but the foams half-life was about 11 seconds, so pretty soon it was just me and this murky and malarial looking fluid. fortunately, the aroma has only pleasant things qualifying for apt comparison, say, for example clove studded apple strudel, danish butter cookies drizzled with bottled lemon juice. frenetic carbonation scrubs each taste-bud up and down like grannys takin em to church. then a tart yeasty lemon bath washes away any trace of whatever you had for dinner. great breath freshener:gone are garlic and cigar breath. quality product, but too much dry citrus for me.
Clove and floral aromas figure big in this one.  The head is huge and the color alluring.  Some samples had pronounced fruit--apples, banana and a little citrus.  This was great with Sunday brunch.

Cloudy yellowish-golden hue.  This wheat smells terrific.  The typical banana and clove scent is there but there is also somewhat of an apple cider spiciness that gives this hefe great character.  Taste is wonderful as well with a very fruity presence.  This is one smooth German Wheat beer.  Simply delicious.
A nice Weisse. Huge head took up most of my mug. Took several minutes to go down. Mine had a pale yellow color to it. A nice subtle banana flavor. Very good.

A fantastic Chilled Hazed, Golden-Orange color, the head is a Whopper, white in color and the lace is significant. Nose is a tad yeasty, earthy if you prefer, citrus, malt and quite clean. Front is malt, the top light, the finish is acidic, dry, lightly hopped and a passable Beer, but nothing to YELL ABOUT. Ranks #565 on my current 1000 beer master list.

Pours a gold with slight reddish hint. White head with moderately large bubbles. Nose is very clovey, perhaps the most clove smell of any of the hefes Ive tried. Taste is nice wheaty malt, perhaps a little less ester flavor than Id prefer but still present.
Overall a good Weisse. The yeast provides an extraordinary banana aroma and taste. Great for those evenings after a hard days work!
Amazing. Bananas in the mouth and wheat and bitterness going down. Only complaint is that its got a high carbonation that impinges on the taste developing more.
Description of aroma is accurate, vanilla and citrus. Good flavor, just lacking a little bit, cant put my finger on it. Overall very enjoyable, and quite sweet. Awesome bottlecaps.

Interesting foggy honey color with great head and lace. Citrusy/banana smell with a definite hint of flowers. I may tend to agree with the lemon and vanilla description. Rather thin and mild yet there is a complex maltiness that tickles the palate. I think this may be a bit overrated, as it seems a bit watered down for a good wheat, but its pleasantly refreshing....did I mention how cool the bottle caps are?

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2011 Frugal lemons and wheat ride refreshing effervescenceAdmirable balance of banana esters and clove-y phenols...Excellent, refreshing weizen, from the bottle and on tap at the Ayinger Speis und Trank in Munich
Aroma of produce fruit stand - very fresh. Just cloudy enough but not so that you cant see the ever flowing bubbles.  Smooth, clean refresing taste with a hint of citrus.
A good wheat beer.  golden color and a full head.  Slightly sweet flavor with a hint of citrus.

Didnt get the big head on this one. Odd color, almost beige, cloudy. Nice refreshing grassy, flowery aroma. Tastes very clean with a touch of citrus-spice but mostly a very clean sweet-tart pure taste that is very refreshing w/o the overly spicy elements of some wheat beers. Great warm weather beer.
Cloudy gold pour nice head that sticks around as a thin lace. Aroma is citrusy and spicy. Nice palate, not to thin with enough carbonation to tingle the tongue. Nice tart finish.
Refreshing white.
UPDATED: AUG 17, 2003 After having tasted all those delicious German wheats, this Ayinger fit in nicely. Delicious aroma of the fine hefe, thirst-quenching palate.

Pale and foggy, downright beautiful creamy and long-lasting head.  I seven-minute poured it as best I could and was very happy with the results.  Oh, onto the beer.  Floral bouquet, extremely crisp and refreshing mouthfeel, nice banana-clove things going on.  Also hints of citrus, maybe pears.  Clean finish.  One of the more complex and flavorful hefes Ive ever had.
Lots of fruit in this beer with bannana being the predominate flavor.  Hint of vanilla and heavy carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2003 Light, murky yellow brew with a huge, rocky/creamy white head. Mostly lasting with virtually no lacing.
The aroma is yeasty and spicy with notes of bread, citrus fruit, banana, allspice and dried apricot.
The flavor is lightly malty, lightly yeasty and very well-balanced.
A bit thin and flavorless overall, but there are nice notes of citrus fruit and clove.
Light-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Short, clean, dry finish with a hint of damp straw to close things out.
Good Summer brew, but I expected more from the master race!
Very nice but a bit too carbonated. A little light for the style but very refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2003 This is one of my favorite beers. It is very smooth with little after-taste. (some guys may not like that) It tastes like carmel, malt, and champagne with a rich, creamy, thick head that looks and tastes very unique.
If you like German wheat beers that are creamy and sweet you must sample this beer. I still prefer Ayinger's Ur-weisse beer over this one

Hazy lemon gold, excellent rocky head with lots of lace. Sweet banana and clove aromas that carry through into the mouth with a lemon citrus hint and a sweet chalky finish and yeasty burps. Almost as good as weihenstephan, and thats damn good.
Nice cloudy yellow, dry refreshing yeast flavor.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2003 Good, but not the best.  A tad too fizzy.  No wait, it's WAY too fizzy!  Mild flavor.

Pretty golden wheat color. Good head, though it doesnt last long. Interesting tart fruity taste that balances out as the beer warms up. Not really my thing (I favor dark beers), but I dont dislike it. Id certainly drink it happily if none of my favorites were available.
One of my favorites and a good rival of Schneiderweisse.  Typical hefeweizen characteristics and a very smooth mouthfeel.  Enjoyable!
Light orange and a good head. Yeastaroma, else pretty standard.
A well controlled weissbier with a rather plain taste. There is some wood in the aroma. Cool and refreshing. A beer you can easily drink a couple off.
Hazy honey colour with a large white lasting head. Some wood and fruit and malty wheat aromas. Medium to full bodied. Well balanced including a touch of sour and a very crisp clean dry finish.
Good hefe -- serving up a clean dose of banana, wheat, and cloves.  sweet up front with a hint of sourness at the back.  starts off with a big head with staying power.

Big head that goes quickly.  Cloudy gold color.  Pungent, malty aroma with some over-ripe lemon in the background.  Flavor is clean, crisp, and pungent.  Its refreshing, but still rich.  Theres a solidness to it that hefeweizens sometimes lack in their effort to be light.  Good beer.
I enjoy this beer, and the best term I can use to describle the aftertaste is caremely. It is good, but be warned of the sourish aftertaste. Definately an aquired taste
Really good, a little sour.
This might be my favoirite wheat beer so far.  Nice and refreshing and a wonderful finish.
This is an outstanding beer.  has a clean dry after taste and is very refreshing after a hard day of working in the heat
Not particularly blown away by the lack of fruitiness in this one.  Finish has lots of spice, but this is more Belgian wit than German hefe.

Cloudy dark straw with some yeast chunks. Whipped cream white head. Heavy rushing carbonation. Aroma of zesty lemons, musty yeast and cloves. Crisp and tart with a luscious wheat flavor. Medium light body. Banana/clove flavors and a lemony zip. Head remains thick and sticky. Gets tarter and thinner as it sits. Less Weizen and more Wit like. Finishes thinner with a surge of light clove flavor. A refreshing but pricey Helles Hefe. Good choice if you just want one.
Spicy and flavorful. A well-crafter wheat. A little thin with a bitter aftertase typical in a German wheat.

Fairly dry for a wheat beer, although not the brut that the commercial description claims. Lingering spice, although, as Volgon says, too thin in the finish. Stick with the Ayinger Ur-Weisse if you crave wheat beer from Aying.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2003 Very impressive. Solid bodied with an excellent light flavor. They know how to make a good german wheat beer over there at ayinger.
Large white fizzy head, acidic and slight banana nose. Mild fruity taste,  that ends too thin.
I guess I just dont like wheat beers.

Deep golden color, hazy but not quite cloudy, good initial head that dissipates quickly, lasting carbonation. aroma is spice/banana. Flavor retains the spice and banana notes, and adds citrus, more tart than bitter. Very good overall for a wheat beer.

Probably the best hefe I have had.  The tartness gives it something more than Paulaner or Pyramid.  Enormous head!  Huge!  Nice cloudy gold with yeast floating within.  Went down smooth with lots of sweetness turning to tartness in the end.  Good work Ayinger!  You make good stuff.
big head.  fruity tartness.  kind of spicy at the end

Im just beginning my exposure to wheats. My only previous experience, before my palate was ready, was Bells Oberon. I really disliked it. Then Aventinus, which I liked. Now, I can handle this, I think, and I think it is good.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Very nice hefe.  Pale yellow-gold color with huge overflowing head.  At first its refreshing and zesty with a bit of clove and banana, but after getting to the bottom (its a big bottle, doesnt all fit in the glass in 1 pour) and getting some of the yeast in, it takes on a nice tartness that adds complexity without covering the clove and banana notes.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy light to medium yellow, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain/bread), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana taffy and bubble gum, light note of clove.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Hopefully fresh-ish bottle (based on the new, squatter bottles -- like what Schlenkerla uses).  Lots of banana-gum, not phenolic enough.  Bit too sweet.  Overall decent but kinda simple and overly estery.
This is everything I ask for in a wheat beer.  Clean, with zesty citrusy yeast characteristics and extremely refreshing.
Perhaps the best Weiss Ive had.  A perfect balance of tartness and wheat flavor, absolutely superb with food and packs a decent punch too.

One of my absolute favorites.  The aroma is fruity, yeasty, mostly banana and some spice.  The color is pale yellow or golden, semi-opaque.  The taste is complex, with notes of the same fruit, nuts, and spices.  There is a slight tang or sourness to it as well, but nothing bad at all.  From start to finish, it goes down smoothly.  The one tiny flaw is that I do wish it were a bit heavier on the palate, or maybe have a little longer-lasting finish, but overall this is my favorite German wheat.
Great German Wheat beer one of the Best!!!!
Very nice, smooth, fruity and wheaty, nothing to much wrong with it, great on tap too.

Gargantuan rocky white head atop a cloudy, light golden body.  Typical apple-banana and cloves aroma, although the earthy graininess often associated with this style is not so prevalent.  Smooth and tasty, the well-rounded citric, banana-walnut flavor is complemented by a rich maltiness.  Lacking the depth of some better wheats beers, the finish is quick, tart and mildy sweet.

Very large, white, artificial-looking head. Light cloudy yellow body. The aroma killed me, it was way too sweet and flowery. Light citric and fruit flavored body was overall very pleasant, but I just couldnt get past the smell.

Gold amber beer with tall head that turns to carpeting foam.  Nice aroma, tart and yeasty-weisse without the funk that accompanies many weisses. Very smooth flavor, pineapple-y but not too tart.  Very good palate, not too thick with good carbonation.

Another superb Ayinger product! Definitely one of the best Weisse beers available. Has all the classic aromatic qualities of a great Bavarian Weisse, but also has a fairly hefty body; thick and creamy (I cant describe that as well as de_la_cerveza does in her rating!) Anyway, findit, drink it and enjoy it!
This is an outstanding brew!  It definately lives up to the Ayinger reputation for great beers.

mmmm...good.

3 words for ya: HEAD, BANANA, THICK

ok, that sounds kind of kinky, but im serious!!!

this was another beer that shows why german wheats are so much more superior to american microbrewed wheats. (other than north coasts pranqster which is right up there)
Super smooth with a great fruity, sweet flavor.
Light and refreshing; perfect for a hot summer day. Mild lemon flavor that doesnt obtrude. Worth the two bucks even if you dont usually go for this style.

I rarely would call a beer too smooth but that is the only fault I can find with this wonderful hefe.  Big, big nose of cardamom, cloves, lemon fits perfectly with a great-looking glass of slightly cloudy, huge-headed (meringue-like), lemon-wheat ambrosia.  Perhaps it could use just a bit more hops, and it might be a bit thick for a hefe; but these are quibbles-after youve had Paulaner and Hoegaarden, make this your next wheat/white stop.

Big creamy hefe head, cloudy, yellow, with and aroma of cloves and subtle banana. Very rick, creamy and smooth, excellent body and mouthfeel, lots of carbonation. Mild banana,wheat and cloves in the palate, the thing that sets this aside from other wheats is that this beer finishes thick, not thin and water like others, its very good!
This is probably the best hefe that I have ever had. Very nice body that lasts through the whole glass. Sweetness will arise about half way through with just a touch of citrus.
Okay weisse beer.  More dominant clove than most weisses, perhaps appropriate to the style (Bavarian)?  Mild fruity esthers like apple and banana creep up here and there.
Remarkably satisfying wheat beer, a benchmark for the style. I cant add much to what other raters have said so well, but you should definitely familiarize yourself with this Brau-Weisse.

This beer looked great: nifty bottlecap gave way to let me pour a nice cloudy brew with an amazing head. But the nose was pure banana, and the flavor a bit thin. Not really much spiciness there, just a bit of a dry sweet malty taste. Im thinking this one had spent a bit too much time on the shelf.
Smooth, creamy, tasty wheat.  Nice palate.  A rather elegant beer.

I found this to have a somewhat different flavor than some other top notch hefes.  The flavor profile seems to be dominated by grapefruit citrus flavors, but lacks some of the mild spiciness in other hefes.  The aroma profile is exactly what youd expect from a top notch hefe and it had a good, thick head which stuck around almost to the last sip.  Wonderful cloudy deep straw color.  I greatly enjoyed this beer, and I am not a big fan of the style.
UPDATED: APR 26, 2005 Lively gold.  Aroma is sweaty, with hints of clove and banana.  The palate is fairly sweet, with hints of plastic amid the standard dusty yeast notes and banana.
UPDATED: MAY 30, 2010 Re-rate.  Poured from bottle. Nice lemon meringue aroma.  Opaque gold, white head.  Creamy with citrus pepper and spice.  Still a great one.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: It is murder trying to decide which German brewerys hefe is the best.  Weihenstephan, Scheiner Weisse, Franziskaner, Paulaner, Ayinger: they all put out top-notch wheat beers.  This one is a little lighter than its brethren, and maybe a little more citric in taste.  It is, of course, very quenching and extremely refreshing.  A cold one of these on a summer afternoon would not go amiss.

One of the top aromas in Hefes.  The head was a lot thinner than Ive come to expect per style, and the appearence suffered a bit because the yeast did not dissipate as evenly as it should have (tended to clump up).  Make no mistake about the flavor though, this is a top notch Hefe.  Wheaty, fruity, and refreshing.  Highly recommended.

This is up there for wheat beers.  That unmistakeable Weihenstephaner aroma and spiciness.  Seemed to have a little more body than Weihenstephaner and a little more flavor overall.  Still does not beat Allagash White, but something any serious wheat beer drinker should not pass up.

Oh yum!  The brewerys comparison 
to champagne is well-deserved.

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2014 from Bier-Bienne - cloudy dark orange-blond beer with no head retention; the aroma of cloves dominates; hints of ripe banana below; fizzy and quite full-bodied, some sweetness lasting in the finish; the notes of ripe bananas take control of the aftertaste
